Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Gannon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short stay in the Trump Hotel - Chicago and the experience was excellent. The staff cannot do enough for you - all you need to do is ask. The health club and pool are fantastic with views across the city and river. Everything you need to ensure you leave the hotel feeling, looking and smelling great are provided. Our room was (20th floor) over looking the city and watching the sun rise was just as brilliant as seeing all the lights start to twinkle during the evening (electric drapes!). The bathroom weighing scales kept me informed of my daily weight gain! the lighting was great for makeup/contant lens and the towels, robes, slippers and toiletries all added to the feeling of luxury. If you don't fancy going out, the kitchenette was equiped with everything you need. And every appliance/tool looked brand new from the kitchen utensils to the hairdryer. The 16th floor terrace area is still closed being out of season, as the weather was unseasonably hot last week, being out there would have been an experience. The hotels location is right on the river and being so tall you never get lost or need the full address for taxis - as we found out when we left the airport and my husband asked me what the address was (I didn't have it!). Overall the hotel facilities and staff are excellent - I would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “If "Go Big or Go Home" is your Motto. .Then.. The Donald is 4 You!”
Reviews.Author: Mtnbrookie
Reviews.Content: I have not had an opportunity to even leave, but felt compelled to post this review. I am still staying at the hotel, here with my family (to young girls under the age of 10) for a mini spring break trip. We have a two room suite, with a pull out queen size bed in the living room, 2 bathrooms and a fully stocked kitchen. (kids have a bed, and parents have a separate room.) While a treat, it is worth the investment. We have stayed at Ritz Carlton in the past with kids in different cities. . But the Donald does it better. Upon check in, the kids were immediately greeted with cotton candy (bell man asked for permission) and matching pink Trump Tower hats. In the rooms, the kids were provided "Trump Kids" robes and slippers. They were left personalized notes as well. Upon returning to the room from dinner the first night, the hotel had left two candy trays with names written in chocolate. For a hotel with a hoity toity reputation if by price alone, they have gone beyond the call of duty to make them feel welcomed. My wife is at the spa; and I am confident her experience is great. I will not suggest that the Trump experience is for the weak of heart for your wallet, but if you want to create a memorable, relaxing and comfortable experience (which is not easy when traveling with kids) I highly recommend the Trump. I know my wife is already scheduling her next girl's trip to the hotel, and my kids will always ask with any future trips whether we are staying at the Trump Towers. As I have not seen a normal room, i do not feel comfortable addressing the accommodations specifically. But the hotel is beautiful, the staff warm (the bell man upon my families return from American Girl responded "That is not bad, it only took you five hours!") and the views and location are hard to beat..

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional St. Patrick's Day stay!”
Reviews.Author: A M
Reviews.Content: Our family decided to have a stay-cation in downtown Chicago over the St. Patrick's Day weekend. Keep in mind that we already had several things going against a relaxing weekend...our two-year old son, the unusual warm weather in Chicago this past weekend (large crowds of people everywhere), and the drunken debauchery that one would expect during such a celebration. We arrived at the hotel at about 10am, expecting simply to park at the hotel and then return later in order to check in at 3pm. As soon as we told the valet attendants that we would be checking to the hotel, they immediately helped to get us situated with our luggage. When we checked in, we decided to upgrade from our deluxe room to the executive suite on the 25th floor--this was a great choice. The best thing about it was that we could check in right away...we didn't have to wait! We had the city, lake and river view. We were also at eye-level with the clock atop the Wrigley building...not to mention the fact that we watched as the boat crews were coloring the river green! We had the best view from our room! The room was great...it was decorated nicely, the bed was comfortable, the kitchen area had everything we needed, including a refrigerator that was large and an ice-box with an ice-maker. I will agree with other reviews that it is a little odd that the bathroom door does not close all the way...it leaves about an inch and a half gap due to the placement of the door. We overlooked that feature quickly and were able to enjoy all of the other great features of the room...primarily the floor to ceiling windows...that in and of itself entertained our two year old to no end...it was great. Aside from the amenities (pool area and exercise rooms are nice and complementary to all guests)...what was most important to us were the noise level at night and the staff. It was important that our son could sleep at night without being disturbed...we didn't hear a sound ...it was great! Also, the great, friendly staff made our stay absolutely enjoyable. Anything that we requested or inquired about was immediately addressed. This hotel is probably one of the nicest we have stayed at, and the staff was the most professional and courteous that we have experienced. Also, as far as hotel food is concerned, we ate at the hotel's restaurant twice...it is pricey, but the quality was exquisite. No complaints on any of it... All and all, if you can afford it, I would highly recommend dishing out the money for this hotel. We had a lovely time and will certainly choose the Trump hotels in Chicago and other cities as well.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: 3ddesigns
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump for 3 nights in early March. There was an online special for rooms at 30% off. The hotel is worth its weight in gold. From start to finish with the front desk check in personel, the concierge advise and efficiency, the beautiful well appointed rooms, there is no doubt this hotel is a well oiled machine. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in at any 5 star hotel. When we arrived home I noticed that I had left my iphone charger in the room. I called security, they located the charger and immediately sent it with no charge. This is why we will return to this hotel every time we visit Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: DarlingNik
Reviews.Content: Thee absolute BEST hotel I've ever stayed in! Catered wonderfully to kids, any concerns I had and really went above and beyond! It's the Disney World of Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday & Spa Weekend”
Reviews.Author: MR t
Reviews.Content: The Trump provided professional car service from the airport. The room was very clean, very big and beautiful. We over looked the river and the city. The Sunday brunch at SIXTEEN was elegant and delicious. After brunch we relaxed by the pool and read the Sunday paper. We will return to The Trump.

Reviews.Title: “Great "Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: ruralgourmet
Reviews.Content: It was very nice. The girls and I (two 16 year oldâ€™s) booked this hotel in early January for a train trip to Chicago while the boys in the family went to Florida to watch spring training baseball. The service was great, front desk, bellman, spa attendants, attache service, house keeping, maintenance (TV issues) were all impeccable. The room felt spacious and rich. Oh, the bed I could live in forever. The restaurant recommended for dinner was perfect. The arriving chocolates were some of the best I've enjoyed. There were little cakes when they turned the room down for the girls, in celebration of their recent birthdays. Housekeeping was invisible, which means they did an excellent job. I cannot make a single complaint about the property. OK, two small things, the bathroom frosted sliding door did not close completely (room 2216 in case your interested, Donald) we had all girls, not an issue. Second room service forgot the Chantilly cream for the Wimbledon fruit bowl and the syrup for the french toast. A quick call and all fixed. Away from the property review the other guests were rude and we felt like country bumpkins. A polite hello on the elevator was met with...........nothing. I know a lot of foreign guests stay at this hotel and may not understand, not the case here. Most of the rudeness came from guests/residents that were black clad from head to pointy toe, honest to goodness english speaking folks. They spoke, just not to us, in response to a spoken courtesy. We got glances that were not kind. The girls were in the dark, except during one of their trips to the spa. That was when I felt bad for choosing this hotel. I chose this hotel, like we chose Chicago. We spent a long weekend, Friday through Monday, spent 1000's of dollars in your city. The Trump Towers courted us with a reduced booking reservation. If these are the world travelers that stay at fancy hotels I'll stay at the hotel that gives you a card for a free drink and chips and salsa next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best in the City”
Reviews.Author: Martin E
Reviews.Content: I took my wife into the city for her birthday and e stayed at the Trump. We have stayed at RThe Peninsula, Four Season, Park Hyatt and while they were all nice, none had the feel and the service of the Trump Hotel. From the minute we walked in and got a great upgrade at no charge throught the ammenities of the hotel and service, it was a wonderful experience. This will be our destination in the city for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “wil go back again - over and over”
Reviews.Author: t-montreal
Reviews.Content: Over the years, my husband and I have stayed at many different hotels in Chicago but the Trump is the one we just keep wanting to go back to. Even the Peninsula didn't change our minds... The service is professional and courteous and friendly. The rooms are spotless and spacious. Room service food is excellent - pricey, yes, but really good. The pool is my favourite feature -it's a beautiful space. The Spa is worth a visit, or two, or three... location is central to everything and an easy walk down to Millenium Park. What else can I say?...I just don't want to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Bardf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trump for three nights, and had a wonderful time. The staff gave 110% attentive and smiling service everyday. Our concierge, Gwen, was fabolous.Extremly sweet, attentive and effective. Our room was stylish, big and modern. The bathroom was clean and beautiful. TV integrated in the mirror, cool. A small state of the art-kitchen. A gift on our bed when we arrived, and always new bottles with water everyday. These guys always gave the little extra. The breakfast at Sixteen was very good. Had also some wonderful cocktails at Rebar. Nice health club and pool also. Overall a fantastic experience, and big cheers to a extremly good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Trump knows his stuff!”
Reviews.Author: pickatripagain
Reviews.Content: Went to Chi town for a business meeting, and felt like we had won the lottery in this hotel. Stayed on the spa floor- had the best view of downtown, the river to the lake from this tower room, It was on the curve of the hotwl, so we had a complete wall of glass - ridiculously large room, even had a TV in the mirror in the bathroom so hubby could catch sports while he shaved. You can walk anywhere from here too, but the best was the terrace cafe with music, drinks and a whole lotta view of the entire city,

Reviews.Title: “A Travel Writer's Review”
Reviews.Author: TravelbyLori
Reviews.Content: The Trump Tower, as it is referred to locally, is both a hotel and a residence. Pulling up in a taxi to the arrival area, I was met by a doorman with a charming British accent who greeted me graciously and directed me to the hotel side. The lobby is divided in half, with a residentsâ€™ lobby on one side and the hotel lobby on the other. Itâ€™s small in comparison to other area luxury hotels whose massive lobbies take up an entire floor, but adequate for small groups who are waiting or checking in. The interior design is in perfect unity with the exterior lookâ€”â€œposh contemporaryâ€� sums it up nicely. The color palette of all interior spaces in the Trump Tower is the same as with many Trump properties, favoring the cooler shades of grey, violet and blue with few exceptions. Tactilely, the furnishings such as couches and chairs are soft and velvety. ROOMS The rooms range from studio suites with approximately 600 square feet of living space to three-bedroom suites averaging about 1,000 square feet. All have either a small kitchenette or a fully-functional and equipped kitchen. The quality of the furnishings in even the smallest rooms is remarkable. Trump didn't cut cornersâ€”the mattresses are comfortable and the technology is up-to-date. I especially enjoyed the TV in the bathroom mirror. It was helpful for morning multi-taskingâ€”i.e. catching up on the news while applying makeup. Electronically controlled drapes and the availablity of various levels of ambient lighting also met a high standard. I found the personal touch of framed photos of Chicago landmarks set around the room to be both charming and a fantastic idea, especially as this was my first visit to the city. It was my floor to ceiling view of the stunning city of Chicago, though, that made the room. SPA ROOMS A unique feature to the Trump Tower is the availability of their Spa Rooms, which invite guests to immerse themselves in the spa experience. These rooms have easy access to the spa via an earmarked staircase, making the trek in a bathrobe less of an issue and providing convenient access. The spa can also be brought to guests in Spa Rooms where a private yoga lesson can be arranged or many of the treatments can be done in-room. The Spa itself is quite minimalist, with the focus on treatment rather than overly ornate surroundings. LOCATION The location to shopping and entertainment is phenomenal. I opted for a taxi due to the cool, rainy weather, but the Trump Tower is within an easy walking distance from the famed Miracle Mile and Navy Pier. There is also a restaurant (Sixteen) and a lounge (Rebar, named for the building materials used) in-house. Both are busy and lively in the evenings. I ordered a delicious crushed berry drink at a premium price while enjoying the perfect view of a fireworks display over the river. RECOMMENDATION As a final note, the service at the Trump International Hotel and Tower is as sophisticated as the dÃ©cor. From the bellmen to the servers to the front desk staff and every other staff member I encountered during my visit, I was shown the best in professional hospitality. I made note of it in my observations of their interactions with other guests, as well. In conclusion, the Trump comes highly personally recommended for the ambiance as much as the location. The Trump Tower truly fits my definition of luxury. Watch video reviews at YouTube.com/TravelbyLori and read more reviews at Examiner.com - search Lori Metze.

Reviews.Title: “Super deluxe hotel with perfect service!”
Reviews.Author: family-van-den-Berg
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location with amazing city and make views. Staff is very professional ! Very big rooms. One of The best hotels ever been to !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ckwrsr
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending a long weekend in Chicago. Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel. Beautiful rooms and decor throughout. Great to have a mini-kitchen in the room as we don't like to eat out for every single meal. (Trader Joe's a few blocks away was a great place for a few groceries.) Bed and bedding incredibly comfortable. Pillow menu available. Turn down service each night. Staff were pleasant, friendly and accomodating every step of the way. Easy check in and check out. Fast and courteous. Excellent location on the river. Spa looked nice although we didn't use it. Athletic club was wonderful with beautiful views. Only strange part of the room: bathroom door slides shut and does not lock. You can also see into the bathroom through the 1/2 inch openings on each side of the door. This was okay for us as we weren't traveling with kids, but if you are someone who likes to be able to lock the bathroom door for privacy, you would not be able to do that here.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Mackie0829
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect from arrival to departure - their attention to detail is amazing. I loved the cleanliness of everything and honestly, the little details and the extraordinary service take it to another level. I have never experienced such great service. From the room service to the restaurants to the concierge who got me into an off-site restaurant within 10 minutes...they treat everybody as they would Mr. Trump and that is why I would pay extra any day to stay there. I felt special and I loved getting everything on time. I look forward to staying at a Trump hotel again soon - great job. Truly amazing service.

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things”
Reviews.Author: Checkmatedesign
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed in many luxury hotels so I would like to say we are hard to impress. The rooms are lovely-kitchenette in the room, mini fridge, stocked kitchen (lovely). Bathrooms are gorgeous! Bed was super comfortable, towels were great. Free shoeshine, ability to make tea in the room, papers waiting outside the door in the morning-great! Staff was hit and miss but mostly a hit. Tall phiilipino gentleman who was our bellman was so kind and recognized us as we came and went (my husband was ill and he suggested going to get him soup)-but we were put on long hold with reception twice, one time for over 20 minutes (we gave up). Some concierges were great (nice african american lady) and the guy named Jay? but some were not helpful at all (Q: do you think there will be a wait? A; yes Q: do you have any idea how long it would be? A: no just go there yourself and see.) I would suggest finding a way to attach the drapes to the side wall-because the windows are so amazing the drapes have a hard time when closed blocking out all the light. Went to Rebar (restaurant) twice -great atmoosphere and wait staff was very efficient and friendly. Spa was amazing- working out was a pleasure here. Windows on fitness center were amazing and pool was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: dmross
Reviews.Content: I went on a nice little pre-Christmas trip to explore Chicago. This was a little Christmas gift to myself... a well deserved break in the windy city. This hotel has the best views from a room that I have ever seen - Beautiful floor to ceiling windows. Take everything you know about hotels, such as; beds, views, bathrooms, etc - this hotel has THE BEST of each in Chicago. This hotel is modern and is perfect for business travelers and couples. I would not bring children to this hotel (in my opinion) because I wouldn't want to have children running around and making noise while I was here. The workout room at this hotel is THE BEST that I have ever seen. All of the equipment faces the floor to ceiling windows - riding the bike makes you feel like you are going to ride right off the edge - again, BEAUTIFUL views. The pool is really nice here - it has a really good size. The location is really good too - literally five minute walk to the "mag mile", Macy's, and the theatre district. The service was of course, also, top notch. They have a minimum of 5 people working the door for you. This place staff's well - you do not have to lift a finger if you don't want to. You will NEVER have to wait around. You will be taken care of like a star as soon as you pull up to the door. I would LOVE to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Amazing. Sets the bar.”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneJ_BizTrvlr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a LOT of 5 start hotels around the world, including a lot of exceptionally expensive multi-room suites. At the end of the day, they were all just hotel rooms. My 1-Bedroom King Suite on the 22nd floor of the Trump Tower Chicago was nowhere near the most expensive of these, but was EASILY THE BEST I'VE EVER STAYED IN. It was so amazing I really can't describe it as a hotel room. It was a spacious, gorgeous, complete luxury apartment. I could list out the amenities, but they're beside the point. When I settled into this room, and invited my Chicago friends over, and we lounged around the fireplace and enjoyed the view of (I'm not kidding) the Chicago river opening into Lake Michigan, Navy Pier, the Wrigley Clocktower, AND Wacker Drive, I didn't feel like I was a weary traveler or a tourist - I felt like the King of the World. And as it happens, that's how the staff treated me. Also, if you stay here, definitely avail yourself of the concierge. She helped us decide where to go to dinner and gave us a little card. When we arrived at the restaurant (a block or two away), the host asked if we had reservations. When I said no, he made that apologetic, "oh dear that's too bad there's no way" sound. But then I remembered the concierge's card and said, "oh, but I do have this." Well, it was actually comical how fast his demeanor changed. We were seated *immediately* and had one of the best meals I've eaten in years, laughing the whole time about our "Trump Card". I'm telling you: King of the World.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Trump Chicago is the real deal.”
Reviews.Author: thbussey
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend here for Valentine's Day this year and it was absolutely amazing. We stayed in one of the spa rooms on the 14th floor and had an amazing view of the north river opening into Lake Michigan. In fact, the buildings around us were the same ones you'd recognize in Transformers 3! Pretty cool. Anyways, the service is amazing...from the doormen to the front desk to the concierge to the housekeeping. Everything was superb. We ate breakfast at the hotel every morning and felt like family, not to mention the food is delicious (I got the 2 egg special everyday!)...and their fresh orange juice and "juice of the day" are delicious. The staff and the hotel itself made our weekend getaway to Chicago absolutely perfect. I have now stayed with Trump in both Las Vegas and Chicago and plan on visiting their other locations in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: Shaggy8
Reviews.Content: When scouring all the reviews on Tripadvisor on which hotel would be best for my family of five for many weeks, I finally decided on the Trump Hotel. I must admit, until I read all the wonderful reviews it wouldn't have been my first choice as I was afraid it would be out of my price range and a bit too stuffy for a very casual weekend with teenagers. I really wanted a large room so we can all be together (two separate rooms would have been pricier...plus, need to keep an eye on the teens ;) We ended up booking a one-bedroom king suite and WOW, it was amazing! It had a pull-out queen sleeper sofa and we also had a rollaway. Hard to impress teens and even they were amazed. They loved the hotel, especially the tv in the bathroom mirror, the push button for opening/closing the curtains and the pool. One of the best parts was it had two full bathrooms---one for us and one for the kids. The location was perfect...just a very short walk to ice skating in Millenium Park and then shopping on Michigan Ave. Of course, the customer service is outstanding. Everyone had a smile on their face and were always offering us assistance...hotel was not stuffy at all as they made us feel very welcome and comfortable. Special thanks to Jenna in the Executive Offices for her assistance in helping secure my reservation and even surprised me with a little birthday cake in the room! We all had a wonderful time and would book this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan R
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Trump at least 5 times and my last visit was as nice as the first. We stayed here for the Auto Show (which has become a yearly tradition). The hotel is on the river and within walking distance to Nordstrom's, State Street, Water Tower and Bloomingdale's. The rooms are modern and elegant and if you stay in a suite you get a full kitchen complete with granite counters and top of the line appliances. It's great if you want to stay for the weekend and spend some time in the room. The rooms have floor to ceiling windows and the suites on the corners have beautiful views of the city, Navy Pier and the lake. The suites also have two full bathrooms which is great if you are staying with the family. The living room has a fireplace and a huge couch that pulls out into a sleeper and also has a big chaise lounge for additional sleeping space. There is a grocery store right outside the hotel if you want to keep some things to eat and drink in the kitchen. The service is wonderful and the hotel is even pet friendly. If you tell them you are bringing a dog they will bring up pet amenities including a dog bed, bows and a blanket. The health club and spa are very nice and over sweeping views of the city. The room service we ordered was delicious and you are also walking distance to Shaw's, McCormick and Schmidt's, Smith and Wollensky, Morton's, the House of Blues, Noodles and Co., Starbucks and the Billy Goat Tavern. This is one of our favorite Chicago hotels.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: j9for3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the weekend in Chicago for our anniversary. We have stayed in quite a few marvelous Chicago hotels (including the Elysian...beautiful!) over the years, and the Trump International didn't disappoint. The decor is modern and elegant, without being a bit stuffy. The staff is kind and helpful. Rooms are beautiful. We had the most "basic" room and it was luxurious and well appointed. Warm browns and deep golds are the primary colors...with deep green/brown granite. Harmonious and soft. It seems a small detail, but the hair dryers are actual high-end hair dryers...not the anemic ones usually supplied. The small wet bar area was well-appointed. The property had a marvelous spa, workout facility, and pool. The floor-to-ceiling windows are just as described and are stunning. The spa had many small touches I've rarely seen in hotel spas. Every detail at this hotel seemed to be well-considered. We had brunch at the main restaurant on Sunday. We hadn't done any research, but anticipated a pricey but simple breakfast. We didn't anticipate a 70$ per person meal...but my husband was seduced, so we indulged. The food/quality/service was excellent, but what put it over the top was the view. Amazing! Was it worth the steep price for what amounted to breakfast? Probably not, however it was an indulgent end to a lovely weekend. Location perfect...easy access to Miracle Mile. Our anniversary dinner was at Keifers...always excellent. Trump International a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest!”
Reviews.Author: DDCee
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting the windy city, this is a first class hotel on the river. The service is impeccable. The lobby area is not grand like some of the older hotels, but is secure. The suites are beautiful, providing every comfort, including a fireplace. The food is excellent along with a fashionable bar.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesome Experience !”
Reviews.Author: styletraveler1967
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Trump International Tower over Thanksgiving weekend, which also coincided with our 2nd Wedding Anniversary. From the moment we checked in, we had the most amazing time. The room was great with it's own little "kitchen" area complete with a dishwasher, fridge, Nespresso coffee maker and sink...all welcome touches when you are traveling. We loved the bathroom, which was a decent size and featured a TV screen built into the mirror.Since we were celebrating our anniversary, we received a plate of chocolate covered strawberries upon our arrival, which we thought was a beautiful touch. We indulged in breakfast twice, once in our room and once in the restaurant....both experiences were great. The concierge was most helpful in making dinner and show reservations and the reception at the restaurant that we dined at was incredible...say what you will, but the name "Trump" seems to carry quite a bit of weight in the local community so when they know someone from Trump Tower is on the list, the level of respect and customer service seemed to automatically soar. The gym was wonderful and the little touches that were offered like the bowl of apples on Thanksgiving morning or the coffee that was offered the following morning, were really nice and appreciated touches. I travel extensively for business and it is difficult to find a hotel that can be rated "flawless" after a stay....however, Trump International Tower in Chicago would come really close. We would definitely stay at this property again...just a fabulous experience.

Reviews.Title: “Trump International Hotel & Tower beats all other 5 star hotels in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling for 20+ years on business and have stayed in numerous 5-Star hotels throughout the country. I live in the suburbs and work in downtown Chicago. I looked into staying downtown for a weekend getaway at the usual places like Intercontinental and Penninsula, ect...Trump was brought up so I booked it.....WOW!! What a wonderful experience from the moment we stepped onto the property. The lobby was emaculate and the host at the front desk was so very pleasent and helpful. Checking in was a breeze on the Friday afternoon before Superbowl Sunday if you can imagine that. The entire staff was very warm and polished...not everyplace in town, no matter how highly rated can boast of that; someone has spent time and resources making sure staff "gets it" The room was even nicer than the photos on the website... and talk about clean throughout; not a scratch or blemish anywhere. It seemed like the room as well as the entire hotel just finished final inspection and was set for a photo shoot for a travel magazine. I have to say throughout the room as well as the entire hotel was a very faint scent of what seemed to be a very light lavender or aromatheropy type smell...nothing overpowering in any way, just a great smell everywhere. Possibly all these details are a requirement expected by the Trump family as they set expectations for the managers of the property?? You sort of felt like maybe Mr.Trump or his daughter might show up at any moment for a little property inspection and everyone on duty was ready....no kidding. The food at 16 was second to none and the view of the historic Wrigley Clock Tower while dining was sureal as it felt like it was 50 feet away and quite large. The gym has teriffic views as you work out and it was nice to have a full gym that included a substantial amount of free weights as well as private studios for your stretching, yoga and alternative fitness needs. The locker rooms were fresh and clean and had a very nice sauna and steam bath. Moving forward I will recomend with great confidence to my friends as well as clients the Trump over any other hotel in downtown Chicago.......J.Conway

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Picky08
Reviews.Content: Amazing service. This hotel really spoils you. Their customer service goes above and beyond. I called to find out if they serve soy milk with the coffee they offer in the lobby and they sent a carafe of soy milk to my room. Th room was clean, large , qiuet and beautiful. The bed was comfortable. Just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “I've had the best, this is better!!!”
Reviews.Author: TMFD
Reviews.Content: I've never been so blown away by the total satisfaction I've had with my stays at trump Chicago. I live in Iowa and travel often to fun places like Miami, Vegas, Colorado and a close trip is Chicago. About a year ago my usual hotel was booked. I was having a hard week at home and wanted to treat myself so I called trump and gave it a try. Ok, the truth is trump was not much more than my other hotel but wow was it worth much more. My wife and I said to each other that it was like we found a resort hotel in downtown Chicago. The best way to describe my exsperence is to say complete top of the line service and amenities! The staff looks good, talks good and seem to real care. The pool, spa and gym are super nice, clean and relaxing to do your own thing. The rooms are awesome!!! TV in the bathroom mirror. I got a river side view so I looked out the window for a hour before I went to bed. Great view. Room had a great kitchen too. After my wife and I returned from dinner the TV turned into a fish aquarium. Very cool. They also turned on the stereo for us. Did I mention the coffee is also great and it's waiting for you when you get up! I work hard when I'm home so I love to leave and love to treat myself. I have done to Chicago and stayed at the trump hotel once a month for the last six months just as a quick get away. I love it and wish I didn't have to leave!!! Stay there, you will not be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Trump is out of this world in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: kkmac_12
Reviews.Content: Just celebrate a milestone weekend in Chicago and Trump Tower is out of this world. The customer service is nothing less of stellar. The staff bent over backward from the time we got out of limo till we finally hit the luxurious mattress at night. The staff also treated my kids as if they were royalty---cookies and milk, rootbeer floats, and monogrammed toys--(over the top). Rooms include anything and everything. Gym and pool are the best.

Reviews.Title: “a most comfortable and enjoyable stay....”
Reviews.Author: celticmoon
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Friday evening in a snowstorm after our original flight was canceled and Midway allowed only one flight that evening, and luckily it was the flight we were on. When we finally arrived at the hotel we were tired and looking forward to getting to our room and relaxing. We were not disappointed. We felt at home and comfortable the minute we walked through the door. Stayed 4 terrific nights on the 26th floor in a bright airy suite overlooking the Chicago River with views of Lake Michigan, Chicago River and skyline. Some hotels lack in the area of bright bathroom lighting, not this hotel. Beautiful bright lighting for ladies, in addition to a vanity/seating area and more bright lighting. It's a pleasure to get ready in these surroundings. Comfortable beds, fine linens, towels and toiletries and very clean. Turn down with complimentary bottles of water. Breakfast was delicious and service first rate. (Try the pancakes for a change). As we were busy during our stay we did not have a chance to enjoy The Spa. For a change and close by, a great pizza place Buon Giorno's. If you happen to visit The Art Institute try to take in the Miniature Collection on the lower level, it was a highlight for us. 5 minute walk to Michigan Avenue. We would not hesitate in staying at this hotel again, and look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels...period”
Reviews.Author: Riplip3
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and view. It's the personal service that seperates this upscale hotel from others. As soon as you enter this hotel...they treat you like a VIP. Nice touch with hats and cotton candy for my two young sons. Bar is great. Though...restaurant "sixteen", over priced and missed out by making the space more comfortable...especially with that view. But...chalk that up to more personal taste than anything else.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: Motherjudge
Reviews.Content: I celebrated a milestone birthday with some of my closest friends. My 7 bffs and I stayed in the river view suite. It was beautiful and the kitchen was stocked to my specifications. My bed was amazing; that was the most luxurious mattress I have ever slept on. The following morning I hosted a brunch for 30 of my closest friends. The service was impeccable. They were attentive to my every wish. I felt like royalty and they acted as though they were my loyal subjects. The food was superb. It was supposed to be a buffet, but they kept serving us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas”
Reviews.Author: shoeaddict78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our dogs into the city for Christmas, and had a wonderful stay at The Trump! We upgraded our room when we arrived.... And this room was fantastic! They treated our dogs wonderfully and brought them treats whenever possible. It was expensive but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not Amazing”
Reviews.Author: PrincessSC
Reviews.Content: We decided to try out a new property this year in Chicago. We previously loved staying at the Four Seasons in Chicago and decided to try out something new. I definitely was not as happy with this property. It all began with check-in. Prior to flying in we were told we would be upgraded and upon check-in we were told we would not be upgraded. Nevertheless, the rooms were pretty and well appointed. Our AC broke during the night and I called down to the front desk telling them it was an inferno. They never called me back. I went downstairs before breakfast and they said they would send maintenance up to fix it while I was eating. After breakfast nothing had been done and I had to call again. Not once did anyone from the hotel contact me or apologize. It took a second time for me to go downstairs for them to send someone up to fix it. I understand things happen in hotels but I think me reminding them to fix the ac 4x is unacceptable. On a positive note, we enjoyed the restaurants on the property but I am pretty confident that we will return to the Four Seasons next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but can't quite compete with the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: alwaystraveling74
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here on New Years Eve, as we were attending a private party at the residence of a tenant in the Tower portion of the building. This is a luxury hotel, yet I don't feel that it can compete with the like of a Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton. Pros: Beautifully decorated room, great views, and my husband and I had an EXCELLENT couples massage. Cons: spotty service (for example, after waiting in line for 15 minutes to check out, the clerk decided to take a break just as I got to the head of the line...!), the spa waiting room was littered with dirty glasses, and I really didn't need to see Donald Trump's face plastered over half the items in my room. Overall, when spending the kind of money you spend to stay here, you expect a much more polished experience, such as the one you get when you stay at a Four Seasons (which actually, was cheaper than the Trump).

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: JustinHubb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing...the service is unparalleled and the views from the rooms are amazing. Being from Chicago, I thought I had seen everything. But the views from our suite were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could always stay at this hotel when in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: JSPrima
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not covered by my company's travel policy -- so the only time I get to stay there is when traveling for vacation. It's a really great hotel. Wonderful views, great decor, cool bathroom, and very good staff. It's such a great room that you want to spend time in it! Only had drinks at the bar so can't comment on the food. Didn't try the spa because I'm really love the spas at the Peninsula and Elysian hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: BaseballMom46
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Trump in Chicago, and I was totally blown away by the service and amenities the hotel offers. Unfortunately, I was only there for one night, and didn't want to leave in the morning. The staff was very attentive - from the front desk to the evening turn-down service. They made sure that I had everything that I needed. The hotel is close to so many great restaurants and centrally located. There really is no other place to stay in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Cira E
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Trump and it seems the service has improved, if that is even possible. It was our birthdays and we were told "happy birthday" from the receptionist to the valet. The birthday cake in the room was also a nice touch. We were in a river view room with an excellent view. The full moon over the river at night was gorgeous. The room was everything you would expect from a Trump property: immaculate, comfortable and spacious. Would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: lextravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at Trump Chicago the week before Christmas and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Room was quite large with a great view of the river. We liked the Nespresso coffee maker. We had a $60 breakfast credit each morning and that was not quite enough for the three of us - just a warning that it is pricy. Best deal was the oatmeal with lots of berries! My massage was great and the exercise facility excellent. We did miss not having a whirlpool though. We had a little mix up in getting the right pillows from the pillow menu, but overall it was really a great stay. Excellent location, nice folks, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Trump Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: jimstooth
Reviews.Content: Great Stay! We had a one bedroom with out 3 children. We had plenty of space! Living room has a fireplace. Full kitchen with stainless appliances and granite countertops, very nice. We were upgraded to a river view, which was great. Hotel location is perfect, block off State and Michigan, right on the river. Hotel restaurant was great, but we did only have breakfast there. Room service pizza was not so great. Good pool area and workout facility.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with Some Irritation”
Reviews.Author: Flit_Wing
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice and the rooms are really fabulous. They are so Trumpish. Glitz & glam - high ceilings, views, gadgets, sleek grey and lots of black granite, glass etc. The espresso maker is wonderful, the t.v. is set to a fish tank, the curtains work on an automatic switch, all lights can be on and off on panels, the bathroom looks like it is from a water works catalog with a t.v. in the mirror. The towels are plentiful, the bed is comfortable, the city noises are far away and the location is wonderful. There is a fridge and microwave and sink so it is easy to have snacks. The sitting area makes it easy to relax after some touring. All that is really a reason to stay if the budget allows. The restaurant is good - expensive - the exercise room is really as nice as some clubs - and it is not subterranean - and that is saying something. Hotels notoriously have one or two creaky bikes and an all in one weight machine crammed in a dreary basement dungeon. What I would say bothers me is the front desk staff and the bellmen/welcome staff (the concierge desk is great and efficient and the doormen is as well). They are irritating. It's as if they went into training with the emphasis on perky and it can be exhausting. The staff do not seem to perceive a guest in a rush or register a guest might not want to get into a discussion of his or her plans etc. Most guests will ask if they want a recommendation and will make a comment about their trip which would indicate they are interested in striking up some discussion. My husband has been four other times and he has the same complaint. We have devised strategies, though what worked pretty well was a blunt but politely and kindly said, "we are not feeling talkative". My other complaint is the amenities. We forgot a brush. When we asked for a comb we were directed to the store where brushes were $10.00 to $35.00 and the ten dollar one was worse quality than Goody brand at CVS. I think a hotel charging this price should provide a free comb and any other small incidentals. It felt cheap. At a minimum they should have reasonable quality at a good value. We would have walked to a pharmacy but we were running late. I have not stayed in another hotel in Chicago - so I cannot compare it. It is expensive but I do like the way I can live vicariously in a sleek building. Don't miss the view from the 16th floor restaurant. Sepectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, like a TajMahal in Illinois!”
Reviews.Author: whitfang
Reviews.Content: We don't normally stay in places like the Trump Towers in Chicago but thought we would splurge and stay here. It's a great location, right on the river, which was real fortunate because we looked right down the river at the lake and got a great view of the city fireworks at night. Walked to every attraction we needed to. Experienced a 'pillow menu' for the first time - allowing you to order specialized pillows per your needs. Can order hot buttered popcorn via room service, very good! They had water with gold flakes in it - I think it was $35 for a pint, so we did not try it. Beds and bedding were excellent. The one surprising thing was the soap / shampoo / conditioner / lotions. We had three bathrooms and expected some high-end French handmade accessories, but the ones provided were more of the Target store brands. And did not even have Trump markings on them!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable stay....well worth the $$$ spent !”
Reviews.Author: ambreenk
Reviews.Content: This review is about 6 months past due but I figured Trump Hotel deserves to be praised for what it's worth! Long story short, we are a Canadian family who stayed for 4 nights this summer . We booked 2 city view 1bed suites but were kindly upgraded to river view without even asking ! We had kids of all ages with us from teenage girls to a 2 yr old toddler with us and Trump staff's service, professionalism, amazing rooms and amenities , not to forget the gorgeous location left us all amazed beyond belief! This hotel left us so impressed that I will be returning again this summer to make my remaining family members experience what I did :) I will take this opportunity to recognize valet staff, a bellboy named KC (I hope I got his name right) and our housekeeping staff Sara who kept the rooms immaculate with all the mess the kids created ! Thank you all of you including the manager for making our 1st visit to Chicago unforgetttable! I'm so looking forward to spending my wedding anniversary and son's birthday this summer @ the Trump again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome. Cant say more”
Reviews.Author: 1821_Spartan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our wedding night and all we can say is wow!!! This place is so devine we recommend it to anyone who wants to stay here. Clean and comfortable rooms, friendly staff they even sent our a limo to our wedding reception at 1 am in the morning to take us to the Trump. We cant say anymore and no faults or negative comments here.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: C_Hedlund
Reviews.Content: River view rooms feature great views of downtown Chicago and are spacious and comfortable. Staff was very attentive. Breakfast at the restaurant was delicious and the bar is a happening night spot. Located a short walk from Michigan Avenue shopping district, but away from the hustle and bustle

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nycnaper
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I ever stays at, and I have been to many. The rooms are perfect. Great decor, very. Clean crisp updated rooms. There is attention to detail for everything. My favorite part is the spa with the sauna and steam room, amazing. The steam room has this incredible fragrance and it super clean. The pool is amazing too. Now for the service, amazing also. They go out of their way to help with whatever they can. Treat you like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “TRUMP Hotel Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Sedonadann
Reviews.Content: There are many choices in Chicago for fine hotels but Trump International Hotel-Chicago tops them all. Personal service exceeds one's expectations; extremely freindly personnel from the moment of check-in at front desk to maid and room service. Wonderful city and river views from every room; you won't be looking at another building's wall as is often the view in other Chicago hotels. Beautiful rooms with fireplaces, full kitchens, and well appointed baths. Trump is an excellent choice and in my opinion, the Best choice for the finest in hotel comfort while staying in Chicago. Sixteen restaurant is simply delicious and what a view of the Clock Tower and Chicago river! I and my family enjoyed a superb Xmas Eve dinner. I've stayed at other fine hotels in Chicago but Trump is definitely tops. I will return for my third time soon. PS- I stayed at the Elysian-Chicago last year and will never return; terrible service, snippy waiters, poor management and absolutely no views from small size "deluxe" rooms at the same prices as at Trump.

Reviews.Title: “At this price, I expect perfection”
Reviews.Author: DougM123
Reviews.Content: At this hotel, they prep your room before you get there. For us, that meant milk and cookies, gifts for the kids, and a Wii waiting in our room. Unfortunately during check in, we discovered that they had us booked in the wrong type of room (city view vs. river). While they agreed to switch us to a river view room, that meant that we did not get our goodies for quite some time (we finally had to request the Wii as it was still apparently in our old room). Also, we left the hotel at 6:30PM and returned at 9:30PM and there was no turn down service during this time (maybe they went to the other room?). Had to call for that as well. The hotel and staff are amazing. It is just when you spend this much money, you hope that reservations can get the room right and in the event that doesn't happen, you would expect them to straighten things out quickly. That didn't happen either. The hotel rooms are nice, we enjoyed the river view, and the staff was always courteous and friendly - we even loved the location. Just wish things had gone more smoothly for our one day Christmas getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: RomoChicago
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Trump last Saturday night and had a great time. The hotel is beautiful; rooms are great, located a short walk from Michigan Avenue. Staff is friendly and the restaurants are great. Lobby is smaller than the Four Seasons but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Trump Chicago does not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: kenferm
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel all the way around. Rooms amazing, service amazing, food amazing. Lots of little extras they thought of like duplex outlets for ac plugs, kitchenettes, tv within mirror in bathroom etc.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it all!!!! Nice rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: Uremovich
Reviews.Content: First time at the Trump! Everything we expected. Best room in years, service awesome, great location and great views! Pricey, but worth it!!! Most comfortable bed I have slept in, in years. Absolutely will come again!!!

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel and staff - shame about the lifts”
Reviews.Author: thejerseygourmand
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at most of the other good hotels in Chicago, where I've been coming almost every year for well over a decade. The Trump, definitely beats them all in my opinion. The staff are, without exception, excellent. Service was always very efficient. Only one minor hiccup - the pillows we had pre-ordered didn't materialise and we had to ask again. Pretty minor really. I note one reviewer's comment about the city view room. I asked for a river view, which was wonderful. Also my request for a room as high as possible was fullfilled. A colleague who had the same room lower down said the higher view was even better. The room was described as an Executive King suite - although I couldn't see this exact description on their website. Anway, it was spacious and very comfortable. Unlike another reviewer, I really didn't find the lifts satisfactory. In fact, this would almost make me think of going back to the Peninsula, where I've never waited more than a few moments for a lift. I can't conceive how anyone could have made such an error when designing the hotel. However, everything else is so good, I guess I'll probably put up with the wait to get up to the room. So, apart from the inadequacy of the lifts (when I stayed, at least), I would say this is a fantastic hotel and I'm very much looking forward to staying there again on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!!”
Reviews.Author: NhLovestotravel
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 sons (17 & 22) and I stayed at this hotel for the first time. From the time you step into the front door you are welcomed with smiles and how is your day going. And that was all four days of our stay for the Thanksgiving holiday. We stayed in a one bedroom king suite with city views. The suite was very spacious and elegant. It had a full kitchen which we ate breakfast in and ordered pizza one night for dinner because the room was so comfortable and beautiful. We didn't want to leave the room. The service was over the top. Housekeeping was very quick and thorough if you forgot something at home. Did not eat in the restaurant but did have sushi and drinks in the Rebar which was very nice but very pricey. The location is very convenient for walking down town, Navy Pier and Millennium Park. My husband and I have stayed in other luxurious hotels in Chicago, but this one tops them all. We will definitely go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and gorgeous suite!”
Reviews.Author: Paris_CDG
Reviews.Content: Wow!! It was my first stay at the Trump Chicago and I have to say I am hard pressed to think of any place I have ever stayed that compares to this. The service is very, very friendly, prompt and courteous. The suite was enormous and extremely cosy. It felt more like a luxury condo than a hotel suite. I felt enveloped in luxurious fabric and warmth from the fireplace. Beautiful views of the river and city as well. The restaurant is pretty nice, not the very best, but definitely worth a try. The Spa is excellent - I got the best facial of my life, the Kate Sommerville signature facial. Expensive but worth it! You certainly get your money's worth at the Trump. I don't visit Chicago often but I look forward to staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: moowliscious
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during our week in Chicago, this was a treat for us as this was our first trip since getting maried and it was an early birthday celebration for me to celebrate my birthday in December. We were met by friendly doormen and checked in by a warm and welcoming staff member (I think his name was England, I may be wrong but I'm certain that was his name) we felt relaxed and welcomed right away. Little touches like the hot towel presented to you on a slate with an orchid are just a step above what you expect. Despite arriving at 10am we were checked in quickly and told we had been upgraded to a river view room, we had requested a high floor for the view and we werent disappointed with being located on the 26th floor. The hotel only goes to 27 floors of this magnificent building so we couldnt ask for much more. (we had emailed them and asked if we could drop off our luggage as we expected to arrive too early to check in, we really didnt expect to be able to get into our room this early) Our room was just fabulous, entered from a quiet corridor and decorated in a simple sophisticated style which added to the air of luxury. We had a kitchen complete with hob, dishwasher, fridge containing mini bar but with plenty of room for your own items and microwave. Cupboards contained glassware, crockery, a toaster and kettle. There was a Nespresso machine and pods and a tray of snack items available for purchase. The mini bar was well stocked with soft drinks, wines, champagne and spirits. Compared with mini bars in less luxurious hotels this was actually all really well priced and not expensive at all. The room had an awesome view down Wabash, South Michigan Ave and dwon to Navy Pier. Comfortable seating was provided in the window so you could sit and watch the world go by below. The bed was MASSIVE and the most comfortable ever! We had selected speciality pillows from the in room pillow menu which were provided daily. The bathroom was a great size, with the walk in shower and bath behind a glass screen. All immaculate and put together in the same luxurious style. The TV in the bathroom mirror was a novelty, I guess we are just not that addicted to TV to see it's neccessity but I see how it goes with the luxury setting. The housekeeping service in this hotel was second to none, these unseen staff members do one of the most important jobs in the hotel. Our room was kept beautifully clean and each evening when we returned to our room we had fresh towells, toiletries topped up and even a little foot mat placed by the bed with trump slippers placed on it! A nice personal touch was a note informing you of the next day's weather forecast with your housekeepers name on it. On our first evening we returned and found a bottle of champagne and a cake with sweet messages wishing us congratulations on our marriage and for my birthday. For a hotel to acknowledge one special occassion is good but to make an effort to make us feel special for both occassions was just unexpected. We didnt eat at the hotel but we did have cocktails in Rebar, a plush bar located on a mezzanine level off reception, understated glamour and smooth service here too. We were seated in a window seat, brought a dish of olives and spiced nuts. Our drinks were prepared and brought to us by friendly waiting staff. Drinks were different to the norm on cocktail menus and clearly showed the quality of ingredients and thought put into thier creation. We truly loved every single minute at this hotel, the extra special touches made our stay but even without these the hotel would rank as the best we have stayed in. Every single member of staff displayed professionalism whilst being friendly, we never felt the staff were aloof. Some other guests may have looked down thier noses at us the day we were on our way out in wet weather clothing but who cares?! We would return here with no hesitation. Thank you to all the staff, especially the housekeeping team, concierge team and reception staff for making our stay everything we hoped and more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wooski
Reviews.Content: First time ever to stay at a Trump property and was very nice. We have a family of 5 and it was hard to find accomodations in downtown Chicago. Our usual loyalty goes to Fairmont, Starwood and Marriot but we had to book 2 rooms. We were greeted by friendly staff and we were upgraded to a river view. The room was spacious and spectacular. The kids got caps, cotton candy on arrival and a treat at turndown. The kitchen was nice but did not use it. Fitness and pool facilities was all you need. Location was fantastic and it was an easy walk to everything downtown. We were there 3 nights and would go back. The only drawback is that there is a slight air of snootyness from other guests as our family does not dress the part.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel! Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: Florimbi
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel - for it's location, staff, service, and great views of Lake Michigan and the city! Depending on the specific day, this hotel can be a great bargain or it can be pricey. Resturant is amazing, but the best is their incedible Sunday Brunch - a real treat! The hotel has two bars, one on the second floor and another, with an outside patio on the 17th floor (great for a summer evening to watch the fireworks at Navy Pier on Wednesdays & Saturdays around 9:30pm.) The rooms are incredible spacious and the larger rooms (suites) come with a kitchen that has a full size refigerator, microwave, etc...I could live here on a longer-term basis without much problem. Some of the hotel "room" are actually condos that are owned by individuals - yes, you can actually purchase a hotel unit, if you want to visit frequently! Wonderful property!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great experience at this beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: csunny163
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights recently and had a wonderful time. The staff were very friendly and helpful and assisted us with directions and with making reservations at a restaurant. The decor is beautiful and elegant and the room was spacious and had everything you would need. The spa was lovely and had a facial and massage that were excellent. The restaurant sixteen was fabulous-- did the 5 course meal with wine pairings and breakfast daily. The views of the skyline were beautiful. The location in the city was great--within walking distance of many attractions like millennium park and the magnificent mile and also close to train station. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: azgal85018
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at the Trump Intn'l Hotel recently and can't say enough good things about it. The suite was exceptional with no amenity overlooked and of the highest quality. The bed was extremely comfortable. The view over the Chicago River with Lake Michigan in the distance was amazing, location was great. What's not to like! Not to be overlooked, the restaurant "16" was delicious and it was so nice to arrive on a cold evening, somewhat late, and be able to dine in the hotel at a quality restaurant. We very highly recommmend the Trump.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!! AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: dewwyy
Reviews.Content: Can not think of one negative thing to say about this outstanding hotel! From the door men to the reception it is a FABULOUS experience. Room service is top notch...the food is unbelievable. It's the little touches that really matter and this establishment has covered all the bases!

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ziggiee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Trump Hotel for a weekend getaway from the suburb of Chicago to come downtown and stay one night at this hotel, which we always heard so many positives about. We were not disappointed. We stayed on the 24th floor in an expensive room with a gorgeous view of the Chicago river and lake michigan. Well worth it since we planned on staying in the hotel for our entire stay. Living in the suburbs, we've done the Michigan avenue shopping, dined at the great surrounding restaurants, so this was all inclusive stay for us. We dined at 16, the hotel's signature restaurant and were not disappointed. Excellent service from start to end. The meals we ordered were presented to us like we were the Trumps.... Being waited on to be sure we were happy with our dining experience.... We returned to our room and marveled at the night time view from our room, watched some tv and it is true, there is another small tv embedded in the bathroom mirror...so cool. There were a total of three tvs in our room, and not to be snobby, but one review mentioned with black tv countertops, you do see dust, which is hard to maintain dust free at all times. Great mattress for sleeping. We ate breakfast as well at 16 in the morning and service was excellent. The spa and exercise area is wonderful with a view of the city where ever you choose to work out. Very open and airy. Our only minor complaint, if any and it was annoying and we heard some others complaining was the elevator. The hotel is huge and it seemed to have very limited elevators running ..getting from floor to floor for dinner took a while and when we departed our elevator made stops almost every two floors going down, and because people on floors were waiting a while, when we stopped they would get on and our elevator was overfilled with guests,because they didn't want to wait any longer. We did stress our minor, maybe, complaint to the reception desk upon departure and he did not give us any feedback to us about this issue. Otherwise, staying one whole night and morning till checkout was well enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Content: location and service is amazing. pool and spa are top notch .. nothing like waking up to the sun coming up over lake michigan and your in the hart of city

Reviews.Title: “TRUMP IS A MUST”
Reviews.Author: Irish0418
Reviews.Content: I've traveled extensively and have never felt compelled to write a review until now. If you're considering a luxury hotel in the heart of downtown Chicago, look no further than the Trump Hotel. I could go on and on about my experience but there are plenty of other comments that accurately describe the hotel as one of the best in the world. The place is pristine. But what did it for me (besides the luxurious amenities and breathtaking views) was the service by the staff. From the doorman to the front desk staff to the maintenance staff, everyone makes you feel special and at home. In fact, many remembered my name throughout the stay which really impressed me. I am very picky and I can honestly say that every single one of my expectations was greatly exceeded by Trump. So if you're on the fence about Trump, take my word for it and go. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Truly the best”
Reviews.Author: elzny
Reviews.Content: I would've given it a 6-star if that's available. I've wanted to stay at Trump for the longest time. When it first opened in 2008 I tried to stay here but couldn't. After that it was either sold out or something, I just was never able to come here. So my review could be a bit biased cause: 1. I was eagerly anticipating the visit; 2. Some of the meetings on my trip this time got shifted around so I actually had time to check out the amenities. So here's the list: 1. Staff are friendly & courteous & professional and eager to help. I got a super nice room on high floor facing the lake. Such a treat. Especially this trip I actually had some time to spend in the room instead of just crashing. Concierge can print your boarding passes for you. Super nice & convenient. 2. Pets & children friendly - I've seen staff walking a super super cute bull dog, and couples pushing strollers around. 3. Room decor & lobby are contemporary. The entire hotel feels very new since it only opened in 2008. It has a residence attached. There's a TV in the middle of the bathroom mirror, which is pretty cool. 4. The spa is AWESOME. I didn't do the menu thing, I just chilled out at the gym and spa area. You've gotta try that funky shower that has like 10 shower heads and with music & almost a light show. Although, to be honest, with so many shower heads spraying water at you, good luck keeping your eyes open to seeing the lights changing color. I suggest stepping back & look at it & take it all in before taking the shower. It's a very spacious shower stall. In the locker room there's a steam room & a sauna. You can really relax in there. There's also a lap pool - so bring your practice suit & googles... I did a yoga class as well, there are 2 studio rooms in the gym. Very nice. Yoga class is $30 per class. I didn't bring gym clothes and the staff at the spa loaned me some even though they don't normally provide such service. Really helpful. 5. Location is at the southern tip of Michigan Ave. It's a bit tucked away comparing to the Ritz & the Four Seasons. But I didn't care so much for shopping. Within 5 blocks of walking distance there are tons of restaurants & shops. Also close to the L - 5min walk to the orange line if you need to go to Midway to avoid rush hour traffic, same with blue line to O'Hare. Also there's a Dunkin Donuts right across the street & a McDonald's around the corner if you don't want to order room service for breakfast. 6. I also checked out the business center even though I have my own laptop. It has 2 terminals & printer & fax machine. THe hotel offers free internet. 7. I didn't have a car so I don't know about parking. Funny that whenever I think of Mr. Trump I think of that hair flip & the little fish mouth saying "I'm the best. The Best, the Best, the Best..." I've met him in person & he's exactly as on TV. So I tried very hard to try to find something negative but it wasn't easy. I have to say he does hold himself to a very high standard. If I have to pick a bone, the negatives are: 1. lighting in the room are low, same with bathroom. The lighting is too low to do makeup. 2. TV program system is SUPER annoying. But I'm not a big TV watcher so it's OK. Basically the response to the remote is very slow, and the TV guide is always wrong. 3. Room is a bit dusty. Highly visible on the black marble counter top. Overall it was an extremely pleasant experience. I'll only stay here if I come to Chicago again. It definitely beats the out-dated Ritz & the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Night at The Trump”
Reviews.Author: DT_10London
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a night at The Trump in February 2010, and we got engaged that night. We had an amazing nights stay. I requested a high floor king room, with a view of the river and downtown. We were given a lovely room, facing out to Lake Michigan, over the river and downtown also. The room was beautiful and huge, with a stunning huge bathroom, with amazing tub and TV in the mirror. We were given an amazing mini bar and lovely robes. We had a massage at The Spa, which was incredible and sooo luxurious. We then returned to our room where I surprised my wife with a proposal and champagne. The hotel had been excellent at providing everything I needed for the proposal. We would definitely stay at The Trump again. It is the height of luxury, with stunning rooms, views and amenities. Nothing is too much trouble and you really feel like you are royalty when you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: fjoerd
Reviews.Content: Wonderful and very spacious appartments with an immense "feeling good factor". The furnishing is of very high quality, not oppressive, but rather light, decent and comfortable. The electrical equipment is marvellous. Flat screen TV, Stereo with ipad station and perfect sound. In the bathroom there is an integrated TV screen in the mirror and brilliant sound as well. A set of candles and different light instellation possibilities are ensuring aditionally best comfort. Even in the shower there is a choice for multiple uses. The service in the entire hotel is brilliant. Not to forget the view at the beautiful city of Chicago, which is breathtaking from whereever you are in the building.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service.....2 small complaints (being very picky)”
Reviews.Author: ajgold
Reviews.Content: It was fantastic....the service was exceptional....every staff member we encountered was very friendly, helpful and attentive. Our only complaints (and they are small ones)....lack of water pressure in the spa suites and.....lol....horrible quality toilet paper!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Paul D
Reviews.Content: This is a truly great hotel. We stayed over spring break for a combination business and leisure trip. Our suite was fabulous--very comfortable for us and our two young children. The hotel really catered to the kids, providing them with food baskets and other welcome items when we arrived. We have stayed in a lot of hotels/resort suites with our children, and this was probably the best arrangement we've had. The restaurant and room service were excellent but pricey by Chicago standards; we worked around it by taking advantage of nearby restaurants and sharing the meals from room service. The view was excellent, providing the children with the choice of looking at Navy Pier, the el, or boats on the river. In addition, the pool was a perfect late afternoon option for working off pent-up energy.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn007
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent two nights at the Trump in October. Like, Nita W., this is not the typical hotel we can afford, but we chose to splurge. What a treat. We had a beautiful view of the river, the weather was gorgeous, and there was a full moon...a photographer's paradise. We were delighted with the kitchen area. In fact, we were delighted with almost everything. There is just one thing I missed. I would like to have had a restaurant similar to the Pierrot Gourmet at the Peninsula on this property. Other than that, this was memorable. I'm glad we made this choice.

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way”
Reviews.Author: Nita W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our 12th anniversary. From the moment you pull up till the moment you drive away, you are treated with so much respect and courtesy. We were given an upgrade to our room...which was such a nice treat. This is not the typical hotel that we could afford, so we were extremely nervous about splurging over $600 for just one night. But we were extremely happy with our room and only left it to go eat dinner at Sixteen. Nothing about this place is cheap so be prepared to have sticker shock. Worth the money for celebrating a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: janinemckall
Reviews.Content: My son and I travelled to Chicago at the end of August for the first time and booked this hotel on the basis of the reviews we had read on tripadvisor. We were not disappointed! We arrived at the hotel to find that there had been a mix up about our reservation; however, the hotel immediately apologized and upgraded us.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Marathon Weekend”
Reviews.Author: suzyque4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump for three nights over the Chicago Marathon Weekend. We actually had three different hotel reservations as we were concerned about location, getting to the start, and cost. We decided to cancel the other reservations and splurge. (I had stayed one night before at this hotel so knew it to be very nice.) The preceding week, I had been contacted by the staff at the Hotel asking if there was anything they could do for us. I expressed my concern at that time about getting to the start of the race and was connected with the Concierge staff who explained the "el" train stops. She also mentioned that last year they had run a free shuttle, but she was not sure if they were doing it again. She took my email address and said they would contact me when they knew about the shuttle. A few days later, I received an email confirming that the shuttle would be run! The service at this hotel is flawless, in my opinion. We have stayed at many wonderful hotels all over the world, and this is one of the best. The location is fantastic. Ask the concierge for directions out the back of the bldg to get to Michigan Ave. in a flash. (There is a McDonalds right out the back tucked away for easy convenience if you are in a hurry or do not want to spend $35/person for breakfast, although you should definitely try their breakfasts.) Upon check-in we were upgraded to a suite with two bathrooms and separate bedroom. Everything was absolutely first-class. Turn-down service was wonderful. If we called for something, I was greeted by name and up it came immediately. The food at the restaurants was fantastic, with very excellent, but not stuffy, service. It is amazing what a difference a genuine smile makes when being greeted or waited on. The mgmt of this hotel must be doing something right because I know it cannot be easy to hire employees with such qualities. The Saturday night before the race we went to The Terrace (outside) for a drink. We had a bit of wait, but it was worth it because it was very warm, very lovely with the landscaped prairie grasses blowing and the view of the Chicago landmarks. As a bonus, we had a perfect view of the lake through the buildings, and there was a spectacular firework show from Navy Pier (better than the Fourth of July!) Yes, it is pricy up there, but you get what you pay for. I will NEVER forget sitting up there in that setting. We enjoyed a wonderful dinner at the Michelin-starred restaurant the night of the race. The service again was excellent, although the kitchen got a bit behind. Not sure about the Michelin star as I have eaten at other Michelin-starred restaurants, and this was just a bit off that night. Maybe they were having a bad night... The only weird thing about it was the couple sitting catty-corner from us was an obvious young "escort" and a man my husband's age making kissing face. After a few glasses of wine, he couldn't keep that up though, and they left before we did. During our stay, my daughter also was treated with special race menu options, epsom salts, and race day snacks and water and gatorade. All in all, it was a fantastic weekend, and I cannot wait to go back without worrying about the Marathon!

Reviews.Title: “Not really a 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: monty36
Reviews.Content: We were a Mom and 15 yr. old son spending a weekend night at the hotel. I called 2 days before and got a very attentive reservationist who suggested a slightly more expensive room with a sofa bed for my son. He said it would all be made up for him and asked if there were other preferences, very attentive. However, I don't think the staff ever got the memo. We were out later and returned and I was already in bed reading when he went to go to bed and nothing was made up or no linens in the room. It was late to call someone to do this and we just made due vs. having the staff come in so late. We had already let them know in the afternoon that the refrigerator was not working, the motor was very loud or breaking, and they were to fix it while we were out and we returned to find it the same. The engineer came up and finally just turned it off. The next morning there was no hair dryer in the room and they delivered one, but it also did not work right, the heat didn't work. It just seemed like a lot for a 5 star hotel and the price. They did cover our breakfast at checkout as a comp for the problems, but I am not sure that was really enough. It is a beautiful hotel, the decor and details, the views and location. The staff for the most part was very attentive. It has a great kitchenette. The bed was very comfortable. I think our problems related to housekeeping/maintenance. Oh.....and the bathroom door......I don't know what they were thinking, it is a glass panel that slides 2" from the wall and does not stay closed. NO privacy at all. If you want a private bathroom, or a door that closes, this is not the right place. Also a little awkward for a 15 year old son.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: MomJill
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 includes 2 girls ages 7 and 9. We stayed in a suite and this was the best place we've ever stayed! We travel extensively and were coming back to the states to visit my husband's family near Chicago. The hotel, rooms, breakfast and service were second to none!
