The location is also superb - within 5 minute walk to shopping and surrounded by great restaurants. We could see the river and lake from our room. We also used the water taxi which is right outside the hotel to get around one day. We will stay here from now on when visiting in Chicago! Couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “The High Rating is well reserved”
Reviews.Author: aa6nz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent Easter Weekend at the Trump Hotel in Chicago. This building has two parts a hotel and residences. However, both parts are completely seperate except when you go to the gym as the residents appear to have access also. It appeared that many Europeans have a residence there as I heard a lot of foreign tongues. It added an air of a World Class Hotel to the environment. Check in was very nice, very professional and I was greeted by first and last name. We had the Brunch at Sixteen on Sunday and the food was very good and the service was excellent. The following day, breakfast was also at Sixteen and that was very good also. The service was excellent, the training at the hotel appears to be excellent as the level of service in the Spa, Sixteen and check-in reflected a level of service that one would expect at a 4-5* Hotel.My room was on the 13th floor and overlooked the Chcago river, Navy Pier and Michigan Ave which was beautiful day and night, so much so I slept with the drapes undrawn as a result. Little touches I noticed that set the hotel apart; 1. Warm towels upon check and cold water 2. Umbrella's for use when raining, at the front desk and in the room. 3. You never touch a door, the doorman always open the door for you. 4. Sentences for service end with, " at your pleasure". Now the location of the Hotel is off of the start of the 'Miracle Mile" so all of the stores on Michigan Ave or Rush street are North of the hotel. Nordstorms is the closest and is 1 1/2 blocks away. There is a little street that connects the hotel with Michigan Ave and sometimes a little Riff Raff hang out there asking if you would like a shoe shine? However, I noticed that the hotel had security camera's and a few seconds after our shoe shine solictation, a security person from the hotel passed us and appeared to be looking for that person. Once in the hotel and in the front of the hotel, security and safety took over. I have stayed at the Pennisula in Chicago and I have to admit that it is a fine hotel, however I feel that Trump Chicago is a much better value. So much so I have booked another visit for the up coming Holidays. Check out the Trump Chicago..." No Birth Certificate Required" :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel! Will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: fijichick
Reviews.Content: Living in the Chicago suburbs, I've stayed at this hotel twice in the last year for quick getaways in the city and I will definitely return. The staff aims to please here. At check in, they give you a warm towel for your hands and kids receive a Trump backpack with a stuffed animal and a baseball cap inside. I don't really enjoy corporate advertising, but the kids enjoyed the goodies. On both visits (one with kids, one without), we stayed in a suite. I don't recall the floors but the rooms were high enough to have great views of the Chicago River and a partial view of Lake Michigan and Navy Pier. Floor to ceiling windows maximize the view. The beds are phenomenal. I've stayed in many high end hotels and these beds and pillows were top of the line! I never wanted to leave that bed. The bathroom is granite throughout and quite nice. In the smaller suite, the tub was contained within the shower. In the larger fireplace suite (fireplace wasn't real), it was separate. My kids enjoyed the TV screen that was contained within the mirror. I thought it was an inconvenient location and made it difficult to see in the mirror. My biggest disappointment with the rooms were the towels, robes and toiletries. I really would have expected higher end from Trump Tower. The towels weren't that large, nor were they very plush. The toiletries seemed like something generic with the Trump name on them. The toiletries are something I look forward to trying at higher end hotels, so this was a big disappointment. I did enjoy the kitchenette feature in both rooms. Very convenient. You have to access the pool through the spa (which smells wonderful!). It was a bit on the small side. Having cold water with lemon slices available was a nice touch though. The concierge couldn't have been better. The staff goes out of their way to make families with kids feel comfortable, but I didn't want to take my three kids to the hotel restaurant on a Saturday night. Although they are well-behaved, I never want to take the chance of disturbing other diners at a high end establishment on a Saturday night. The concierge was helpful with recommending a more kid-appropriate, non-chain restaurant with food and drinks that the adults could still enjoy. On our visit without kids, my husband and I really enjoyed the hotel bar (blanking on the name). The martinis, while a bit overpriced, were fabulous and the views made up for the price! We did try the hotel restaurant for breakfast with the kids and I have to say, we did not like it at all. We really appreciate well prepared food and this was not it. I would think breakfast would be a tough meal to mess up, but I was wrong. We like to stay at different hotels when we head into the city, so while I may not rush back to Trump Tower, I would definitely visit again, and recommend it to out of town friends.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on expectations”
Reviews.Author: Jordan N
Reviews.Content: The best part of the hotel is the location. We were upgraded to a Spa Room, which means there was a spa-style bathtub. I don't have a frame of reference, but I'd like to think it was the best view in the hotel, if not the best view in Chicago. Plus it gave such easy access to everything to do in Chicago. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The beds were great as well. The TV in the bathroom mirror came in handy for watching TV while relaxing with a hot bath. Other than that, it's just kind of a novelty item. I was kind of.....surprised by the furniture choices. All of the furniture (TV stand, night stand, coffee table, etc) were basically Ikea furniture, but with glass tops stuck on top to give it a slight upgrade. Nothing wrong with Ikea; I own plenty of it, just kind of surprising that they went that route. No one really uses that type of furniture, so it's really irrelavent. It was great that our room had a complimentary umbrella during our stay, because it rained all weekend. That didn't stop us from walking everywhere and seeing what we could see. We took a long (45 minute) walk to the Lincoln Park Zoo, which is the oldest zoo in the country and also FREE! It was nice and very intimate. Much larger than I expected. Millinium Park is only about a ten minute walk from the hotel, as is the art museum. If you want to try a bus tour or water taxi, you can board right outside of the hotel on Wabash St. I'm not sure if the hotel was financially worth it for Trump, but the experience was worth it for me, so that's what matters.

Reviews.Title: “Long on Style - Short on substance”
Reviews.Author: RaiDoc
Reviews.Content: Overall dissapointing three day stay. Beautiful Hotel with great show and promise but when one scratches the surface its mostly style and not substance. Examples abound, from the fact that the slippers are for tiny female feet, the bath robes for size zeros, the towels barely average in quality and size, the TV with the worst channel selection I have seen for 20 years, the amenities that need a pair of pliers to squeeze, the minibar that gets charged on your account for the prior guest consumption, the room that is set up for a family with kids when you check in as a solo business traveller, the "we have a wonderful city view room" that actually is not of the downtown city but of the industrial suburbs and the list goes on....

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Rooms are first class, views of Lake Michigan and the Chicago River, great food, even the sandwiches are top of the line. Held a conference there and the place was fisrt class all the way.

Reviews.Title: “It ain't a Trump if it is a Trump”
Reviews.Author: Bobijntje
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 5-day fun stay in Chicago. Before we went there I needed to make a choice from many excellent 5 star hotels in Chicago and finally I choos Trump. Why? Because The Trump Hotel made me the best impression as an hotel where childeren are welcome (I was travelling with my daughter). I have been in many hotels from 3 to 5 stars and most of the time the hotels are not very comfortable with childeren. As Trump International Hotel and Tower made the best impression to me I choose them altough we European are always a bit afraid of too much gold & and trumpness :-). But what a suprise! We arrived on a Saturday for a 5-day stay and the first suprise was that we got an upgrade from our booked Spa Suite to a Suite on the 20th floor with a magnificent view. When we arrived there was a special bathrobe, matching slippers and milk and cookies for my daughters which is a great welcome after 16 hours of travelling for an 7 year old! The Suite was around 140 m2 big and had a separate sleeping room, 2 bathrooms (one with bath) a kitchen and a big living room with a fire place. The Trump Hotel and Tower is situated near to the Wrigley building and the Magnificent mile so great for shopping an see all the high lights from Chicago. Instead of kitschy gold (which we Europeans often think when we hear the name Trump) the whole hotel was nicely decorated in a chique and modern way. The dining room has a impressive chrystal chandelier. Unfortunately the weather was not good enough to sit on the terrace but if you can, you will experience a wonderfull view which we could only see from Restaurant 16 indoors. Anyway it was still impressive. We went for dinner in Restaurant 16 and where impressed by it's amazing wine card. The people from doorman to chamber maid are friendly and interested. They are willing to help you out (from hairdresser, thank you christopher, and shop). Just ask! And they will tell you the inside tips from Chicago you do not read in the Travel books. All the people where very friendly to my daughter and she even got al little bit spoiled with candy ;-). So summerized: if you are looking for a high class 5 star hotel in Chicago on a perfect place and is child friendly, I can recommend this hotel wholeheartedly. Also for dinner the Restaurant 16 is great. The only tiny thing I can suggest is a bit more variety is the breakfast. The breakfast was very well but sometimes you just wanted to eat brown bread with chees (but that might be a Swiss/Dutch thing ;-) .

Reviews.Title: “The BEST in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: BrightonBelleUK
Reviews.Content: Can not fault the Trump, service amazing, staff attentive, rooms spacious and well kept. Walking distance to virtually everything and the Architectural boat tour starts in front of the hotel (highly recommended!) I think Trump is perceived as being expensive but on comparison is often cheaper than the likes of the Ritz Carlton / Park Hyatt and the rooms are twice the size. Great value for money

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bob5554355
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay the hotel was nice and the hotel front desk people gave me 5 extra pillows even tho my room already had 4. I'm defiantly coming back here!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: regent7
Reviews.Content: This truly is a first class five star hotel situated in the heart of downtown Chicago. My room was spectacular with all the amenities one could ask for. All modern designer touches throughout and just a real pleasure to relax in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisitely Trump”
Reviews.Author: MiquiP
Reviews.Content: Trump Chicago - it was erie to almost see it destroyed in the film Transformers: Dark of the Moon - but happily on my second visit it was still standing beautifully as the first time a year before. :) Ivanka and team are to be commended. The design, staff and location are all perfection - my room always facing Lake Michigan, Chicago River and the gorgeous Wrigley and Tribune Buildings right outside the window - dreamy! Staying 6 nights my first visit and 4 my second was a true blessing, and high level of privacy, 5 star service and cuisine was quite consistent. I enjoyed the lap pool and spa / gym, the restaurants and bars for breakfast, lunch and dinner with lovely results each and every time.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful rooms but”
Reviews.Author: Sandra04
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the Trump hotel in Chicago. The rooms are beautiful, spa is amazing and the staff is super friendly. I only have two complaints. First, the thermostat does not work such that it gives you the illusion you can control the temperature but not at all. It is centrally controlled somewhere such that they had the AC blasting all the time. I had to call the front desk twice this morning to turn it off. Then I go to lunch and come back and the AC is blasting again. I woke up with a cold this morning and I think the AC being on all night was to blame. The second complaint is the lack of lighting. The whole room has soft light but I am here on business and so I need more reading lights. I have to sit on the bed to get enough light to read. The light around the sofa is useless. I like the hotel but I will not stay here again if I can't control the temperature in my room.

Reviews.Title: “It's All ABout The Four "L's"”
Reviews.Author: mkgssong
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Trump Property and it will not be our last. We all know about the the three "L's", but this property is nothing less than the Four "L's" . Luxury and Location Location Location! What a fabulously luxurious property that postions itself on the Chicago River and respectfully shares the skyline with historically beautiful architecture. That is the outside, and the inside is nothing short of genuis of comfort thought. IT has all of the bells and whistles plus new ones I didn't even know that I would enjoy. It is simply a beautiful stay,limited effort, and extreme comfort. The beds are very comfortable, and pillows are available in different fragrances that allow for the easing of stress,encourage calmess and I could go on simply on that subject. The bathrooms are spacious, well appointed and have double sinks with a TV in the mirror..I didn't know that I would enjoy this, but hey, while you are indulging yourself in an oversized tub you can watch tv too. The closet are oversized with lighting, the rooms are oversized and housekeeping is thoughtful, oh I could go on and on. THe hotel itself is stunning, the food expensive, but worth every bite. This was an extraordinary experience and worth it! Location,Location,location...easy access, safe area,walk your tootsies off and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Lose the Designer Water Bar”
Reviews.Author: tarrytown54
Reviews.Content: Donald Trump fails to amuse me. Many of his business ventures have failed: does anyone besides me remember the Trump Shuttle? His television program is juvenile. Serious businesspeople do not bellow â€˜Youâ€™re firedâ€™ at underperforming employees, because todayâ€™s underperforming employee could be tomorrowâ€™s potential customer. No man living under my roof would be allowed outside with a hamster pelt glued to his scalp. So I was not pleased when My Dearest booked us into the Trump International Hotel & Tower for a Chicago business trip. Still someone must be the supportive spouse in this marriage, so along I went! Our arrival was not auspicious. The doorperson did not seem to grasp that, as arriving guests, we had luggage in the trunk of the taxi and that it was his job to unload our luggage and get it into the hotel without fuss. Instead, confusion reigned, and I wasted several minutes explaining to the doorman his job and supervising to make sure our luggage was not gifted to another guest. Minutes from my life that I will never get back! Where was Mr. Youâ€™re Fired when I needed him? The hotel reception area is a cramped space that also serves as the main entrance to one of the noisy hotel bars. The stupidity of this set-up was breathtaking. When we arrived the lobby was swarming with ill-dressed bar patrons and we had to battle our way through them in order to reach the reception desk. (Chicago people: Mr. Trump thinks himself an important man, so donâ€™t show up at his fancy hotel dressed like youâ€™re dropping by the neighborhood sports bar.) Circumstances improved when we reached the reception desk and were greeted with hot scented towels and efficiently checked in. Our room was spacious and furnished in a masculine style with chunky modern monochromatic furniture done in shades of black and dark gray. However, everything was comfortable and the room had lots of nice features: plenty of storage space, lots of power outlets, good lighting, nice mirrors, and a Nespresso coffee/espresso maker. The view was pleasant enough, although Chicago looks much better from a distance than it does up close. People, is it too much to ask for you to tear down some of those ugly buildings from the 1950s? The bathroom was large and well equipped with heaps of towels and bracing water pressure in the shower. I liked the separate his and hers sinks and the enormous mirror. The room was clearly designed to massage a Master of the Universe ego, so there was nothing cozy or charming about it. The toilet ran endlessly. I was hoping that housekeeping would notice this when cleaning the room and call maintenance to fix it. My hopes were in vain. The room had a designer water bar featuring bottles of uber water ranging from $10 to $20. Mr. Trump, do you think your guests are idiots? City of Chicago water is not appealing, but, if you think I am paying $20 for a bottle of water, another thought is on your way and will, after it burrows through the hamster pelt, arrive in your cranial cavity soon. There was a pillow menu that I could not be bothered to read. People, please!! Just put quality pillows on the bed, and if I have an issue with them you will be the first to know. My Dearest needed technical help with his laptop, and guest services responded quickly and effectively. Kudos to them! I liked the room service menu. There were all the usual dishes designed to appeal to beefy businessmen choosing food without female supervision: steaks and hamburgers on steroids, mountains of fries, etc. But there was also an appealing selection of salads with a wide range of fresh ingredients. I (and My Dearest!) enjoyed these very much. Even better, they put the dressing on the side without being asked. A nice touch: the man who delivered room service wore white gloves! While the reception desk was efficient, there were several lapses in service. I used up all the tissues and housekeeping did not replenish them. Our good night, sweet dreams letter one evening was addressed to another guest. And the toilet continued to run. This is an upscale businesspersonâ€™s hotel. Itâ€™s not my style, but a stay here is hardly hardship duty. They need to focus less on non-essential frills and get the basics of good hotel service right. Doorpeople and cleaning staff who understand their jobs and perform them well are more important than pillow menus and designer water bars. Perhaps Mr. Trump should host the next season of his television show here and bellow â€˜Youâ€™re firedâ€™ at the slacker who is supposed to fix the toilets!

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mudandlumber
Reviews.Content: Don't care much for "The Donald" but love his hotel. Stayed here for a one night birthday celebration with dinner at 16. The hotel is gorgeous and the food and service at 16 was fantastic. The staff and amenities are what you would expect from a five star hotel. Nice location on the river and close to shopping. We recommended it to friends coming in from out of town for a Cubs-Phillies game and they loved it too.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking”
Reviews.Author: olivertrips
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. The staff was excellent. However two things surprised me....coffee was spilled on the rug by the housekeeping staff when removing the breakfast cart (a hugh spot) and was left their. When we came in for the evening we were shocked by this obvious big brown stain on the rug. The housekeeping staff had to have known they spilled it since it was so big. We had to call them to clean it up. And my flat iron disappeared from the bathroom....

Reviews.Title: “Trump Tower experience - fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne045
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Trump Towers for three nights in August 2011. The greeting at the Reception desk after an eight hour flight was so welcoming. I still havent worked out how the Reception staff knew our name before we had even checked in?? The warmed hand towel was a nice touch too after travelling. Our room was brilliant and we had our 20th wedding anniversary during our stay which was recognised by the hotel by placing a bottle of champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries in our room. The location of the hotel was ideal for sightseeing too. The only points that I would note as maybe needing attention was the service in the main dining room was a little adhoc and the breakfast menu could maybe do with being a little less fancy. Sometimes you just want toast!! All things considered I would definitely go back here - great stay

Reviews.Title: “Only the Trump's know how to do Hotels right”
Reviews.Author: AKCToronto
Reviews.Content: Your looking for a five star experience and you'll get so much more. The room and hotel is absolutely pristine and the bathrooms are luscious. The rooms are spaticious and the closets are large. We stayed in a room overlooking the river; with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the river and Chicago's hallmark architectural buildings was a delight, particularly at night with all the lights. If staying, you must head to the restaurant 16 (on the 16th floor) and take pictures on the terrace. You'll get such great views of the river, lake and city. My husband worked out regularly during our stay and the gym is unique because it wraps around the perimeter of the building, thus affording luxurious views of the city while treadmill running. Didn't try the spa - prices were steep but I'm sure their diamond massage is exactly as luxurious as it sounds, with a pricetag attached to match. I think it's commendable that this hotel appeals to vacationers, business minded travellers and familes with children. Everyone is welcome. The location is excellent - walking distance to the pier, Michigan mile and Mellinium park and endless restaurants and water taxi's. The concierge is informative and follow through with requests PROMPTLY, without repeat reminders. Turn-down service at night leaves you feeling a little more at bliss...they leave slippers by your bedside, bottles of water, turn on jazz and leave the TV on an aquarium channel. I won't ruin the total experience, you just have to walk through those glass doors to experience everything for yourself. It's just really really nice to be away from home and have a stress-free mini get-away; even if it's a 'workcation', it still feels stress-free than actually being behind your desk! I booked through Magellan vacations. I didn't find this hotel to be outrageously priced, relative to other hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTravelMan07
Reviews.Content: There is nothing negative that I could say about the Trump International Hotel and Tower Chicago. The service is outstanding. The hotel is beautiful. The rooms are luxurious and decadent. The spa, swimming pool and exercise facilities are top-notch. If you have any expectations, staying at this hotel, they will be exceeded. This was my third time staying at this hotel and each time was better than the last. Kudos to management and staff for delivering service quality and excellence each and every time. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Trump did not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: SamKCMO
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from a great two night stay at the Trump over Labor day weekend. This was my first visit to Chicago and I don't think I need to see any other hotels after staying here, Trump was awesome! I booked directly on the hotel website and found a 20% off of a two night stay special and reserved a city view suite (room 2326, 23rd floor). Personally I don't think the room could have been much better. The room was huge with a full kitchen, dining table, living room, two full bathrooms, and a separate bedroom. The room was very clean and well furnished! The fridge was stocked with drinks, and also had a Nespresso machine. The master bathroom was phenomenal. I'm very picky when it comes to hotel rooms and the room exceeded my expectations. The service was very good, the staff was obviously trained how to properly treat guests. Each staff member I encountered was polite and very eager to help. The only negative comment I have with regard to service is that Trump AttachÃ© did not deliver the pillows I ordered from the pillow menu (even though they confirmed the order via email). This wasn't a big deal to me, I'm sure if I had called they would have rectified the issue but I did not give them a chance, mistakes happen. We didn't have a chance to visit Sixteen but we did order in-room breakfast twice during the stay and it was very good. The staff didn't just deliver the food they arranged it on the table with a fresh cut flower! The hotel is in a prime location, we walked to Millennium Park, Navy Pier, Willis Tower. Michigan avenue is a block away and has tons of shopping/dining too. We didn't touch the car until it was time to leave, parking is a nightmare anyway. I would recommend letting them valet your car, I was going to do self parking but quickly changed my mind, the garage is very narrow and steep! My only regret is having to leave so soon, I could have spent a week in this hotel easily!

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a 5 star hotel worth...well, 5 stars.”
Reviews.Author: SConthemove
Reviews.Content: The fantastic service from Trump International Hotel began the week prior to my arrival when a representative called me to check if I needed anything before my trip to Chicago. The service continued from the time I stepped out of the taxi to the moment I checked out and came home. In my opinion, five star service is not only high end appointments and a beautiful building but the commitment of staff to provide an EXPERIENCE. From the bellman to the management staff encountered everyone was fantastic. Folks, if you get the chance, experience this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbug90587
Reviews.Content: My husband I and I stayed at the Trump Hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary this past weekend and had a wonderful experience. From the moment we checked in to the time we sadly checked out, every detail was thought of and not a trick was missed. We received a warm towel and bottle of water at check-in (although I felt a bit guilty taking it seeing as we drove all of 25 minutes to get there). A very nice bellman took us to our room and showed us the many amenities it has. Our room was a one bedroom suite with one and a half bathrooms, full kitchen and living area. The bathrooms are spacious and well appointed. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in and the views from our room were magnificent. Not a single employee walked by without saying hello and no request was unmet. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and I hope to be back again one day soon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay, we will be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: jbc1208
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 5th anniversary at Trump Chicago this weekend. It was the PERFECT choice for a fun, romantic, weekend in the city. The hotel staff and service was outstanding. Our suite had an amazing view, very comfortable bed, well appointed in every way, very quiet rooms. The location is perfect for walking to great restaurants, night life and shopping. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: TWGirl
Reviews.Content: This is a luxury hotel done right. Not quite there as the top hotels in Asia, but it's certainly a good try. Great location, spacious room with high end amenities, really nice bath (over-sized bath tub), free WIFI (!!!) and overall good service. The restaurant on the 16th floor has great food and an amazing view. Will definitely stay again if in Chicago. We particularly like the kitchenette in the room, where you can make your own tea/coffee, microwave leftovers (because with so many awesome restaurants in Chicago, you'll inevitably order too much food!). The location is also superb because it's close to everything yet somewhat tucked away from the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: maya09
Reviews.Content: I struggled to find a title that can accurately describe our experience. Many past reviewers are right on the mark with the positive reviews. We planned to stay at Trump Towers in 2010 for our 20th anniversary, but we were not able to make it, but were able to go for our 21st. We stayed in room 2504 - which had the view of the river and lake - with excellent views of the skyline - perfect day and night. This room was perfect - as well as the housekeeping and service. I will not repeat what others have commented on the overall service experience as the positive reviews are right on. I will have to comment on the conceirge service however. Every suggestion they made was perfect - from dining options to entertainment - they even went the extra mile to inform the company of the dinner cruise (Odyssey - which was excellent also by the way) that it was our anniversary and they made a point of making it special for us. Now I know that overall our anniversary was not a hotel headline, but the fact that the staff went out of their way to send up a card, champagne and chocolate covered strawberries and make an effort to tell the dinner cruise staff - is an example of the type of service that you will receive. This hotel is worth every penny - the best I have stayed in - so much so that when we go to las vegas I am thinking about checking out the trump hotel there verses the Wynn where we have stayed in the past. This is a bucket list hotel folks - if you are in Chicago - give yourself a special gift - stay here - you will not be dissappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Top in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Far_and_Away_4Us
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay at the Trump hotel. The hotel was very clean, well appointed, the location was terrific, and the staff was extremely gracious and accommodating. (especially Joseph (from Maine) at the front desk who checked us in and out, as well as the lovely housekeepers assigned to our room). Our room was large and very comfortable. Our two young children were treated so well and they loved every minute of it (from the robes and slippers to the stuffed animals to the cookie plates with their names written in chocolate) (we reminded them not to get accustomed to that kind of treatment ). Our room had a lovely view of the river and lake, and we even had a great view of the City's Wed. night fireworks. The pool was outstanding (and was one of the reasons we selected this property). While not cheap, we felt this hotel was a good value for what we received in terms of location, service and amenities. This is definiitely going to be our hotel in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: Justin K
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Wednesday-Sunday for business. Was expecting top-shelf and somehow they delivered something higher. I literally can't think of one thing to complain about. I raved to my friends and colleagues when I got home. The Trump is all details. Thursday morning it was raining....as I'm walking out of the room, for some reason I glanced to the left and saw a small closet door. I opened it out of curiosity and found an umbrella leaning against the wall right there. Perfect. Every night I came back to great music playing on the stereo, the TV was turned to the "fish tank" channel, and a bottle of water was waiting on the night stand. Looking forward to coming back in two weeks over Labor Day with my wife! Do not hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “This place trumps all others”
Reviews.Author: Mervmeister
Reviews.Content: Kudos to the Trump organization for erecting a magnificent building in a great location and training the staff to provide extraordinary service. When we frst arrived, we were greeted by friendly bellmen and receptionists who were courteous and efficient. Hot towels were provided each member of our group. Our room was ready early in the day and made available to us. The bellman, who showed us to our room, took the time to explain many of the features and amenities. Several times furing our stay, he went out of his way to help us. Our room was immaculate and had a beautiful view. The kitchenette was well equipped. Whatever we asked for was provided quickly and cheerfully. Follow up calls were placed to our room by supervisors who checked that our needs were met. Several supervisors went out of their way to introduce themselves and offer service. I have stayed in several luxury hotels but I have to say the service here is the best I have ever experienced. Free internet and coffee service in the morning were very nice touches. Bottled water was provided to our room every day or upon request in the lobby. Concierge service was very helpful. The hotel itself is a magnificent piece of architecture which stands out among the many other distinctive buildings in Chicago. From the moment you reserve a room to the moment you leave, you are treated like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Good but.....”
Reviews.Author: Joe S
Reviews.Content: This is a modern contempory hotel with very polite and helpful people at reception. Our room is spacious and comforatable but the bathroom lights are not bright enough for my wife to put on her makeup. In addition the hotel has only three elevators (not big) which result in constant lines (as many as 50 people) waitng for an elavator. The elevator frustration will prevent our return.

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing service EVER”
Reviews.Author: robinz1075
Reviews.Content: We have never been treated so well...anywhere! The staff was so incredibly friendly and accommodating. Never experienced such hospitality or willingness on the part of front-desk staff in all our travels. We wish we could LIVE there after our one amazing night!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Incredible Service and Awesome Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler34530
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, Trump International Hotel in Chicago is one of the best 5 star hotels that I've ever visited! The rooms are wonderful, the spa is great, and the Terrace restaurant is definitely a memorable experience.I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bvanc
Reviews.Content: Our suite was like a having an apartment in the city. Beautiful views of the river and the lake with a living room, full kitchen and separate bedroom. Great location and excellent service. We are from Chicago (in Baltimore now) but travel to Chicago often. We've stayed at several downtown hotels over the years and this one is the best to date. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: albatros63
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel 4 nights and had an outstanding time. We all were treated beautifully, the room was excellent and the hotel setting is perfect. Would recommend it to anyone. On completely joking side toward the hotel; please do not repeat the tiki bar theme on top of your hotel. In Chicago??! Come on!! You are fired!!! :):)

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: ShowmeRx
Reviews.Content: We had a great 5 star experience at our stay at Trump. It was so nice to see what great customer service is really all about. From the bellman that took our bags up, to the managers we would see in the lobby or the elevator, all the staff was very customer service oriented. It was my anniversary with my wife of 21 years. We spent some time in the spa having a couples massage. My therapist, Royal gave the BEST massage I have ever had. I would highly suggest that anyone wanting a massage in Chicago, go and see Royal, she is the best. My daughters loved the hotel and all the perks that come from spending 4 nights in the hotel. I also want to mention how great Christopher was at the concierge desk, he made sure that we went to the best restaurants that Chicago has to offer. We can't wait to go back again. Great job Donald Trump, on building a 5 star hotel from top to bottom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: DanW329
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel about half a dozen times over the past year for work, and they never disappoint. In terms of decor and ambiance, it is largely what you would expect from the Trump brand -- except that I have to give props to their staff, who are especially courteous, without being pretentious. The rooms are all very comfortable, and the fitness center/spa is absolutely tops. If you coming to Chicago for business or fun, this is definitely a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Surikata71
Reviews.Content: Hello, I would like to thank you for the very quick help employees Trump Tower Hotel in solving my problem. I forgot my bag and left the room to the airport. I found it up at the airport, so I called the hotel. Security staff found the bag and the hotel arrange transportation to the airport. PS: The Hotel is marvelous and service perfect. Thank you very much. Renata V

Reviews.Title: “July 4 in the City of Big Shoulders. Fantastic Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Toujourstraveling
Reviews.Content: We had a two-bedroom suite/apartment for two nights over July 4 -- with a perfect view of the Navy Pier fireworks. This hotel is perfectly situated -- great part of town, the bellmen were friendly and professional, the concierge helpful and available. The in-room coffee included Nespresso and a german brand of filter coffee that may be even better than Illy. The interior is crisp, modern, yet warm. We ate in the restaurant, which did not live up to its price and reputation. But that's a different review!

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL we've ever stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: artloverToronto
Reviews.Content: Although we have travelled extensively, I have never written a hotel review before. However, after returning from a wonderful holiday in Chicago I felt compelled to let others know what an amazing experience my husband and I had at the Trump. From the warm and welcoming check-in (thank you England and Erica) to the very last moment we left the hotel we were treated with respect and professionalism. ALL the staff go out of their way to do anything to make your stay comfortable and memorable. The concierge staff was very helpful with a package I needed to return. As well we were given a free upgrade and enjoyed all of the first class amenities in the room. The bed was sooooo comfortable and we enjoyed ordering from the extensive pillow menu. The pool, spa and exercise facilities are exceptional. As well, the elegant turndown service with the personal weather forecast and quote on a card was so lovely. We have stayed at other 5 star hotels before but nothing compares to the experience we had at this hotel. Thank you again to the amazing staff for helping to make our trip so memorable! We will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: Norcal-Saratoga
Reviews.Content: First time stay. Chose the Trump since they had rooms with two queens vs typical two double beds. Room had a stunning view of the lake and the city. The staff was extremely helpful and competent. The restaurant service/food/ view was particularly good. There were some stains on the furniture at the foot of the bed but otherwise rooms were clean. The bathrooms don't separate the toilet from the rest of the bathroom which is inconvenient with multiple travelers. I had a massage in the spa as part of our AMEX package. The therapist was very nice, but not very good--my only disappointment with the stay. I would stay here again, but Four Seasons would still be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great city and great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pokieman2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had been talking about a trip to Chicago for some time and decided to take advantage of Ontario's Family Day long weekend in February to do so. It was an opportunity to celebrate our anniversary and a chance to break up the long dreary winter season. What a great time! It was a little nippy so we looked for indoor things to do such as the theatre and the aquarium and some jazz at night. Great dining and great service. We know we have to return during the Spring or Summer to explore the outdoor venues and shopping, as well as the architecture. Look up and it's a visual feast! I'm so glad that we spent the three nights at the Trump Tower. I have so many positive things to say about this property. I'm really particular about things and The Trump Tower raised the bar in all areas for me.The views are spectacular and the decor is snazzy and at the same time really comfortable. The staff is trained with one thing in mind - don't just meet the guests' expectations, exceed them. To this end, they succeeded! We spent a lovely afternoon lazing about by the pool and the next morning we enjoyed one of the most delicious and relaxing Brunches of my life. At one point, looking out at the skyscrapers, from the massive bank of windows alongside our table, I casually remarked to the waiter that it was too bad they didn't have a foldout map of the skyline view so that you were able to identify the various buildings. His eyes actually lit up and he was so excited to tell me that such a fold out map existed and he would go and get one for me. His genuine pleasure in doing this for me as a guest was one of the memorable moments from this trip. It's not just about training the staff right. It's about hiring the right staff. The amount of pleasure that this person gave me was only matched by the pleasure he took in doing his job so well. I think that there are a lot of really nice hotels in the city of Chicago. However, the property is only as good as the service found within those walls. I really believe that the level of service is set from the top down. We encountered an issue with a noisy dog in the suite next to us during the second day of our stay. Due to circumstances beyond the staff's control, the solution became tricky and with a bit of prompting a very happy resolution was found, in the end. The managing director, Mr. O'Callaghan, was not present on that particular day and upon my return home, I sent him a very detailed letter regarding the incident, which he decided to follow up with a phone call and a letter, assuring me that the incident had provided an opportunity for staff training. Very generous compensation was offered at the time of our stay and additional compensation was offered at the end of our conversation. Mr. O'Callaghan was an attentive and discerning listener. His concern was genuine and his response was more than fair. During the last several months, I have recommended this hotel to anyone who is considering a trip to Chicago. I really can't imagine why anyone would want to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Business can mix with Pleasure at the Trump Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hahnje
Reviews.Content: My husband was attending a business meeting at the Trump hotel while I enjoyed shopping along Michigan Avenue. At check-in, the staff was professional and gave us cold towels and water (Chicago was experiencing a dangerous heatwave). Every morning water bottles and apples were available at the reception desk. In the afternoon or evening, you just had to ask for a water bottle, and the staff would pull it out of their mini refrigerator under their desk. We had a great room on the 27th floor, room 2770. To get to the correct floor, you have to insert the room key into the elevator control panel. When you first walk in, you immediately notice that there is a kitchenette with first rated appliances. It is stocked with all kinds of snacks and drinks... a new definition for mini bar. The bathroom is large and has a tub and a shower. The mirror even had a built-in TV with remote. So if you want to shave, brush your teeth, or apply your make-up, you can still watch your program. The room even had a digital scale. Our room had a king size bed, a love seat, chair with ottoman, coffee table, writing desk, and dresser with wall safe. With all this furniture, the suite was still spacious and felt bigger because of the super high ceilings. The view was amazing during the day and night! At night, the drapes are closed by using the wall switch. The lighting throughout the suite is adjustable. The room has a door bell and there is a switch to press if you do not want to be disturbed or if you need service. The only complaint I have is that the bed was hard; I am used to a softer bed. We just stayed at the Marriott in Glenview, IL and that bed was softer. But, everything else in the hotel was incredibly comfortable. At check-in, we were told that the hotel had free WiFi. It was very easy to log on to. The conceirge was quick to give dining and shopping recommendations. They were fully prepared to give you directions on where to go and how to get there and they gave you maps for each venue. We dined in Sixteen (on the 16th floor) and chose the blind taste dinner ($150/person). The chef picks all the meals. We believe that there were 12 gourmet courses. The meal was started by a complimentary Seafood Ceviche. Then a beet dish with 3 different preparations. Then a scallop dish with what tasted like Fois Gras. Then a Ravioli dish for me and an egg plant parmigiana for my husband. After the halibut course, we found out that we still had two beef courses followed by the cheese course, then two desert courses. Each course was beautifully composed on the various plate shapes. For each course, we had a different set of silverware. The dinner rolls were tasty, especially the orange white chocolate dinner roll (you have to tell them not to bring you any more). The service and the dining experience is something that we will never forget. We have eaten at Louis XV in Monte Carlo for $700 (no drinks) and the chef at Sixteen is better! A few years ago, we stayed at the Four Season Hotel in Chicago, and the dining experience was not good. You will be delighted with 16. We worked out in their fitness center and it is well equipped. It is good, but not as good as the Four Seasons in Maui at Wailea. They do have fitness classes for $30/person. I didn't take any because the times didn't fit, plus it seemed that it should be included like at the Four Season (more offerings). Some hotel fitness rooms are just another empty small hotel room with no view. The view from the Trump fitness room was floor to ceiling glass of the Chicago city landscape. Awesome! Each bike, treadmill, and eliptical machine was equipped with a tv monitor and you could plug in your ear phones. At the very end of the of the room is the free weight room. One negative...the self parking is very limited. If they are busy, it is very possible that you will not find a spot. This hotel while definitely frequented by business travelers also will meet the needs of the luxury seeking vacation traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and subtle luxury”
Reviews.Author: krisgia
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beat. Make sure to get a room with a river view, and you will find yourself glued to your window. I was fortunate enough to stay here due to an Expedia glitch. I was upgraded to a suite upon check in even though I had no prior stay here. I was a bit worried that I would be out of my league at this hotel, but I was treated very well. The check in was smooth. The lobby is small, and it fit the hotel's personality. I had drinks at both bars. I prefer the bar on the second floor due to its decor and layoIn the room there was an espresso machine that was very handy. Fresh fruit was delivered my first evening there along with a nice note. The maid service was outstanding. The rooms were very clean and all items were restocked efficiently. The drinks and food offered through the minibar were of high quality though expensive. The concierge was helpful in recommending restaurants. I found the bed to be the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The room was very quiet, and I never heard any hallway noise. This hotel is expensive, but it is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “best service ever”
Reviews.Author: mmt50
Reviews.Content: every time you asked for directions, dinner suggestions, best bakery they went out of their way to help when we would return they would ask how it was loved the room and service would stay again for sure

Reviews.Title: “In Chicago, don't stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: kathiegrundhofer
Reviews.Content: We recently hosted our daughter's wedding reception at the Trump. There are not enough superlatives to describe our experience there. Banquet food is often an oxymoron. Not at the Trump. Cocktails, wine, appetizers, entrees and even the wedding cake were the finest restaurant quality. The venue is spectacular with views on some of Chicago's grandest architecture and landscape features. All our guests staying at the hotel thoroughly enjoyed the accommodations which are spacious, elegant and well-appointed. Those staying with children were especially impressed by the welcome given young guests. In the end, however, the thing that sets Trump apart from all others is the consistent, extraordinary service from top to bottom. In this area, it is without peer. Without exception, everyone...doormen, reception and concierge, bellmen, housekeeping and guest services are not only skilled, but you get the sense they genuinely enjoy the role they play in pampering their guests. Finally, special kudos to events manager, Cyndi Rosenberg, who is nothing short of amazing...a master of coordination and diplomacy. Over the course of several months, she handled every request with style, confidence and grace. She was reassuring during tense moments and took a personal interest in every detail. She even made the whole crazy thing fun! She is a jewel and Trump is fortunate indeed to have such a dedicated and gracious representative. We are forever grateful to the entire Trump family who made our event so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: petros56789
Reviews.Content: In Chicago for dental convention...Bad first impression, had called weeks before to assure 2 beds, front desk didn't reflect the change, had to wait for 20 minutes while they worked it out, (awkward) rooms are nice, enjoyed the bathroom, the tub fills with aqua in a minute or two flat, turn down service is awesome, they deliver chocolates (best i ever tasted) and bottled water, had charges on card at checkout that we disputed....also a bummer.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice”
Reviews.Author: TryItAll76
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end the staff was all about service. We stayed here for 2 nights and my parents for 1 night. They upgraded my parents to a suite because it was their anniversary and gave them cookies and milk. Really nice touch!!! The views of the river side were great. Beds comfortable. We had a spa room which had the coolest bathroom. It was all very comfortable. The only snag came at the end when all the charges were supposed to be on my card but they ended up charging my parents for their room on their card even though I asked at check in and check out if everything was set up correctly. We ate breakfast at the restaurant which was quite delicious. Fresh fruit and juices and good eggs. Lunch was average with some different but good tasting food. Aside from that my wife and I still want to return very badly as this was one of the best hotel stays we have ever had here in the states. Their customer service reminds us of what we get in Asia where we spend most of our time. Fantastic and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: leilataminelli
Reviews.Content: The Trump hotel is really a perfect hotel to stay in Chicago! Position is perfect! The hotel is very very beautiful and the rooms are big and fantastic! The staff is simply perfect: very kindly, very helpful and professional. My stay was really a dream!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and view”
Reviews.Author: UniversalGC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Trump Tower in Chicago from July 15th-17th, This was a getaway weekend to celebrate my wife's 40th birthday. For the most part, my stay was excellent. We stayed in a Studio River view room on the 26th floor, and my wife and I both loved the room. High ceilings, floor to ceiling windows, great view of the skyline and the river, excellent bathroom and quality linens. We both found the bed to be too soft, but that is, of course, a personal preference. For the most part, the service was good but not a cut above as I was expecting. The staff takes pride in learning the names of their guests, and is a nice touch when executed correctly, but I was twice referred to as "Mr. Gordon", which isn't my name. Not a big deal in the grand scheme of things, but it was a little awkward. The facilities in the spa are excellent, although the massage i received wasn't particularly memorable. The "Deluge Shower" they have in the locker room is awesome. It has nine jets and the water hits you from all angles. You can control the temperature and the tempo of the water and change the color of the lights in the shower. I've never experienced anything like it and highly recommend it. The location is hard to beat. You have easy access to Michigan Ave and Millenium Park and restaurants galore are within walking distance. Once we learned our way around the area it became obvious just how good the location is. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxury hotel in Chicago. With that said we will probably give the Elysian a try the next time we travel to this area just for comparison's sake.

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way”
Reviews.Author: Stella55711
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at a very lovely hotel. Top notch service, great location - would highly recomend!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I stayed in chicago”
Reviews.Author: Tonee92
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay in this hotel. Very modern, clean, nice bed and the bathroom is to die for.pricey but worth it...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay Except for One Thing That's Easy To Fix”
Reviews.Author: LisaKnoxville
Reviews.Content: We travel to Chicago once a quarter and plan to stay at the Trump Tower from now on. the location is perfect and the view from my room, which I am looking out of now is sublime. The service has been super friendly and my room is decked out with well-thought out amenities. My bathtub is the nicest ever. It is modern with very luxurious spa products but has a homey touch with the shelf you can rest your juicy novel one while you soak. The pillow menu is fun and the choices of snacks and drinks in the mini-bar is eclectic in a good way. in short, the room is as nice as it gets. I love to exercise and was very impressed to see the Technogym weights and the yoga DVD included in the room. We have a spa room and there actually is room if you were inclined to workout in the room. I decided to take advantage of the excellent workout facilities and attend the spin classes that were offered. Sonya, the spin instructor, is as good as any instructor I have ever had. She is very motivating and her winning personality along with the super friendly people who regularly attend made me come back the next day. So here's my complaint: the temperature in the spin studio is almost unbearably hot to work out in. There is an extra charge of $30 to take the class so I am hoping that the management will use my $60 to buy some ceiling fans or even standing fans to help circulate the air in that stuffy space. I am hoping to see them when I come back in the fall!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, can't get much better than this!”
Reviews.Author: TusharSrivastava
Reviews.Content: At the very heart of downtown Chicago, this tower is an epitome of pure luxury and style. Spacious rooms and wonderful service at quite reasonable prices. Didn't try the spa but heard awesome reviews about it. In house food menu has plenty of variety and so does the mini bar. The apartment on top of the building (above the hotel rooms) are owned by wealthy businessmen and flamboyant sportstars. The experience is rich and unique! Like I said it doesn't get much better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: DogLover042
Reviews.Content: Our check in was smooth and we enjoyed the hot towels offered for our sweaty faces. We had in-room dining on the evening we arrived. The service was prompt and the food was delicious. We enjoyed various pillows from the pillow menu; the turn down service; the bottles of water; the one-touch lighting system and the electronic curtains. We also liked the spaciousness of the room and the floor to ceiling windows. I visited the spa on the first day of my stay and received a facial and massage that left me feeling refreshed and relaxed for my entire stay. I loved the luxurious size of the pool, as well. The location of the hotel is great. It's close enough to walk to Navy Pier, the Art Institute, shopping, etc. The service everywhere at the Trump was super friendly. We felt that we were treated like family. The concierge service was awesome. We were given passes for a restaurant so we didn't have to wait in line. We were pleasantly surprised by the in-room delivery of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries on our sixteenth Wedding Anniversary. Dinner at Sixteen was an excellent experience. The wait staff at Sixteen remembered our anniversary, as well. Happy Anniversary was written on our dinner plates. Lastly, chilled water was waiting for us in our cup holders when our car was brought to us for our trip home.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Barbiu
Reviews.Content: From the moment we drove up to the hotel, everyone we came into contact with seemed genuinely pleased and interested in the fact that we were staying at Trump International. We were meeting 3 other couples for a long weekend in Chicago (2 were from Baton Rouge) and the rooms were amazing. The views from The Terrace were spectacular, as were the views from our room. I loved the workout facility - again, amazing views. The Spa at Trump was a delight and my facial was especially relaxing. Mr. Trump really knew what he was doing when he chose this location for his Chicago property. Easy walking distance to shopping, water taxi and some of the boat rides are very close, and lots of restaurants in the area. I'd love to stay here again and again, but more of a special occasion price point for us.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely LOVED it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aimeelaba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Trump Chicago this past weekend. We absolutely loved it. Our room was beautiful (we loved the little kitchenette) and the staff is amazing!!!! Everyone we encountered was so professional, helpful and, most importantly, nice. We didn't have time to work out in the gym, or swim in the pool but we did take a look at them and they are equally amazing. We live in Chicago, but hope we have the opportunity to stay at this gorgeous property again soon.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star view, 2 Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: EcoRick
Reviews.Content: I gave this a 3 star rating only because of the valet that took handled our luggage both to and from our room. He was exceptional. The balance of the experience was less than average for the price we paid. We had a $750 king suite with a river view to take our granddaughter downtown for a play. The room itself was extremely nice. Great views and nicely laid out. The balance of our experience was disappointing. We had no turn down service and when the service staff arranged the pullout bed for our granddaughter, they did not provide a pillow or adequate blankets. The second bathroom only was provided with shampoo. No conditioner, no shower mat, nothing other than shampoo. The tub drain did not work properly while the shower drain clogged. The drapes that reveal the view we pay extra for, are electric and operate by a switch. Half of the drapes in the master bedroom did not open in the morning. When our granddaughter received her candy gift, not only did they spell her name wrong, they used a male name (isn't that what Trump fires people for!). We had to ask the service staff for towels when we called for the turn down service. We did not eat dinner there, but the lunches were expensive and not exceptional for the price. Bottom line, it became humorous for the price we paid. This is an annual event for us and we stay at the Fine Hotels in Chicago for this. This was by far the most expensive and most disappointing of all the hotels. They really do not accomodate children like the other Fine Hotels in Chicago (this comes from my granddaughter). I'm assuming we had a bad experience that occasionally happens. The worst part of all was how the manager handled this at checkout. She asked about the experience and obviously knew of the turn down mistake. When I briefly explained it got worse, she apologized and offered to cover the $25 balance of our breakfast. The breakfast we had would have cost $20 at an expensive breakfast restaraunt. The actual bill was $75 since we had a $50 credit coming as part of our Amex package. With this offer she only added insult to the the experience. Our total bill was over $1,000 for one night. I'm assuming other hotels would have handled this much differently. I'm assuming that the high ratings this hotel receives are probably warranted as most of the staff does seem to try hard. Mechanical issues like our blinds will occur. The way the other issues were handled simply does not match what I would expect from a Fine Hotel and one with the Trump name on it.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: TruthfulCritic85
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed a night at the Trump Hotel for a birthday celebration. This hotel was simply amazing. The customer service was awesome and the hotel was elegant, modern, and clean. Every time we walked into the hotel I was greeted by staff by then saying, "Welcome Mr. __________(my last name)". I have no complaints about this hotel and would recommend highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING! Favorite hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: kristenlovesmusic
Reviews.Content: This is the kind of hotel you fantasize about. It's like an upgraded Hilton. I love the modern-ness. Of course, it's expensive, but it's worth it. The location is perfect, right in the middle of the city. The service was wonderful and fast. One thing that blew us away was the 'pillow menu'. You could choose extra pillows! Scented, Neck, Shoulder, Therapeutic, WHAT!?! The bathroom was amazing and very clean, with a built in tv in the mirror. We had a great view of the river, and if a river view room is available, I recommend it. It's gorgeous and relaxing. If you want to go to Chicago just to relax, get a suite here and you're all set. It's great to come back and relax to, or to just stay home all day! I remember one day we got a complimentary chocolate truffle plate. I mean, who does that?! They were delicious, too. The mini bar in the room was great too. Expensive, but great. Almost anything you want. Anyone looking for a hotel in Chicago willing to spend quite a bit of money, Trump is your thing. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Palatial rooms; polite and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: PoshGirlNYC
Reviews.Content: We had a really great experience at the Trump Hotel in Chicago, and this review is long overdue. We were there for a weekend - Friday night to Sunday afternoon. The hotel and its staff were very kid-friendly, and my little one, who has severe nut allergies, was able to eat there safely. The kids even got little kid-sized robes - waffle-weave on the outside, terry on the inside - matching slippers and stuffed animals. The service was great, everyone was very polite and friendly, and the location was great, too. We walked to Millennium Park, Navy Pier, Pizzeria Uno, etc. Our one bedroom suite was HUGE - the microwave came in VERY HANDY, as well as all the plates and silverware. Best part was the Nespresso machine in the kitchen. Also great were the Lutron light switches and the fact that housekeeping rolls around these carry-on-type bags when they clean the rooms, so as to not block the entire hallway with a service cart of towels and toiletries. I haven't seen either of these in a FS or RC yet. Also nice, but not necessary, were the automatic drapes, the TV in the master bathroom and the multitude of closets. One thing that surprised me was the fact that my little guy's food allergies were not communicated to the restaurant or room service by the front desk. FS and RC both do this. Also, the cookies were a nice touch, but he couldn't - and didn't - eat them (his big brother enjoyed them instead). The onus is, of course, always on us to alert people to his food allergies, but FS and RC usually tell us as soon as we call for room service or walk into one of their restaurants, that they are aware of his food allergies. We stayed at this hotel a while ago though, so maybe the communication is better now. Nonetheless, as I indicated above, he was able to eat at the hotel quite safely.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May and it was great. We saw the rating on TA and after comparing price, location and amenities online, we decided to stay at Trump. We were willing to pay a little more to be comfortable and enjoy our leisure stay. Our room was huge. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was great and very modern. We loved the turn down. It was nice t come in to bed turn down, nice music playing. Room service was pricy but we expected that. The food was good and they were prompt. We were there about a week and they called us by name when we came down stairs. The concierge were extremely knowledgeable and helpful. Location was perfect. We walked every where. No rental needed. You have to go to the gym and the spa. Even if you not going to do spa services, take the tour. Check out the showers in the gym. If you're toning to stay here, you might as well enjoy the rest of the hotel. I have no complaints. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent service, incredibly chic... this is the place to stay in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Crimmy
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, the service we received was five star. All of the staff are very pleasant, polite and professional. You can tell that customer service is a high priority. When we checked in, we were given a scented hot hand towel - a nice treat and certainly needed after a long drive. Our room and the view were spectacular. We stayed in a corner suite which was quite spacious and well decorated. It was very chic and modern. It included a kitchen, generous living room space, and a large bedroom and bathroom. The bed was oh so comfortable - one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on in a hotel! Turn down service was excellent as was housekeeping. The room was immaculate. We appreciated the delicious chocolates that we received upon arrival. The location of this hotel is perfect. It's right in the middle of everything and is within walking distance to shopping, great restaurants, and other attractions. I can't imagine staying in another hotel the next time I'm in Chicago. This is a great place to stay for an extended vacation or even a night or two. The spa facilities are excellent and the pool was quite nice. My only suggestion would be for better shampoo, soap, and conditioner. Certainly the hotel can upgrade or partner with a higher end company for better soaps and shampoos instead of generic stuff that seems a tad bit cheap. Even if Mr. Trump's name has been plastered on the packaging it still does not make it a better product. Other than that, it's a great place to stay and well worth the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “My new Chicago Favorite”
Reviews.Author: ErikontheGO
Reviews.Content: Wow! What else can I say, from the great staff to the ideal location, the Trump is now my new Chicago-land favorite. The rooms are off the charts with the finest of luxury. The only, short-coming was with the speed of the elevators, I know it sounds funny, but it was the same in the last Trump property I stayed in (Miami, Fl) it seems the evelators are slow.

Reviews.Title: “Truly World Class”
Reviews.Author: Nomadralph
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 31st - April 3rd. Have stayed at five star properties around the world and this has to be one of the most satisfying stays I have experienced. From check in to check out the service, physical plant, and amenities are consistently superior. Pros: Check in clerk offers hot towels "garnished" with orchids. Concierge went out of the way to provide service. I wanted a late evening fast food snack. The concierge called local outlets to be certain they were open Room are completely furnished with outstanding contemporary furnishings to include full set of dishes, pots, pans, Sub Zero refrigerator, German dishwasher and cook top as well as a microwave. Bed is extremely comfortable with superior sheets and pillows. Turn down service was outstanding... the housekeeper repeated asked if there was something else we needed. Every hotel prints a boarding past; the Attache Service here printed one AND delivered it to my room!!! CONS Nothing Rates were quite reasonable during my stay although the regular "rack rate" is well worth it. Give yourself a treat and stay here when you next visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: Spartyhomer
Reviews.Content: Loved lodging at the Trump Hotel. Awesome rooms, great bathrooms, wonderful amenities, great service by the hotel staff, wonderful workout facility, breathtaking view of the Chicago River and Lake Michigan, and perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel with superior service!”
Reviews.Author: WstrnSkies
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all our expectations--our room had wonderful views of the Chicago River and nearby architectural gems. I have stayed in many hotels and the Trump excels in in service. I would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Setting a high standard for service and quality”
Reviews.Author: flyinmom
Reviews.Content: Well...I may not like to watch him on TV, but Trump does know a thing or two about providing outstanding service. From the minute you walk into the hotel, they remember your name, the service is discreet and outstanding, there is pretty much nothing you can ask for that you won't get. (To their credit, the Concierge was even able to obtain Oprah tickets when every other avenue we tried had fallen through!!!). I was down with a group of women for a couple of days of shopping and culture. Never have I had a group so unanimous in its praise for the service of the hotel. Mind you, it doesn't come cheap; although they were very willing to provide group rates for the rooms (and the group rate was excellent), any service or meal you have within the hotel is super high end. But...you get what you pay for. It is as luxurious a stay as anything you could ever ask for. In fact...we all liked it so much, we're going back for a second shot at it! If you're looking for some pampering, this is definitely the place to go (and to also get some of the best high views of the city!).

Reviews.Title: “One word: superb”
Reviews.Author: CyberguyPR
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the property in June 2011 for my 10th wedding anniversary. This is truly a wonderful hotel. If there is better service than this I would love to see it. During check-in someone quickly provided pink cotton candy and a Trump Kids hat to my daughter. Everyone addresses you by name and make sure you have everything you need. I took advantage of the complimentary shoe shine service and when they asked when I wanted them returned I said anytime would be fine as I was planning to be in the room all day. To my surprise they came back 20 minute later. I also asked for a blanket for my daughter and it was in my hands no later than 5 minutes after I called. The room is very modern and spacious. Open the motorized drapes, grab a copy of Robb Report or Luxe Source from the magazine rack and relax in the comfortable sectional sofa. The kitchen is great, featuring Sub-Zero and Miele appliances. For coffee lovers there is a Nespresso machine in the kitchen with 5 or 6 pods (bold, regular and decaf). You will also find the fridge has a wide variety of beverages ($$$) including beer, water, juice and a wide array of spirits. I ordered a small cake (4-6 people) which was exquisite and was surprised to see it show up along with 4 gigantic chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of champagne which were comped by the hotel due to our anniversary celebration. Bravo on free wi-fi. Even though it was rather slow I appreciate the fact that is is free. this should be standard everywhere. Another small detail that caught my eye was the elegant charcoal gray, Chinese collar uniform that females wore at the front desk. Loved it! I am not deducting stars but had the following issues to point out: 1. Front desk Asian lady had such a thick accent and spoke so softly that it was very hard to hear/understand what she was saying. 2. The elevator has a voice announcing "going up, going down" that was very annoying. We were in and out the hotel a lot and just got annoyed every time we heard the voice. Overall, superb property in a great location with breath taking views and amazing service. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf”
Reviews.Author: stevieNewYork
Reviews.Content: We generally stay at the Peninsula which is a great place but do to an error we stayed at the Trump. Great room, great service, wonderful amenities, first class in every way. Well done, kudos to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: LuvSLO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night while in town for an interview. I don't stay at many properties of this caliber so that's probably why I was so blown away. Still, I held the hotel to a much higher standard than any others I've stayed in. Check-in was seamless and I was escorted to my room by the bellman. The room was gorgeous and sort of resembled those at the Wynn in Las Vegas. It was a huge room, beautifully appointed and had a full kitchenette. I was impressed that the wireless internet was actually free to use and wouldn't cost me $12/day. Bravo Trump! The bathroom was also extremely spacious and had a very unique shower/bath tub layout with top-of-the-line fixtures. After settling into my room, I had dinner in the bar section of the fine dining restaurant. I waited too long for my meal and when it came out, it was not as I ordered. Feeling very irritated, I asked them to correct my entree and send it to my room since I had been waiting a while. They delivered the food promptly but it was only ok. I've eaten in many fine dining restaurants and was not impressed by this one. I had my shoes shined using the complementary shoe shine service and requested the morning paper of my choice. I had a fabulous night's sleep in the very comfortable bed, and used the fitness center in the morning. The fitness center, hands down, was the best equipped hotel gym I've ever used. They had plenty of hand weights and a Smith press machine which I used for pull-ups. It was great! My room was impeccably clean expect for right next to the toilet paper dispenser. There was a tiny brown smear on the wall which disgusted me because I can only imagine what bodily fluid could cause a small brown smear. Other than the restaurant and the smear, I was blown away by the hotel and wished I could have stayed longer. I felt very pampered.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: ShalS99
Reviews.Content: We are just returning from a four day stay at the Trump Hotel in Chicago. We have stayed at many 5 star hotels...Ritz-Carlton, Four Seasons, St.Regis, etc. None compare to the amazing service of the Trump Hotel! From check-in to checkout service was exemplary. Keep up the good work. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing level of service in an amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: FuenfsterneTiger
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at various 5-star-plus properties in the last few years, however, the experience at Trump International Hotel in Chicago surely ranks among the top stays. And this is only partly due to the fact that this recent addition to Chicago's hotel market is brand new and thus offers stunning architecture combined with all the modcons one would expect nowadays. Yes, the rooms are spacious, have spectacular views, are well designed and very, very clean. However, what sets this place apart from the crowd - and here the owners seem to have taken a leaf from "The Four Seasons" philosophy - is the spotless service provided at each and every point of the stay. Here, I would like to single out the excellent Concierge Desk staff - I have yet to stay at a hotel with as many "Clefs d'Or" concierges (the ones with the crossed "golden keys" on their lapels) on duty as here at the Trump. Their friedliness, their attention to detail, their knowledge of the ever changing city was absolutely flawless. Their dinner recommendations (and I am not an easy customer) were fabulous. I have enjoyed every second of my stay at this great hotel - and I am looking forward to coming back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Decor and good customer service”
Reviews.Author: supreeth007
Reviews.Content: Donald Trump and Evanka Trump try to give the best environment in all their hotels. Loved the room which was well equiped. Had a good night sleep ready for the meeting next day and eventually decided to invest with them.... Cheers to this great hotel

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel bad servic from front desk”
Reviews.Author: linamuni
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, pretty rooms but we couldnÂ´t sleep two nights due to loud music (didnÂ´t know were it cae from) we called frot desk, did not do much...at the check out we complaindes again and ericka at front desk just said "I am sorry..." easy to say....but when you are leaving the kids home to have a vacation, pay a five star hotel and want to have a nice rest, and donÂ´t get it , you expect they respond in another way . The should care about their guests experiences

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Experience”
Reviews.Author: LTtravelUSA
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Property is well cared for and the attention to detail shows throughout. Don't pass up an opportunity to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Location, unsurpassed views, and unbelievably quiet room”
