Reviews.Author: Frick
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I won tickets to Oprah's Surprise Spectacular, so I wanted to find a hotel to make the trip extra special. Each time we visit Chicago, I like to try a different hotel. Trump International had a special rate for a three-night stay and that's what convinced me to give it a try. We arrived in the evening, escorted to our room by a bellman who showed us the details of our room. When he opened the curtains (electronic, by the way), the view took our breath away. Little touches -- bottled water, a small card with a featured quote, slippers by the bed, a small box of fabulous chocolates -- all examples of Trump's attention to detail. I fell in love with the single-cup coffee maker and the coffee (choice of three varieties) was generously replaced, even in the evening. Hotel staff exceeded my expectations in regard to attentiveness and courtesy. I was concerned I might feel out of place since the hotel is higher than my budget normally allows, but from the front desk to the bellman to the cleaning staff, we felt welcomed and valued. The bed and robes are heavenly and if you need to get ready when your favorite show is on, simply turn on the TV that appears in the bathroom mirror. Speaking of TV, check out the Trump Channel and watch the Discovery Channel Show "Build it Big" which features the construction of the Trump Tower. Highly entertaining and informative! The only negative that comes to mind is counter space in the bathroom for make-up, etc. (especially when you're sharing it with your 20-something daughter). I like the fact that you have to use your room card to operate the elevators - made us feel safe and a little more special. Also, the room is so quiet, we never heard neighbors' doors opening and shutting like you do in most hotels. Another plus: free internet that works - something every hotel should provide. The pool is fabulous (even though we forgot our swimsuits) and was stocked with plush towels, refreshing cucumber water, and of course, Trump bottled water. I have stayed in close to 10 different Chicago hotels and this is the best by far. If you have a special trip planned to Chicago, splurge and stay at the Trump International Hotel and Tower. One last thing - today I received an e-mail from "Mr. Donald Trump" (okay, I know it's not from him personally), that asked for my opinion about my visit. Another mark of a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"The Perfect 25th Birthday"”
Reviews.Author: bambinaxo
Reviews.Content: I live in Chicago and had stayed at The Trump Chicago once when it first opened. I had a standard room and was blown away at the excess amenities. In most hotels, you need to book one of the more "elite" rooms to have a wow factor, but not at The Trump. Since I had such a great experience the first time, I decided to look into booking a suite for my 25th birthday. I explained to the concierge that I was hoping to have a small get together in the hotel suite. Upon arriving, I felt like a Queen. When I first walked into the suite, there was a birthday cake with a card, hand written from the GM. The suite had a guest bathroom ( complete with a TV in the mirror) a full service kitchen, fully stocked with numerous bottles of champagne, snacks, and other alcoholic beverages, a full living room and dining room, and master suite. The master suite had floor to ceiling windows with an AMAZING city view. The master bathroom had a huge double vanity, separate room for toilet, and full jacuzzi tub and separate shower. There was a separate "powder room" and of course, there were already robes and slippers laid out on the huge California King. The suite was also wired with surround sound, three plasma TVs and two ipod docks. I was beyond amazed at this room, and I was able to have a fabulous birthday. The Trump truly is about living a life of luxury. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone who is interested in seeing Chicago in style. I have been to both bars at The Trump, on this occasion, as well as others. The drinks are phenomenal and are all hand crafted, but quite pricey. The only negative thing I would have to say is that I was quite astounded at the amount they charged for incidentals. On a $750 room, there were over $350 in incidentals, which was insane. Also, they accidently charged someone's bar tab to my room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: Christiann52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for his 60th birthday and from the time we pulled up to check in until we pulled away, our stay was perfect. All of the staff were so friendly and helpful and surprised us on many occasions by calling us by name. We enjoyed a couples massage which was relaxing and romantic and dined at Sixteen for a delicious gourmet meal. They have spent time considering the traveler which makes too many small details to mention but which sets this hotel apart from the others. Another overnight will be in our near future. Fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service, rooms just good”
Reviews.Author: detroitmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Chose the Trump Int'l Hotel & Tower because it was across the street from a restaurant where we were meeting family. The service at this place was spot on. Literally five minutes after check in, the doormen, concierge and front desk staff was calling us my name. They handed my boys Trump Hotel, Chicago baseball caps on the way to the elevator and were gracious without being gratuitous. We were in room 1429, a spa room which means big bathroom I think. The room itself was done in a more contemporary way than I typically like - more like the Park Hyatt Chicago than the Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton. There were coffee stains on the end tables, but other than that, the room appeared clean and well kept. My absolute biggest issue with the room was the all the gadgetry. Never did figure out how to turn on or off the bathroom lights. The phone only worked as a speaker phone. Curtains open with buttons. A heavy, frosted sliding glass door to the bathroom that didn't shut completely. But back to the service - turndown was perfect, leaving popcorn, root beer and water. Upon leaving, the valet brought our car and it had four bottles of cold water, one in each cup holder. All inexpensive touches, but certainly nothing that I seen at the Park Hyatt or Four Seasons in Chicago. Room was $475 for a Sunday night in keeping with other hotels of a similar brand. After *many* contiguous nights at the PH and FH in the past, they had no idea who I was or cared to be bothered. Bring someone tech-savvy to figure out the room, or take the time to ask the bellman, and all will be good.

Reviews.Title: “Has the views and the service”
Reviews.Content: Great suite (900ftÂ²), booked through What A Hotel.com. Overall price ended up being very reasonable. We had the most fantastic rooms with views towards Lake Michigan a downtown. What A Hotel also provided some credit for hotel restaurant, which meant we paid almost nothing for breakfast during stay. The hotel has excellent spa/gym facilities. Pool is a decent size. Changing rooms well serviced. Concierge staff polite and friendly, particularly to our 6-year old. Thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection”
Reviews.Author: InternationalAhole
Reviews.Content: My husband had been staying at the Trump International for a few nights for business purposes before I decided to join him. He's a frequent guest at hotels with very high standards, so when he raved about the accomodations, I knew it had to be great and I was not disappointed upon our arrival. The hotel is located very close to lots of shopping, public transportation, good restaurants and even Union Station. The hotel is a 5 star and everything was absolutely luxorious. The spa was fabulous, the gym was great and the room was extremely comfortable. Free and fast wifi was great, wonderful selection of television channels, a DVD player, Boise system with an iPod attachment. Room service was great and fairly priced. Views were wonderful of the lake and every amenity was great and replenished often, even before we had run out. We always enjoy our time in Chicago, but the Trump International really made it a much more enjoyable and luxorious trip. The hotel is very big, and nearly every hotel employee remembered our name and greeted us whenever we passed. Although we didn't travel with children, we did notice that kids get a "Trump Kids" bag, which was filled with lots of little goodies. The front desk staff, the cleaning staff, conceirge and bellman are all top notch, and although I like to try different hotels, I'm going to stick with Trump as my preferred Chicago hotel. My husband left again this morning for another business trip with a stay at The Trump and I'm highly jealous. Also....you should definetly consider eating at nearby "The Goat and The Girl" which was fabulous dining and only a $5 cab ride from the Trump. Don't hesistate to book here, you will be very glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Chicago - great place to stay with children”
Reviews.Author: cosmokat
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Trump towers several times, but this was by far our best visit. I was traveling alone with my 3 boys 13, 10, and 4. Upon arrival they welcomed us with trump kid's clubs baseball caps. We had a suite which had a bedroom with a kingsize bed and then a living area with a pull out couch, full kitchen and, 2 bathrooms. The master bathroom has a tv built into the mirror and I never have had 3 boys fighting over who was going to take a bath next. The room was very spacious with great views and floor to ceiling windows. The kids arrived back from dinner in the evening to beautiful hand-dipped chocolate cookie creations with milk. They also have kids size bath robes and slippers. They have a great pool and a nice workout area. The staff is attentive and prompt when you ask for service. Previously, we would book at the Four Seasons, but since the arrival of Trump, we have been staying here and have been very pleased with the level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: TerriDougherty
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some of the nicest rooms I've ever been in. We had a room with a view of the Chicago River and Lake Michigan and the bathroom was all marble. The bed was comfortable and the resaurant in the hotel was great for breakfast. We were in Chicago to see the Cubs game and to see The Blue Man Group so we were just there for the week-end but it was a great trip. This hotel is so beautiful I highly recommend it if you're going to be in Chicago anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Plush, Sexy, Location ... Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: foodiehotelguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right on with what you would expect from a Trump Hotel. I will note that the decor is a bit "grey", but other than that, the room was comfortable and spacious. The staff was nice, and you could tell they were trying to provide that 5 star service, but it just seemed like they were a little hesitant. A good example is the extremely shy housekeepers. I would definately reccomend anyone stay here however.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at superior location”
Reviews.Author: Luk4000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and perfectly equipped with business center and gym. Service was friendly and efficient however one person at the front office failed to account correctly for the invoice which has been paid cash and thus 10 days later the amount was still on my credit card which resulted in a blocking of the card in the end. Besides that the rooms the rooms are spacious and modern, including a small kitchen and an extensive mini bar. Concierge service was one of the best I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Room, Stellar Service, Spectacular View!”
Reviews.Author: Vnyrdr
Reviews.Content: Decided on short notice to take my teenage daughters to Chicago for a 4 day weekend. Hotel availability was low and prices high due to a huge convention, but was shocked to find a room at Trump for $395/nt; no more than the Westin, so booked a Queen/Queen City View Studio. Upon arrival the bell staff and reception staff were very warm and friendly yet very professional. Whisked up to our huge 600 sq ft "room" on a high floor; extremely impressive with very luxurious furnishings, a kitchenette, and a beautiful bathroom. Perhaps most impressive was the view; a spectacular panorama of city, river and lake (not sure if this was an upgrade or just a magnificent city view!). The flawless service continued throughout the stay, and daughters loved the personalized pink stationary and 'in residence' business cards they sent up to the room. Concierge was very helpful in finding us tickets to the second city improv show, and even managed to add on additional tickets to a sold-out show when two friends decided to join us. Very impressed with this property; will definitely try to stay again when we return to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: KathleenMFl
Reviews.Content: Last trip to Chicago, I stayed at the Palomar based upon TripAdvisor's recommendations. I found the room cozy and the staff friendly/helpful. It was a block away from a conference I attended as well. The wine hour and breakfast were nice touches at the Palomar. This time, I decided to try Trump International Hotel. The location was far superior to that of the Palomar's with engaging views of the River and skyline. The architecturally striking Trump hotel was within walking distance of most attractions. Every convenience was at this hotel from a television in the bathroom mirror to a phone near the toilet (I didn't use either but think this would be appealing to most people). My only criticism was that the bed was too soft for me. Pillow service was available, but I did not use it. Morning gourmet tea and coffee were available near the elevators. The room had tea and a coffeemaker too. I also appreciated the kitchenette in the room to reheat leftovers from a restaurant or to microwave water for tea. A welcoming box of chocolates on the bed was a nice touch. I did not use the fitness center, but it was much more impressive than the Palomar's, as was the large indoor poo, which I did use. There was a spa and lockeroom with a steamroom and sauna. At the recommendation of staff, I took the architectural boat tour of the Historical Society. I would have to say that the architectural boat tour of the Architectural School, which I took last visit, was better.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the Trump brand!”
Reviews.Author: travel_junkie1573
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at some of the nicest hotels in Chicago and this is our new favorite. The service is absolutely off the charts superb. From the doorman, to the reception, to the spa, to housekeeping... they are impeccable. We had a couple of very minor issues with our room (a prior guest pulled the drape off the track so it wasn't opening and closing with the automatic switch. They also lit the battery operated candle in the bathroom!) and they were fixed IMMEDIATELY. We were upgraded to a Spa Room on the 14th floor and it's lovely. Spa amenities in the bathroom and even a towel warmer in our room. Complimentary water (thanks for not charging me $5 to open the room water, just be careful not to accidentally open the "Bling" brand water... that'll run you $25 a bottle.) and chocolates at turn down service. Sixteen Restaurant is DIVINE. We couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ken09Ireland
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 6 night stay at the Trump. I must say it is a fantastic hotel with the best possible facilities possible. We were there for our wedding anniversary and received an upgrade, champagne and choclate dipped strawberries in our room on arrival - nice start! Also all the staff were friendly and wished us a happy anniversary! The room overlooked the dyed green river for st.patricks day. The hotel is so clean and fresh throughout, Joseph at reception was polite, friendly and very helpful throughout! The gym is beautiful with ample supplies of shampoos, shower gels, water, tea coffee etc. The equipment is top notch and the view when working out is amazing! We ate breakfast at Sixteen, beautiful setting, didnt eat dinner there as too many options elsewhere. Concierge were good, found one of the men a bit cold - he was the guy with the glasses, very clinical however the rest were spot on. We had cocktails in the rebar some nights, very upscale and classy I liked it alot. One issue I did have was a creaking noise at night in the room -1934. This was like a squeaking noise and I found the response to my query to be poor which surprised me. I reported via attache service one morning and heard nothing so I had to ring again the same evening however the person didnt seem to be aware of me earlier call. Breakdown in communication? Souldnt happen really. Engineer called me and explained the buidling moves in wind and something about wires...to be honest my sleep shouldnt suffer regardless. This left me a bit disappointed as otherwise this is a fantastic hotel which I plan on returning to for business and pleasure. Another minor compaint - one sink in the room, difficult when a couple are getting ready to go for dinner. Location - Unbeatable... This is a really good hotel, will I return? Possibly yes, Penninsula may get a look in also... Ken

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous customer service”
Reviews.Author: denvercharlie123
Reviews.Content: Wow - even though you haven't made it easy to tell you how much I enjoyed my stay here (I would add a link for reviews that are easily accessible or an email contact - can you tell I work in the web/internet world??) I am extremely picky, vocal and I LOVED my stay at your hotel. I was there for the Chicago Mid Winter Meeting, one of the largest dental conferences in the world held at McCormick place. My stay at your hotel made me realize that it can actually be a treat to travel for work. It's been a very long time that I have enjoyed such "over the top" customer service. From the moment I pulled up to your lovely hotel from my delayed flight, my long traffic induced cab ride, and my exceedingly grumpy demeanor, I immediately realized I had entered a whole new world. I have stayed at many St. Regis', Four Seasons, Ritz Carltons along with some very nice boutique hotels. It's been a long time since a hotel has exceeded all of my expectations. From beginning to finish you all have excelled at all that you do, from the most charming and efficient doormen, to the front desk, to my great room, to the staff at the restaurant and lounge. I unfortunately didn't have time to enjoy your spa, but the rest was so good that my experience compelled me to tell all of my friends and send you my appreciation. I know there are other public ways I can "rave" about you, but then again, I don't know if I want to share you.

Reviews.Title: “luxury in pause”
Reviews.Author: mamalou37786
Reviews.Content: Blizzard 2011! Booked the Trump from Monday til Friday, blizzard and frigid cold central. Trump elegant, all the amenities and gorgeous views, minimal occupancy (per concierge), perhaps the snow? Donald Trump himself appeared for a press meeting on Thursday (2/3/11) in the a.m., not sure why, but fun to see. So cozy in the frigid Chicago cold to be on the high taking in the view. A few shadow details: Noticed the bedsheets were torn on our 2nd night, and on the 3rd night the bedsheets had a large, abstract brown stain in the center of the fitted sheet. Small potatoes in a hotel of minimal quality, but at the Trump? Grave oversight. I assume it's one part low guests, but a hotel of this caliber can't afford to slip off the side with the basics. During our stay, Sixteen, the hotel restaurant, received a glowing review from the Chicago Sun Times. That tells a good, thumbs up story! Only, the staff hadn't noticed. Ironing out the kinks, but surely on the up and up.

Reviews.Title: “Facility and staff more than exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: MBUSA156
Reviews.Content: In planning for a business trip, our expectations were very high considering it being a "Trump" facility. We were greeted promptly and professionally, the luggage was taken care of immediately, we were offered a warm towel at the reception desk and shown to our room. The staff couldn't have been more pleasant and courteous, not only where it was expected, but while passing in the hallway/elevator, etc. The business cocktail reception was elegant without being stuffy, the was food delicious, and the bartenders/wait staff worked very hard to make sure all patrons were served promptly and courteously. Thank you for an wonderful experience that we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “The Great Reviews are Right”
Reviews.Author: tikifiona
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The hotel is wonderfully located and we were in a corner suite with great views, which was just the best. However the truly outstanding feature has to be the staff- they were attentive without being smarmy and the service was unforgettable. My husband was looking for his book one night, just a paperback that he had been reading, and we couldn't find it. We thought that maybe it had got caught up in the laundry when the room was made up so I rang housekeeping. After checking they rang back to say they couldn't find it but they offered to replace it the next day...amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room, gym and service”
Reviews.Author: alavende
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Chicago - I booked one night using my 'black' Amex card - $335 but got $100 towards spa services (which I then used) and $50 towards bar and food, plus room upgrade and 4pm late checkout! The hotel is well located in the middle of the shopping district and close to Millenium Park Great rooms - large with big bathroom, and including dishwasher, microwave and nespresso machine! Free internet is included (paying for the net in North America is a real bug-bear of mine!) Gym is incredibly well equipped - lots of machines , but also free weights, a bench rack and a Smith machine. Nice sauna and steam room. Spa is excellent (even if expensive). Beautiful pool - long enough to do proper exercise laps! Service is very attentive. This is not a character hotel , but is one of the best that I have stayed in for a long time! No

Reviews.Title: “Trump Hotel 5 star - still delivers!”
Reviews.Author: Windycity21
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trump again for a brief weekend get away. This time was in the executive king suite overlooking the river and the Wrigley building. From the moment you arrive, there is nothing but respect from the employees. At check-in they offer a warm towel and water. This is a lovely touch. This being my third stay, the hotel still delivers on efficiency, cleanliness and customer service. The room was fantastic. High ceilings. Full kitchen minus the oven. Full fridge freezer, stove top, dishwasher. This hotel beats out the competition. Big rooms, plush comfortable bedding and stocked kitchen, flat screen TV, DVD - this place has it all and does not disappoint. Breakfast at 16 delicious. The French toast is a favorite. Yes its a bit pricey but food is fresh and fantastic. Mr. Trump 2 thumbs up. Will be returning! For fantastic stuffed Chicago pizza try Bella bacino's across the street on wacker. Crispy crust. Delicious sauce. Do keep in mind it takes 30-45 min to bake. Took my pizza to go and had a great dinner in the room.

Reviews.Title: “5* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mac4SouthWales
Reviews.Content: On the river close to the boat trips. In the shopping district and possible to walk to Navy pier. Location good, rooms excellent, a sleep as good as you get at home. Didn't get to use the hotel facilities as we were only there for a long weekend. Would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ToniDuv
Reviews.Content: Guys, I was there for three days on a business trip. this hotel is on top of it in everything. staff, rooms, food, everything. Room service was fabulous, fast and the food quality was excellent. my one bedroom suit was amazing. I promised my girlfriend to visit chicago on a leisure trip and to make her stay there.

Reviews.Title: “affordable luxury (except for the water)!”
Reviews.Author: Johnfcooper
Reviews.Content: don't touch the bottled water on the side table! choice of 4 that come with their own menu hints at expensive, but $25 for a 500ml bottle of "Bling" water is taking the ....proverbial! Excellent 5* hotel that really lives up to its reputation / claims - we had a fantastic room on 27th floor with kitchen facilities (if for some strange reason you want to eat in). Bed was a bit soft for the perfect sleep, but better than many, and bathroom was real practical style. Pool (14 floors up and next to the windows!) along with a good and not ridiculously priced spa, was welcome after a hard days shopping & eating. great hotel in great location in great city.

Reviews.Title: “Its a Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mattjb24
Reviews.Content: The hotel still has the new feel to it. The staff is always accommodating and welcoming. I usually wind up in Chicago twice a year and this is the only hotel I will stay. Without naming names, all others at this level do not match it. The health club and pool are excellent and the rooms are extremely spacious and comfortable. The staff took me on a tour of rooms to pick out the one I liked best. I highly recommend the King 1 Bedroom Suite. Everytime I go back they try and give me the same exact room I picked out as there are several 1 Bedroom suites with different layouts. The hotel was the silver lining of my flight being canceled during a snow storm.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect wedding (despite the weather)”
Reviews.Author: DaveOliver
Reviews.Content: We got married in the Trump on the 18th September 2010, and stayed for 3 nights in the hotel. Everything was superb, and our wedding planner (Brittany) was superb - especially given that the weather for our big day was atrocious!! We were due to get married on the terrace on the 16th floor, and the move upstairs into the salon room was done with minimal fuss. Our room was luxurious, and we loved every second of our stay (the room service food was also outstanding!)

Reviews.Title: “Thank You, Trump Hotel Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: vintagejewel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump to celebrate the New Year. Each staff member was outstanding. The housekeeping staff was terrific. The hostess at the restaurant, Sixteen, was cheerful and made us feel truly welcome. The dinner and celebration there was grand. The spa and pool experience was wonderful. Our room was sensational with kitchenette. Perfect spot to stay in Chicago if you're traveling with teenagers. Thank you to the entire staff.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectation”
Reviews.Author: debtodeb
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Trump on the Monday afternoon following Christmas for a three night stay. The hot moist towels offered during registration gave a pretty good indication of the service and attention to detail we could expect the rest of our stay. Our room on the 17th floor was at the lower price point, having booked a package through Expedia. Nevertheless, we had all the amenities and service I was hoping for; slippers and robe (both alas too small for my husband, who is a big guy), ice in fridge, incredibly comfortable king size bed, beautifully appointed room, turn down service and both NY and Financial Times in a bag hanging on our doorknob every morning. If you want to take advantage of spa services, book at the beginning of your stay. We were not able to get in for a massage but my husband had a wonderful leg massage/pedicure. Breakfast in our room, which arrived late due to a communication snafu in putting in the order the night before, was absolutely delicious and the in room dining manager handled the matter efficiently and appropriately. We have stayed in a similar luxury hotel approximately 8 blocks north of the Trump and given a choice between the two, I would return to the Trump without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around”
Reviews.Author: Chris68chicago
Reviews.Content: Living downtown Chicago, I'm not one to stay in Chicago hotels. However, my girlfriend thought it would be nice to take me there for the weekend. Even though we live four blocks away and my home is nicer than the hotel, it was still a nice treat. We used the spa, ate in the restaurants, etc. We stayed in a 1bedroom plus kitchenette. I was very nice, spacious, and modern. Overall a great place but I probably would direct out of town business people there before in town guests.

Reviews.Title: “Trump - Bad Hair, Great Hotelier!”
Reviews.Author: JTE_10
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 children (ages 10 & 13) and I spent an overnight at Trump International to celebrate my wife's birthday. Our hotel choice made the celebration one to remember. The reservation was booked thru WhataHotel which added to the perks of staying at the Trump(room upgrade, spa and food service credits). Our suite was huge - @1600 sq. feet - and gorgeously decorated. Our special request for a game system for my son was met in record time with even a choice of games and either Xbox, Nintendo etc. The fitness facilities were great and the pool even has a great view. My wife and daughter's last minute request for side by side spa treatments was graciously accomodated and will be a great memory for them. Our breakfast was as good and elegantly served as any high end hotel restaurant - except ours came as room service - very impressive. We've stayed at all the high end Chicago hotels - Trump is the winner.

Reviews.Title: “Super location and top-notch hotel & service”
Reviews.Author: rac-columbus
Reviews.Content: First time at the Trump. Beautiful hotel, nice public areas. Room on 26th floor was huge, and the bathroom was enormous. Beautifully appointed, massive walk-in shower. Great views to the north, west and some east, too. Absolutely would go back to this place. Outstanding service, the best we have had anywhere in Chicago. Location just off the Magnificent Mile, convenient to Macy's (formerly Marshal Fields) and Art Institute. And a short walk to our favorite restaurant, Rick Bayless' Frontera Grill and Topolobampo.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed result not worthy of price - go to Penninsula for excellence.”
Reviews.Author: jackxcity
Reviews.Content: The hotel and rooms are beautiful, as are the amenities, including the restaurant "Sixteen," the spa and the gym. But our stay was speckled with issues. Great check in, then a bellman crowded his cart onto an already crowded elevator (poor). Dinner was $300 for 2, and one of the waiter's assistants hit me in the back with a dish, then plopped in on my cutlery. My muffin at breakfast was half raw. They apologized, and got me toast, but that was all. I got to the spa and the soaking tub wouldn't hold water (leaky drain), which they knew but didn't tell me until I was standing there in a robe naked. The room staff turned off my radio station and left on their spanish speaking station. This would never - EVER- happen at the Penninsula, Ritz or Four Seasons, which are all in the same price category. Some of the staff were truly excellent, but there were glitches in everything every day I was there. I cannot endorse this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: BonVoyage90
Reviews.Content: I gave it a 4 star rating or "almost perfect" because we hit a few hiccups during our stay that shouldn't happen in a hotel of that standing. Let me first say that our room was outstanding, bedding quality superb, and the bathroom and amenities excellent. The staff made a genuine effort to be friendly and very professional. Turn down service was among the best. The waitress at the Rebar was probably the most friendly and yet professional wait staff I've had in a long time. The location can't be beaten. However, it seems that this hotel is not a "well oiled" machine (yet?) as it should be for the rates they charge. The hairdryer in our bathroom did not work and it took over 10 minutes to get a new one brought to our room...quite annoying when you're on a schedule. We used their valet parking and "retrieving" our car at the end of our stay took 20 minutes! The valets couldn't find it and brought us a different car...(hum...). Finally, an item was charged twice to our room. It was taken off our bill when I pointed it out, but again not up to the standard I would expect. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay but it appears that this hotel does need a little more time to improve efficiencies and timeliness around their service.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS THE TYPE OF SERVICE I EXPECT AT A 5 STAR HOTEL!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jaytiffany
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed in the city just for a little vacation, we were greeted by our doorman, who was very personal and courteous. the flow of our whole arrival experience was amazing and i expected nothing less from a five star hotel. our bellman terrence, showed us all of the ammenities in the hotel and the room, from the dvd player, too the pillow menu), and he even remembered our names everytime we saw him throughout our stay. the service at the restaurant was exceptionally wonderful as was the food. this was my first time coming to the trump hotel and i was not dissappointed at all. from your building, to your amenities, to all of your staff, thank you for giving my family such a wonderful experience in chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Donald Trump has really outdone himself!”
Reviews.Author: Conseula
Reviews.Content: Everything at this luxurious was superb. The staff was extremely friendly, the rooms were emaculate, and everything else was equally as amazing. One problem, this hotel still has a great location, but not ideal, some destinations we were headed to were a far walk or taxi from the hotel. Overall, this was one if the best hotel stays ever!

Reviews.Title: “My new "best hotel I've ever stayed in"! Exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: skmp1117
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Trump Hotel in Chicago for 1 night for a conference. Building is beautiful, inside and out. Service was friendly and very professional. A couple favorites: turn-down service, full kitchen with flatware, dishes, barware stove top, micro, fridge, etc, complimentary esspresso and nice tea selection, TV in mirror in bathroom, full soaking tub, a very comfortable bed with pillow menu, very large rooms and bathrooms, and fruit in the water at the gym - which is also wonderful with great city and lake views. Also electronic control of the curtains and all lights in the room from the bedside is a luxury that's just a nice WOW factor. The Peninsula Chicago used to be my favorite, but The Trump just might win out, or at least tie, after this trip. Location and views are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Winningtogether
Reviews.Content: The pleasant surprise here was not the great hotel, great location and great dining. Nor was it the fact that one hotel employee excelled over the others, which you see in a good hotel. No the thing here was all the employees excelled which puts Trump into the great category. Donald Trump has created such a high service ethos that being in the hotel felt like being served by a dozen Mr Trumps from the doorman to the Chef.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel in the ideal location”
Reviews.Author: FreidaMn
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long weekend with two teenagers at the Trump Hotel and we loved it! We thought we might be cramped with the 4 of us in one room but the room was really spacious and we felt very comfortable! I loved the kitchenette area, which had a mini fridge, a dishwasher, a two-burner stove top, coffee maker, and my favorite: an espresso maker! Our view of the river and the lake was wonderful, especially at night when we could see the lit up ferris wheel on Navy Pier. The only negative about the room was the sliding door to the bathroom which didn't close completely, although it didn't leave you exposed it did not give you the sense of privacy you might want! The service was outstanding, we especially loved breakfast every morning at Sixteen, a lovely way to start the day! The location could not have been better, we could walk anywhere! The concierge was very helpful getting us tickets to Billy Elliot last minute. I would love to stay here every trip to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: la_walt
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three night stay at the Trump Hotel. It was absolutely fabulous in every single way. The service is unparalleled compared to most hotels I've ever stayed in. Andy, the bellman, was fabulous. No matter when we saw him throughout our trip, he always remembered our names and greeted us by name. Our room included an awesome view, two queen beds, a full kitchen with cookware and dishes, a microwave, and a sub-zero refrigerator. The bathroom is unbelievable, with a TV in the mirror.We would come in at night when the room had been turned down to music on the Bose radio and a birthday treat on the counter. They even had an iPod charger. The gym was really nice as well as the pool, although we didn't end up using them or the spa. We did check everything out, though. I would run outside along the river/lake, though, and when I walked into the hotel, I was always greeted with a fresh bottle of water. I would recommend this hotel to anyone for a fabulous stay in Chicago. We didn't take a cab the entire time, except for to and from the airport, because we were located close to everything. Trump really did it right at this hotel. Well worth the money. Oh, and they have free wireless Internet, which we used everyday. Most hotels try to nickel and dime on this type of thing, so we were greatly appreciative of it being offered for free.

Reviews.Title: “Well Done Mr. Trump!!”
Reviews.Author: PurdueGirl1127
Reviews.Content: Wow!! This hotel has no equal in the city! We stayed on the spa floor so we didn't have the greatest view & there is not a full kitchen... however it didn't matter! The rooms are gorgeous; the bathroom was absolutely ridiculous in its beauty! When I discovered the towel warmer in the closet I was in pure bliss. The soaking tub is so deep that I felt as if I could swim in it! The shampoo/conditioner & lotions are all super sized. We used the pillow menu and loved the firmer pillows that were brought to us. The floor was very quiet and made us feel like we were the only guests on the floor. Keep in mind that all of this does come at a price. Room service although fine (I had the red curry chicken my husband a burger..2 cokes) is VERY expensive..$84. Valet is $52/day with in & out privileges...we parked across the street $37 for 24hrs no in & out. Terrific location...a short walk or cab ride to everything. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: AmesPat
Reviews.Content: What a cool experience! From the moment you walk in to when you check out, it is a great stay! Beds were uber-comfy and whule it took a while to figure out the espresso machine, it was worth the trouble!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: pvjirealnd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week . I found all the staff without exception ,excellent - no skimping on training here . The bars and restaurants are well run . I can't fault anything at this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Trump is Tops in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TurtleGirl1
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic property - well worth the money. Every staff member has the highest attention to detail in an unpretentious way. The views are incredible and rooms are large. Brunch on Sunday was also outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay -- definite repeat planned”
Reviews.Author: GeneDocTA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had time for that one special night get away and chose well. While we only skimmed the surface of the available services, the personal touches were terrific. We stayed in the city-view study and it was quite spacious. The bed was terrific and it was a treat having a kitchen in the suite. There are no true complaints about the place. Three very minor observations: 1. Not enough creamer in the cupboard. There was a fantastic coffee maker (Le Cube) maker with six pleasing options for coffee with plenty of sweetener, but only two creamers. I am certain that if I'd requested more, I would have gotten it. But, it would have been nice to have it stocked better. 2. The lighting in the bathroom could have been brighter, even with the lit makeup mirror. My wife needed to put her makeup on in the main room as she wasn't happy with the lighting in the bathroom. I thought it was fine, though admittedly on the dark side. No, there weren't any obvious lights out and, yes, I had all available lights on. Didn't complain to anyone about this, either. 3. The fancy mirror-based TV was neat, but only ran ads about the Trump construction and available services. Despite thinking I am at least as bright as the average bear, I couldn't get the darn channel to change beyond the aquarium (neat touch) and the three Trump channels. Again, didn't care enough to call the desk, but would have liked to have watched football in there. In short, an amazing stay in a setting that provided everything we wanted. Oh yeah, the breakfast was great. Definitely recommend getting the 'simple luxury' add-on. BTW, went to Morton's Original -- impressive steak!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: mainland_wahine
Reviews.Content: I plan meetings for a living, travel often for work and stay in countless hotels and must say, this is one of the nicest rooms I've ever stayed in! Service is exceptional and the rooms of gorgeous. I believe I was in a standard and it came complete with a kitchen area (stove, microwave, toaster, dishwasher, etc.). During this trip I did a site visit of a presidential suite at another property and I believe my room at the Trump was nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Wish the Meeting Was Longer!”
Reviews.Author: deborahdorm
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I can recall in years that the business meeting attendees spent their time raving about the hotel and wishing they could stay longer. At the cocktail party, in the hotel, while watching the sun setting and lighting up the buildings across the city, attendees traded notes on playing with bathroom tv's embedded in the mirrors. Sumptuous, with every amenity, and wonderful views from floor to ceiling windows, the rooms were simply awesome. Kitchenettes, ice in the room, slippers - you name it, they had it. They also have a super friendly and helpful staff. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Glittery and well-designed, except for the elevators.”
Reviews.Author: Monterone
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the other positive reviews of this hotel. It gets almost everything right: friendly and courteous service, beautiful and spacious rooms (each with a small kitchenette), and tasty food. Housekeeping was extremely efficient and professional. I especially enjoyed the duck confit egg dish at breakfast, as well as the hip vibe of the bar, Rebar, at night. The lobby, while small, is intimate and comfortable, and it is an easy place to rendezvous with people. The one glitch in the hotel was the extremely slow, painfully slow, aggravatingly slow elevators. There are only three elevators in the elevator bank that serves all the hotel rooms, and they often took forever -- well, more literally, 5-10 minutes, which is a really long time to wait for an elevator on a consistent basis! I stayed at the hotel for four nights, and after a while, I had to build an extra 10 minutes into my plans to get anywhere in the city, just to account for the elevator wait time -- to make sure I wouldn't be late. Kind of ridiculous. It wasn't enough of a problem for me to lower my rating, but it was close -- if there were half stars, I would give the hotel 4 1/2 stars out of 5, as a result of the poor elevator planning. Notwithstanding the elevator problem, I still recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Chicago. It is worthy of its accolades.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: SLOPHIL375
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels we've stayed in. The rooms are ultra modern with state of the art lighting. Large bathtub. Every amenity you can think to have. Beds large and comfortable. Large windows with power curtains. Minimal lobby. The restaurnt 16 is nice. Health club etc great. As nice of a hotel experience as you can find.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RENU78
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to have a one month stay in this hotel due to business purpose. We were so happy upon arrival we were greeted with snakes and drink. The stay was such an amazing experience, from start to end. I highly recommend the whole experience for A romantic getaway, Girlfriend getaway, People with disabilities, Older travelers, Pet owners, Families with young children, Families with teenagers and specially for Tourists

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: glsander
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to Trump Chicago. It is an incredibly confortable hotel with some great staff. My wife and I had a few very poor customer service expereinces as well, but it is mostly incredible. The sushi at Rebar is INCREDIBLE. Our service was very good and it has a beautiful view of the Chicago River. In-room Dinning; Interstingly they have a dog food in room dinning menu that surpasses the human in room dinning menu options. The pillow menu is a joke. It hosts a poor selection and the scented pillows that we ordered must have ahd their scent pouches refreshed every two years whether they need it or not. Front door staff, Bellmen, and front desk staff are all great. We have had a couple of questionsable experiecnces with the Concierge staff.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff, particularly...”
Reviews.Author: LetsGoRedSox
Reviews.Content: Outstanding staff, particularly concierge. Top rate rooms, good central location. Only downside is lack of points program.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: kezz38
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in Chicago hands down. Have stayed at the Peninsula, Hyatt & Westin previously - this is my new favourite place to stay in Chicago. Beautiful rooms, well run and all the staff during my stay were highly professional - do yourself a favor and treat yourself to a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations not met”
Reviews.Author: gmoney2008
Reviews.Content: That about sums it up. After reading some great reviews both on TA and in some magazines, I thought we'd give it a try. To be clear, I had high expectations going in which never helps. My main issues were as follows: I am a very light sleeper and the mini bar is see through and lit up and in the room we had it was also facing the bed. It was very annoying and at one point I had to get up and cover it with a towel which still didn't help (nearly broke a coffee cup in the process). Also, the electric curtains do not black out the room. Especially not in the end room we had with the huge floor to ceiling windows (which are nice to look out). Next, the pillows are about the worst I have had yet in a high end 5* hotel. The oddest thing is the cool pillow menu they have which was very exciting BUT they either have super soft pillows or super thick firm pillows. Nothing in between! I found this to be very odd. Suggestion - add some medium thickness pillows, very easy. The airstream pillow was interesting, but not for me. Picky, yes, but oh well. That's I why go for high end hotels. I could not find a comfy pillow. Last main issue was the constant banging on my window on Saturday morning. Never experienced anything like that in a hotel. At first I called down and asked if they were washing the windows and they said yes! But it turned out to be the wind. Still odd. Worst two nights of sleep I ever had in a 5* hotel. Another negative was that the classes in the gym are extra $$, unlike the Peninsula. Now, on the brighter side, the service was very good. When I complained about the mini bar light after the first night they had it disabled. When I said that I could not sleep in that room after the 2nd night with the banging on the window, they were nice enough to move to us to another room on the other side of the hotel which also also a nicer room. But as you can imagine at that point, I was disenchanted and very tired. Then, the air conditioner in that room didn't work, but it was quickly fixed. Also, the lighting panel next to the bed was out of sorts and I couldn't turn off a couple of the lights properly. I'm just being honest here. Overall the rooms are nice and modern and clean. The kitchen in the suite was very cool along with the mock fireplace. Bathrooms are great, especially the tub in the spa rooms, but I don't understand why there are no speakers in the ceiling and why they went through all that trouble to put in electric curtains and then didn't put a control panel next to the beds. But you'd only notice that if you'd stayed in a Peninsula or MO in Asia where they have that. Otherwise, you'll like it. It really seemed like the people there have been trained very well, but there still the feeling of newness rather than a seasoned staff.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo! Bravo!”
Reviews.Author: NancyKay
Reviews.Content: As I write this review, I search for the words that can truly describe my experience at the Trump Chicago. It was not spectacular, it was MORE than spectacular. It was not fabulous and luxurious, it was MORE than fabulous and luxurious. From the moment my reservation was made, the attention to details started. The cordial emails, the Trump Attache asking if I needed anything upon arrival. This only enhanced my anticipation for a great stay! The attentive valets were there on a moments notice, opening the car door, opening the entrance door, making me feel totally welcome. Then on to the polite desk staff, who even wished me a happy birthday, (I had noted it on my guest profile, but not mentioned it to anyone, great attention to details!) Then the golden moment....the crowning glory....the room! They had graciously upgraded me to a one bedroom suite! I was speechless! Two bathrooms, kitchen with island and granite counter tops, (with a individual birthday cake waiting for me!) stainless steel appliances, beautiful plush living room with fireplace, beautiful bedroom with soft music playing, and those windows! All this for me!? And when I opened those drapes, (which you push a button and they open themselves) and saw the view, I actually screamed! I had to put my hand over my mouth! The city of Chicago was at my fingertips! I could see everything! Michigan Avenue, the river, the tourist boats going back and forth, I could see all the way out across Lake Michigan, the view was infinite! I could see Navy Pier, the Wrigley clock was within my reach, and at night, oh my.....the ferris wheel, lit up and blinking, the city lights, the street lights going so far up Wabash, it was never ending. I had to decide, did I want to go out? Did I want to leave all this, walk around, go shopping? or did I want to stay in this crazy wonderful room? Could I tear myself away from this view? Alas, I did go out for a short time, and with a spring in my step, knowing what I had waiting for me when I returned! You must stay at this hotel. Sure it is somewhat more expensive than others, you may have to cash in your change jar, but we all deserve to stay at such a wonderful property at least once in our lifetime. It was a birthday I will never forget. Go Trump!

Reviews.Title: “Off the hook”
Reviews.Author: banned_in_austin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is mind blowing. Service is impeccable. Rooms are silent, spotless, and lovely. It's extremely expensive, but if you have the money, you can really enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ajg67
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights in superior king room which I think is smallest room - no sofa or sofa bed. Room clean, excellent bedding. Excellent staff, who made us feel special, especially bell hops/valets with almost zealous housekkeeping staff desperate to perform daily service and turndown. Managed to spend nothing in hotel (you'll understand why when you see the rates - $10 to $25 for bottled water in your room (however standard trump water free). Small deli 30yds outside east lobby for basic range food/drinks. Staff were very good with our 2 year old son with gift bag on arrival including soft toy cow (we named it Donald). Very convenient CTA bus service to major museums (Shedd, Field, Art institute, Science & Techniology and Lincoln Park Zoo) only 200m away. Good 25m 3 laned pool although often rather cold!

Reviews.Title: “the views, the staff, the spa are tres magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: luxuryboy
Reviews.Content: our stay at the Trump Chicago was fantastic. besides the obvious physical beauty of this hotel and the views that come from its great location is the awesome staff. they are all so friendly, genuine, helpful, and entertaining. from the bell staff,reception,concierge, housekeeping, bar and restauarant,spa, etc.,etc., they all were great. the people of Chicago is what makes the city of C so wonderful. the midwest charm and genuine good heartedness oozes throughout this hotel.we would def stay here again, and again, and again...

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: MSimos
Reviews.Content: Went for our anniversary. King Suite overlooked both Chicago River and Lake Michigan. Suite was perfect! Dinner at window table overlooking Chicago River at Resturant Sixteen was perfect! Great service and attention (Waiter: Richard). Complimentary champagne and chocolate covered strawberries in the room after the evening turndown service!! They were aware of our annivesary, but did not make it an anoying experience. Only subtle referenes, such as the words "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate on the desert plate at dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury travel for both business and vacation”
Reviews.Author: Kettenbach
Reviews.Content: We stayed in for more than a week. Conference facilities were excellent with fantastic view. Rooms with all kind of luxury. Very spacious rooms, including little kitchenette, DVD player, etc. Location right in the city center, close to all shops and restaurants. With Spa and fitness center. Had everything you needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: albychoi
Reviews.Content: My first time in Chicago and loved it. This hotel was perfect. Everybody from the front desk to the concierge, the houseman and room attendant were very friendly and courteous. The room was spacious, and very clean. I did not see any dents, scratches or stains anywhere. I really liked that the kitchen area was supplied with dishes, glasses, pots, pans, cutlery, microwave, etc. It was very convenient making my own meals. The ice maker in the fridge was always filled with ice which was nice because you never had to leave the room to get it like some other hotels. The view from our room was beautiful. We had a perfect view of the Transformers movie that was being made outside during the whole weekend we were there. I also loved driving up and down the parking ramp - doing those circles gave me a rush each time.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world”
Reviews.Author: lmunizgolf
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to congratulate Trump Chicago for its well deserved first rank in Travel and Leisure's 2010 World's Best Awards. I, together with my family, stayed at the Trump during our 30th anniversary celebration trip, and I can tell you that the hotel is just amazing. The rooms are modern, elegant and very spacious, with fantastic bathrooms and all kinds of amenities. The staff is great. They remembered our names since the beginning, making all of us feel at home. In short, a fantastic experience that we all are looking forward to repeat very soon. Oh! and we loved too the magnificent city of Chicago, and the Trump is in the middle of everything!! So, many many thanks to the hotel for a fantastic stay. We will come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience of My Life - Unbelievable!!”
Reviews.Author: ammarcou
Reviews.Content: I honestly do not know where to begin raving about this amazing hotel. My girlfriend and I are college students working to pay our way through school. Naturally, we don't have a lot of money, but we decided to splurge on our trip to Chicago. We originally planned to stay at the Holiday Inn Express just down the road from Trump, but changed our minds due to the great reviews about Trump. And WOW, we were more than happy when we arrived. Prior to our stay, I emailed attache to notify them that I was planning to propose to my girlfriend on our trip. I wanted to gather any helpful advice and information about services they could offer to make the experience more special. I was very impressed at the quick response (it was within the same hour that the message was sent). I was told that the there would be a notification on my reservation stating it was a "special proposal stay." Upon checking in, the receptionist told us that we had a complimentary upgrade from the Superior King room to a Spa Suite (that's about a $200 upgrade)! *Note: the front desk/entrance personal are extremely friendly and helpful. I figured that our young age would cause them to not take us seriously, but it was exactly the opposite - we felt so comfortable, like family. Being a 5-star hotel, one would assume the staff would be snobby, but trust me, the Trump staff is quite the opposite. I wish I could remember the names of the two nice ladies who helped us check in, because they were two of the most polite, kind people in the world. We got our key and headed up to our special upgraded room. We were both speechless when we opened the door. The hotel had given us a room with a river view, which overlooked the Wrigley building, and Lake Michigan was visible. Not to mention, the room was MASSIVE. The bed was HUGE and so comfortable. Personally, I like to sleep in late (I work a second shift job, so I'm not usually required to wake up until about 11am each day), but after sleeping in that bed I was wide awake and well-rested at 7am. The sunshine pouring through the giant 10-foot floor-to-ceiling windows was a great way to wake up. Within the first hour of being checked in, there was a knock on our door. Who was it? room service with a VERY special amenity completely free-of-charge. The deliverer told us that it was a gift from the hotel because of the special occasion. Bottom line - my girlfriend and I felt like royalty the entire time. We've never before had anyone treat us like the most important people in the world, but the Trump staff managed to do so. In the future, I will never visit Chicago without staying at the Trump Hotel. Once you stay here, you'll never stay elsewhere. I've already began recommending my friends and family to this hotel, and I would encourage anyone reading this review to do the same; it is well worth the little bit of extra money. After hearing about my experience, my parents have already been talking about making a trip to the Trump Hotel in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “The Trump Hotel in Chicago is superb.”
Reviews.Author: kerryhanigan
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, fabulous location, exceptional staff. Absolutely 5 star service. The Spa was remarkable; the massage treatment provided by Jon M.was simply the best!

Reviews.Title: “trump hotel - on the Top of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: LucienHoudremont
Reviews.Content: We, hat mean my wife Odette, my children Guillaume 22, Laurent 19 and myself were extremely pleased. Nohing to complain, only good comment bout the pleasant and professional staff, and the superb location and equipment. All this at a reasonable rate we definitely not regret. Again in Chicago we return to the tower. Lucien Houdremont Hotel Saint-Nicolas L - 5533 Remich

Reviews.Title: “The finest hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Summit65
Reviews.Content: They have thought of everything in this hotel. From the lighting to your daily paper the little things are not forgotten. The rooms are very nice, the staff is extremely friendly . The workout center and pool are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated, excellent service, great views”
Reviews.Author: SRZurich
Reviews.Content: I visited Chicago with the family and by coincidence we booked the Trump Hotel. We were enthusiastic from the first minute. Stunning lobby, smily and friendly staff. The room was a deluxe, big refined and with the most beautiful view of Chicago. The furniture were just elegant and the bathroom had just everything you need. Our son spent hours looking out of the huge window the bustling city under his feet. The restaurant was fashionable, excellent service and very good food. The bar terrace a popular rendez-vous for aperitif, big cocktail list. The services and the staff were the best, efficient and always very friendly. Front desk, bellman and doormen were adorable with our son, he kept remembering them for long time. He was only 3 at our visit but still after time and many trips he consider Trump Chicago his favorite place. We had a wonderful stay and surely would return.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you would expect!”
Reviews.Author: CGspouse
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out of our taxi, our experience was top notch! We were immediately greeted with a warm/moist washcloth and a bottle of water which was awesome after 2+ hours of flying and more time in the airport and taxi. Room was ready and beautiful! The only trick was trying to learn how to use the light switches.... we should have asked the bell captain. I would recommend that.... We ate at the restaurant SIXTEEN... it was outstanding! Impeccable service, outstanding food and beautiful presentation, but just know you will drop some serious dime! The view off of the Terrace was spectacular! Massage at the spa was well worth the money and the workout facilities were great as well.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZED”
Reviews.Author: MonkTravellers
Reviews.Content: So, I'm not a huge fan of Trump and all things Trump so it is a complete surprise that I find myself raving on and on about such a wonderful hotel! From start to finish this hotel is top notch. We were given an upgraded suite to accomodate our family of five and had great views over my home town of Chicago. I will say, it's still very trendy and though children are welcome it's a hotel to be seen and see the beatiful people. Obviously, the restaurant is spendy but so is everything else about this place. Still, one of my all time favs and I've been to a dozen and dozens of luxury hotels in the world. Very close to American Girl Doll Store.

Reviews.Title: “Never Got A Chance To Stay”
Reviews.Author: familyofsix094
Reviews.Content: I showed up for my reservation and they had no record of it. The Front Desk clerk and Manager were worthless and basically had no interest in helping me I went over to to the concierage desk and they were incredible --they worked for 30 minutes and found me a a room They need to teach their front desk staff--First Class does not have to equal snobby

Reviews.Title: “Great time, great service, pricey options”
Reviews.Author: SK-travel1
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Trump Tower in Chicago and we had a great time. It was a little pretentious at times (a selection of waters sitting on the counter in the room, ranging from $5 to $25 for a bottle, for example), but every member of the staff was prompt and professional and obviously well trained. Our pets were welcomed, the baby got a special stuffed animal, and room service looked after us. Traffic was a nightmare getting to downtown Chicago but that was to be expected. I would have liked to have some little treat included in the room for $500 a night (like for example a free candy jar that goes for $18 in the room service menu), but overall we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Better View”
Reviews.Author: stevegreer
Reviews.Content: Trump Hotel was absolutely fabulous. Tastefully decorated, everything you could ask for with a great staff. Stayed in a lake/river/downtown view one-bedroom suite with our two school age children. Huge suite (Twice as big as most) with two baths, full kitchen, large bedroom and larger sitting room. Could have stayed a week without a problem. View of Navy Pier fireworks on Saturday night. Also best fitness facaility I've ever seen in a hotel. Trump Hotel as replaced the Pennisula and Four Seasons as my favorite in Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Usually friendly but not this weekend”
Reviews.Author: applevac
Reviews.Content: I do love this hotel and walk all my out of town guests here to promote it. A few have stayed here due to my showing them the hotel. The people that work here are usually very lovely but I took some people here this weekend and we weren't treated with the same welcoming experience as before. I was actually embarressed and my guests felt awkward as well. I'm ashamed to say, they won't be staying here due to the way we were treated. I tried to show them the patio on 16 and they said it was full to capacity. I just wanted to at the very least let them look out through the window and they made us feel very unwelcome. I tried to show them the restaurant (all things I've done before) and they just seemed to want us out. Later I took them to other hotels and they came right away out with the menu and times of service. I won't give up on Trump as they have been good in the past but needless to say, I'm a little afraid if this happens again. When the hotel opened they were so kind as to walk me around to spa/pool and everywhere. I've since promoted and shown it off and it's due to how welcoming they were. I'm hoping this was an off weekend but it was upsetting to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury for your and your infants”
Reviews.Author: likey2travel
Reviews.Content: We finished our first airline trip with our infants, both under the age of two. We were quite nervous about traveling without all of our things at home, but the Trump Kids program was just great for travelers with infants. I haven't seen many focus on these amenities, so I will highlight. In summary, a great trip and we would visit again. Luxury, helpful staff and a worry free vacation. The basics: They provided us with diapers, wipes, a diaper pail, desitin, shampoo and a rubber ducky! The cribs were great and the backpack had some coloring books and crayons. The robes and slipper were far too big for our young ones, but a nice idea. The lights are all on dimmers, perfect for nap time. The full refrigerator allowed us to stock the basics for the infants (a full grocery store was a 5 minute walk). We even cooked some minor meals on the electric stove and microwave oven for the kids. The cleaning service was always doing a great job cleaning up the little crumbs left by the boys. We stayed using the Amex FHR program and were upgraded to a 1BR suite. Wow! 1,200 sq ft, two rooms which allowed the parents to watch tv while the kids slept. Plenty of space in either room for both cribs and for playtime and burning off some energy. Nice furniture, tvs and a cool bathroom tv built into the mirror. Shaving took a while longer. We had a $100 spa credit, and blew through that, not cheap but good services. The spa and gym were huge, the 8-jet shower was a delight in the spa, the pool was okay, but not designed for infants (3 ft deep at the shallow end, and divided into three lanes). They had a few water toys and rafts for the kiddos, which was a nice touch. We only ate breakfast in the hotel, and it was quite expensive though delicious. $8 for a bowl of cereal, $12 for three pastries, $8 for two slices of toast. Plus, $4 delivery fee and 18% tip added for room service. I would recommend the heart healthy pancakes, french toast and belgium waffles ($18 each). Service was great for the most part. Needed a hand with luggage, no problem, just call. Needed a tide-to-go stick for the stains on the shirt, it was delivered in 5 minutes. Needed batteries for the kids toys, delivered in 10 minutes. Excellent! However, at check out we called down to get help with luggage and a taxi (van, because all of the luggage and stroller). A bellhop came immediately to help us with the luggage, but 15 minutes later there was still no taxi van. They said "we haven't seen one yet" Come on! I have a flight to catch and you left it to chance that one would drive by as opposed to calling. That is not fitting with the rest of the excellent customer service. Also, the valet that loaded the luggage into the van put the bag in upside down, and at the airport we were rudely greeted by a wet bag full of leaking baby formula. I know he didn't realize what was in the bag, but there was room to put it right-side up as opposed to upside down and he snapped when I went back to help load it (again, I am sure good intentions to allow me to relax and get seated with the family, but not the best communication). The Concierge staff was mixed (good job David on your recommendations, Gwen you made dinner plans for the wrong night). They were able to arrange through Sitter Studio babysitting ($20/hr, 4 hr min) so we could have dinner together without the kids. Previous reviewers commented on the lobby and open areas not being very large, and this is true but who cares. There is plenty of space in The Spa on the 14th floor to relax, sit and read, but the hotel layout is designed for privacy and serenity, and I like not having 50 people in the lobby staring at you when you come and go. Free wireless internet was also a plus along with a great location that was walking distance to most things, or a $10 cab ride to museums. I would visit again and rate this among my best hotel experiences. This was even better to me than my stays at the Four Seasons in Chicago because it seemed less pretentious and more kid friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room - lovely touches for kids - overall lovely but not blown away!”
Reviews.Author: conors-kangaroo
Reviews.Content: I have never written a hotel review on here before but I read and value the reviews all the time when booking hotels myself so I thought it was about time that I contributed. Stayed here last December for a short last minute trip for my birthday. After considering New York we realised we could stay at this hotel for far cheaper than an average hotel in New York. What a good decision we made as Chicago is a delight and we will definitely be back. Everything was so convenient and we found people to be so helpful and friendly. Now for the hotel, First impression was great. Lots of staff, no line. Beautiful Christmas tree. Lobby area a bit on the small side and not much seating. I had booked the hotel under my maiden name as my email address and passport are still under same and have learnt from past experience its easier to have booking and email in the same name but they kept addressing my husband with my maiden name it was funny the first time so I let it go but by the third time I had to tell the girl at reception that that was my name and not his!!...Poor girl was very embarrassed but we thought it was funny and took it in good spirits. They immediately gave my 6 year old at the time a little Trump kids back pack with lots of goodies inside like crayons, colouring book, a little cuddly cow (who he named Donald!), little business cards with his name on it -handy in case he got lost we stuck one always in his pocket with our mobile phone number on it just in case he strayed from us. It was all a big hit with him. We were very swiftly taken to our room. I had asked for a room on a high floor which they had honoured. What hit me immediately was the sense of space and how clean the room was and the HUGE bed. Think it was the high ceilings and the huge floor to ceiling windows that gave the sense of space. The bed was gigantic and full of plush cushions and pillows. I was dying to dive on it! They had left a cookie and milk out for my son which was also a nice touch. Great to see a hotel like this catering so well for kids. Room had a kitchenette which we didnt use except for the fridge which was fully stocked but still left room for us to put our water in. Big wardrobe with light! Lovely bathroom with tv in mirror which was a novel touch. Bath and shower were a funny set up. Behind a glass screen was the shower which was next to the bath also behind the glass screen. Loved the bath products but once you got your hands wet they were the most non-user friendly bottles I have ever experienced in any hotel. I know its only a little thing but I am so surprised no one has mentioned it. It was like a comedy scene every time I went to use the shower. If your hands are wet at all (which most peoples are in showers) when the bottles are upside down to empty the products out they exploded out of your hands....not once! not twice! but many times! So shampoo and conditioner and shower gel were going all over the place except into my hands. Its the pyramid shape of the bottle. It doesnt work upside down guys!!!...Its only a small thing but my husband had the same problem. Lovely bathrobes and slippers. My husband is a very tall man so I phoned down and asked for a larger one for him, I had noted from their website that they supply play stations and robes and slippers for kids also so requested both for my son because I knew we would be using the pool. The playstation was in our room along with my husbands robe (it was brand new in a packet) when we arrived back but unfortunately my sons robe and slippers never arrived! I didnt bother to follow it up but it kind of irked me when I saw other kids in theirs at the poolside. The day of my birthday, when we came back to our room that evening they had left me a small chocolate dessert and a note wishing me a happy birthday which was a nice touch and delicious but it was miniscule when divided by three so I let my son eat it. Think you could be a little more generous than that Trump but I dont mean to sound ungrateful. It was a nice thought. Thank you! The swimming pool was lovely and there was no one there initially. It soon filled up. Seperate lane for those who want to do lengths. Plenty of comfortable chairs poolside with plenty of clean towels available for pool users. Some pool toys too. The most spotlessly clean and well stocked ladies changing room I have ever been in. Robes left in every locker. We had a look in the gym on our way to the pool and it was very busy, lots of water and fruit to refresh those pumping iron. We looked in again on our way back to our hotel room after our swim and it was practically empty so for those gym using people timing is everything! We wanted to eat in a diner for breakfast. Unfortunately there is none nearby. Dunkin donuts was across the street which was fine for a cup of coffee. So husband was sent over every morning to get a coffee for us and cereal for my son and we then got up at our leisure and sauntered down for brunch to Tempo diner recommended by the concierge which was about a 10-15 walk away, which ironically is right beside Sofitel hotel which was my alternative (and cheaper option) hotel if I hadnt stayed at Trump but we decided to splurge a bit because it was my birthday. Hmm!... I took a peek in the Sofitel and they had a bigger foyet and a restaurant and bar on the ground floor which I thought might be more family friendly for our next stay in Chicago! Back to Trump - Concierge was very helpful recommending things to do and restaurants nearby. Ate at Grand Cafe Lux on his recommendation. I think its owned by the Cheesecake Factory definitely same style but much nearer the hotel. Family friendly. Didnt eat in the hotel or visit the bar as we had a child with us. Pity there wasnt more seating in the foyet area because would have been nice to have a glass of wine there to relax after the very busy days out sightseeing and shopping. I felt we were confined to our room once we came back to the hotel. Another thing to note was how well stocked and restocked the room was as we were using it with bath products and towels. We commented on the fact that not once did we see a hotel trolley or maid cleaning rooms but thats something you would expect from a 5 star hotel. They were very discreet. Also, we had a plumbing issue at one stage that was sorted very promptly by the hotel and the guy that came to the room was very efficient and very friendly. One other little niggly thing though was every night they converted the sofa to a sofa bed for my son which was great except it left the room quite cramped and twice I hurt my leg from the edges of the sofa bed. So much so that we used to convert it back to a sofa and my son slept in the bed with us. It was so gigantic and comfy a family of five could have fitted in it! But as we were confined to our room I felt we needed the space more and was fed up being bruised by the iron bars from the sofa bed.. All in all, very nice hotel, tad on the expensive side for Chicago but worth it for a special occassion. Much cheaper than New York. Check your bill as they tried to charge us for a the brand new robe they sent to our room for my husband! Immediately sorted and taken off our bill but some people might not check. For a 5 star hotel I think I would expect more communal lounge areas. Would have been nice to relax in the evening and people watch! Maybe thats just a European thing we like to do. Definitely loved all the extras they gave my son and from that aspect very family friendly if they could just sort out the public seating areas it would tick all our boxes. Would have loved to have been able to visit the top of the building to see the views but the whole top half of the building are Trump private residences and condos so not possible which is a pity. Anyway, definitely a lovely hotel but I think I may try the Sofitel next as might suit our needs better. Stayed in the Sofitel in Munich before and was blown away by it so have a leaning towards the Sofitel. I am aware Trump International, Chicago has won some awards lately but dont get complacent Trump. I have stayed in some equally impressive and some even more luxurious hotels, Sofitel Munich being one of them. Next time we come to Chicago will definitely check Trumps rates but I reckon we will end up in the Sofitel due to its proximity to family friendly restaurants and diners and of course shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience-”
Reviews.Author: travelclassygal
Reviews.Content: Splurged and stay at the Trump and it was worth every penny,no nickel and diming for water or extra towels or sheets or use of gym or pool.Classy place-The best view in Chicago! Never heard another person in the hallway nor outside. The only interesting thing is that from about 6:00in the morning till about 9:00,we kept on hearing something outside and the window and we realized it was birds hitting the window into their reflection.Not anything the Trump could about that, just an fyi. Tried the spa twice, for a 220.00 facial it was not worth that. My expectations were high because of the cost and it did not come through. I would check around the area and find a really good stand alone spa and spend 1/2 the money.
