The concierge staff was awesome, they jumped on every question I asked and did what ever it took, they rock. We ordered room service and it was prompt and very good!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sleep_NH
Reviews.Content: The pictures I took of my room did not come out (I've since purchased a new camera)....but I can tell you that my room was one of the nicest I've stayed in through all my travels. The staff was professional and the valet/door staff was very friendly. They remembered me as I came back from dinner which was impressive since the hotel was full and I was only there one night. My room was very large, a small kitchenette area that I was not expecting. The bed was extremely comfortable.....I actually fell asleep on top of the covers at first, thankfully I woke up a few hours later so I could get under the sheets and drift back to a great sleep. The hotel offers a "pillow menu" that I though was great. The bathroom offered a stand up glass shower as well as an over sized tub. The TV in the bathroom mirror was a nice touch even though I didn't use it. I can say that the next time I'm in Chicago, I will look at availability for this luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “chicago is an awesome place to visit”
Reviews.Author: twostickbugs
Reviews.Content: We didn't run out of things to see and do while in Chicago. Go in October if you love haunted houses...went to one while there and nothing compares to how awesome it was, back home. I am planning a second trip back soon. We stayed in a suite, only because someone paid for it, but it was sweet, amazing view, and we ordered every kind of pillow they had available on their "pillow menu". Tv inside the bathroom mirror was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “The Trump Int'l Hotel Chicago is, imho, the finest hotel in America in terms of overall experience & especially service”
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey1976
Reviews.Content: Trump has created in the Trump Int'l Hotel Chicago what IMHO is the finest hotel in America in terms of overall experience and especially service, and one that can rival the greatest hotels in the world. Over the course of the past thirty years of my business career, I have stayed in many of the top US hotels and many of the world's great hotels, from London's Connaught, to Geneva's Hotel des Bergues, to HK's Mandarin and Peninsula, and Tokyo's Seiyo Ginza. The Trump Chicago is definitely in the same league as these great international hotels, yet it also retains a distinctly American flavor: friendly service, modern design, and leading edge technology. From the moment you arrive, the service is impeccable and achieves the elusive ideal balance between professionalism and friendliness. The staff are efficient, attractive, well groomed, courteous, and extremely helpful. Moreover you never, ever have the feeling that anyone is expecting any kind of a gratutity, which can be so offputting in certain American cities. Here, you truly get the feeling that you are a valued guest and that whatever can be done to make you comfortable and happy is cheerfully offered. From the reception staff to the room staff to the restaurant and spa staff, everyone did a superlative job. Our room was magnificent: 900 square feet with a superb view of the lake, a fully equipped kitchen area (including Nespresso coffee machine) an enormous and delightfully comfortable bed, and a very complete and efficient bathroom. The design was modern, but not oppressively so. The high ceilings reinforced the feeling of space. The electrically controlled drapes opened onto magnificent floor to ceiling windows, the soaking tub in the bathroom allowed for a bit of indulgence. This was truly one of the best rooms I have experienced in 30 years... The location was ideal for anyone having business in the downtown/loop area and there were always taxis a doorman's whistle away, despite a busy convention (which had the hotel 100% full) as well as regular summer thundershowers. As for food and wine, we spent our first evening at Rebar, having quickly changed after an arrival from the West Coast, and found the cocktails to be delicious, the Sushi/Sashimi remarkably good, and the ambiance lively and young. We were in fact surprised when the lights were raised shortly before 1am to indicate that closing time was approaching. We had been having such fun that time truly flew by. We did not dine at the in-house restaurant so I can not comment on that. The exercise facilities were state of the art, in pristine condition, had spectacular views and contained everything one could possibly want. We did not use the spa facilities so this is something else I can not comment on. In summary: a truly outstanding experience. I would definitely stay there on my next trip to Chicago. And while this hotel clearly charges five star prices, they unquestionnably deliver five star service; so even if one was not travelling on business, I can think of no better place to treat oneself to real luxury. And I left thinking what a pleasure it was to see an American hotel earning a place among the unique establishments of the world. Bravo Mr Trump and congratulations to your team!

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best run hotel in the world.”
Reviews.Author: tamu1956
Reviews.Content: Booked with an Amex Platinum package with a spa credit and free night. Upgraded on arrival and the rooms are fantastic with HD TV and all the everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel. However what you don't usually receive is the level of personalized service and attention to even the smallest details. When you go to the gym, each of the aerobic machines already has a towel and bottle of water neatly placed on it. The pool is fantastic as is the spa. And if you score a room on the east side of the building you have a front row view of the saturday night fireworks at Navy Pier.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel to enjoy Chicago, one of the most fascinating cities in the world”
Reviews.Author: cyclone-zh
Reviews.Content: I had dinner at the restaurant of the trump international (sixteen) back when the hotel was being built. Food was delicious and views were breathtaking. This year I planned a trip to Chicago, with a couple of days in the city and a trip to the upper peninsula. When you look at the skyline of chicago, the trump hotel is a beautifully designed and crafted element of it. It is certainly one of the most impressing and appealing buildings of the period of the last 20 years. When you arrive at the hotel, you are warmly welcomed by the distinguished and well trained staff, an experience worthy of one of the best hotels in the world. The rooms are very spacious, well equipped (including kitchenette), beautifully crafted, modern, reflecting distinguished luxury, but not bling-bling or traditionalism. The room service is fully up to this level. Make sure to tap the knowledge of the concierges to make the most of your chicago trip- places to go, things to do, Jazz Club recommendations, programs of Blues festival etc.. The concierges are excellent at arranging activities, reservations etc. The location of the hotel is very central- in the heart of downtown Chicago. We loved this hotel and recommend anyone to consider the trump hotel when coming to Chicago. Rates can vary throughout the year, and by booking agency, so I recommend to do some research.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel -- All Around”
Reviews.Author: ivanciment
Reviews.Content: Quite simply an excellent hotel. Spa and the gym are great; breakfast in the restaurant was perfectly decent; service is excellent; my suite was almost perfect (ie: light in the bathroom is not optimal for shaving); view from a river suite is excellent; location of hotel is perfect (right between the Magnificent Mile and downtown), and Chicago is just a great location getting better and better. I went through Amex Platinum and got a very significant upgrade. Only 2 complaints in Chicago are the traffic on the highway to and from the airport all throughout the day (almost pays to take the train to the airport -- and allow 25-30 minutes at O'Haire United Terminal to get through the security check), and the 10.25% sales tax which is a disincentive to buying anything in Chicago that could be bought elsewhere. Trump seems to be establishing a good chain of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and service at very competitive prices !”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsPeter
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel with astounding views on the Chicago river and the lake. Rooms are bigger than at comparable hotels and the personal service is superb and personal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, outstanding service and unsurpassed amenities.”
Reviews.Author: atener_10
Reviews.Content: We travelled here with a large group for Memorial Day weekend. The outstanding service started as soon as we arrived. Mr. Colm O'Callaghan and the rest of his staff consistently went above and beyond - making reservations, recommendations and accommodating us in all of our needs. The views from all of our rooms were spectacular and the beds were so comfortable we didn't want to get up in the morning. The Terrace bar is a definite must - more spectacular views and the perfect place to enjoy the sunset. The location of the hotel is highly convenient to many downtown attractions. I can't say enough about our wonderful experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality business hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: riverside-london
Reviews.Content: Stunning hotel with incredible views over downtown Chicago. I had a great value corporate rate - but I would expect normal rates would make this a very expensive hotel. Nevertheless, the rooms are top quality and the location perfect for sightseeing across the city.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Bedding and Views, Skip the Food”
Reviews.Author: lizrogatz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We have stayed at the Peninsula, Four Seasons and Ritz in Chicago, so we thought we'd try something new. Our room, upon check in at 4, was not ready we were told. It was supposed to be ready at 3 and I was not interested in the drink coupons to be used at the bar, so "another" room was found for us. I was told it was not an upgrade, but I could not have been happier when shown our room. It was 2701 and had spectacular views of the Chicago river, the Wrigley building and more - could not have been better. The furnishings were understated and luxurious, the room itself was very spacious as was the bathroom. We LOVED the bedding, the terry robes, the slippers and the TV "in" the bathroom mirror - truly wonderful. The pillows were scrumptious, and the pillow "menu" of complimentary upgrades was a nice touch. We had a drink on the LOVEY terrace on the 16th floor and each ordered a $20+ salad. You are absolutely paying for the view, because my salad was inedible and I ended up sending it back for another that was very over-dressed. My husband's salad was forgettable. So, my advice is skip the food and just enjoy a cocktail and the view. Another tip is the terrace has no heaters and gets brisk quickly as the sun sets. I wouldn't get there any later than 6 if you don't want to be cold. The pool was lovely on the 14th floor (although nowhere near as spectacular as the Peninsula) and the work out area was huge and well equipped with great views. Overall, a terrific experience and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet”
Reviews.Author: planourtrip
Reviews.Content: Just finished a long weekend at TIH, increadibly quiet, great location if you are in Chicago for business or tourism.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: STLMommy2Three
Reviews.Content: WOW! I cannot recommend the Trump Tower enough -- it is SIMPLY AMAZING! Every detail has been considered, well thought out, and carried out to perfection. I could go on and on about every detail, but I wont...just know, it is absolute luxury in every way! and the service...oh, my! again, perfection!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best that I have stayed in - world class!”
Reviews.Author: bertlassche
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in several well known 5 star hotels over the world, Trump goes beyond expectations. The service, from the minute one arrives till check out is superb. Every employee is friendly but not overdone, many know your name, some speak to you in your own language and so on. Room was excellent. Especially re the duration of my trip for 14 nights it was great to have a kittchen with all equipment one needs including a Nespresso machine (which, for a dutch citizen is great since normally we find the US coffee as no too good). Used the gym at Spa floor almost everyday, which has great views all around. Give you a 5 +! Thank you! E.S. Lassche (Netherlands)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for a great night's rest!”
Reviews.Author: LDV15
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Trump for 3 nights and loved every night we were there! The staff's attention to detail was amazing and we were treated like royals from the first time we stepped into the hotel and to the last step took as we walked out of the hotel. The decor was beautiful and modern. The rooms were impeccably clean and well maintained. We got a nice surprise gift from the hotel when we arrived as we informed them in advance that we were celebrating a special occasion! The location is fantastic as it is close to the main attractions of Chicago. The fitness room looked like like it had state of the art equipments and the swimming pool looked very serene and welcoming. The bed was unbelievably comfortable and we had a good night sleep for all three nights. It was very hard to get out of bed. The drape were very functional as it allowed us to enjoy our beauty sleep until whenever we wanted. The hallways were always quiet despite the fact that our room was very close to the elevator. The kitchenette was very convenient and the channel selection for the TV was great. There were always great movies playing at night. The shower was relaxing and although we didn't get the chance to use the bathtub, it looked very deep and comfortable. The complimentary slippers were super comfy too! Overall, our stay at the Trump was fabulous! I have nothing but great things to say about the hotel and its staff! Many thumbs up!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: kaunismatka
Reviews.Content: The Trump in Chicago is absolutely beautiful. From the outside of the building, to the lobby, to the room, to the health club, everything about it is gorgeous and luxurious. We stayed at the Trump for 3 nights. We reserved a Superior King room on a 3-night seasonal offer. It worked out to be three nights for the price of two. From what I can tell, the Superior King is the same room as the Deluxe King room, but is only called a Superior King room when you book a multi-night stay. The room was large and had beautiful, up-to-date furnishings. It had floor-to-ceiling windows the length of the room, and we even had a beautiful view of the river. There was free wireless internet, a large (42", I think) flat screen TV, a comfortable chaise lounge, a couch, a wonderfully comfortable bed, and a Bose sound system with an iPod dock. Oh, and a large closet. The number of TV channels was sufficient, although I wouldn't call it a lot of channels. There was no Food Network or HGTV for me, although there were multiple ESPN channels for my husband. There was a full kitchen with refrigerator, dishwasher, sink, two-burner stove, toaster, Nespresso machine, electric teapot, dishes, cookware, and silverware. The Nespresso and tea were complimentary. I really loved the Nespresso coffee, although the Nespresso pods were not refilled on our last day. Disappointing. :( The refrigerator was stocked with honor bar items, but there was room to put a few of our own things in there, and we were not charged for moving the honor bar items, as you might be elsewhere. The bathroom was large and beautiful, with a large glass shower and deep soaking tub. I used the tub more than once! The Trump-branded toiletries have a lovely, fresh scent, & I loved them. Are they truly made for Trump, or are they another brand with Trump's label on them? I guess I'll never know. :) There is a "Do not disturb" light that can be turned on at the door. We really appreciated this, since this meant there was no unwanted knocking by housekeeping. There is nightly turndown service that is supposed to come between 5 and 9 p.m. Our first night, it was 9:15 and they hadn't come. I was tired and wanted to take a bath, so I turned our "Do not disturb" light on. They left a note saying they had stopped by, but our light was on, and if we still wished to have them come that we should call. The second night, they were in our room when we returned for the evening, between 9 and 10 pm. We took a little walk around the hotel while they finished. They brought bottles of water for each of us, turned down the lights, and put quiet music on. The third night, we returned to our room around 9:30 pm, and the turndown had not been done. We waited to get undressed, assuming they would come soon. Finally, at 10:15, we were exhausted from our day and turned on our "Do not disturb" light. Fifteen minutes later, I checked our door and they had left the note saying they had stopped by. It felt, to us, that they were waiting for us to turn our light on, to avoid having to turn down our room. In my opinion, if the service is supposed to be done between 5 and 9, then it should be done within that window, not at 10:15 at night. Perhaps this would be okay with people who are out later than we were, but I am pregnant and needed to go to sleep. We did not go to the restaurants or bar, so I can't comment on those, but we did use the health club, and it's beautiful. It's huge, with many machines, and has a wonderful view of the city. Each machine has a bottle of water and a towel on it. Each machine has its own tv, and there are headphones available for you to use. The locker rooms are gorgeous. Each locker has a robe, slippers, and towel inside it, and a combination lock for you to set your own code. We were always treated well by every employee we encountered. We were greeted with a smile, and they were always very polite. It should be noted that the hotel puts a $200/night incidental hold on your credit card. We were not warned about this. When my husband noticed it on his credit card account, we inquired what it was for, and were told it would be released upon our departure if we didn't incur any additional charges. It was fine with us, and it was released several business days after we left Chicago. But I think it's worth mentioning, as someone else might be taken off guard by it. The hotel, as a whole, is pristine. I didn't see so much as a piece of lint on the floor. I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel; their housekeeping staff must be amazing! All in all, we had a wonderful experience at the Trump. We felt pampered and taken care of. We would love to return again .

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: DeborahI
Reviews.Content: The Trump is a beautiful hotel and our view was simply awesome. The staff was flawless. (No one knocking when the privacy button was on.) It was an easy walk to fantastic restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but service sets it apart.”
Reviews.Author: kidultimate
Reviews.Content: I don't often gush. I've been fortunate to have stayed at some wonderful hotels, but very rarely am I driven to write such a glowing review. I'm still here as part of an extended business trip with my wife, but wanted to write this review while everything is fresh in my mind. This is the nicest hotel I have ever had the pleasure to stay in. The hotel rooms themselves are beautiful. Starting with the bathroom, with a glassed off shower/step in tub area, an electric mirror with built-in TV (cool for a gadget guy like me), fully automated/dimmable lighting, etc. The room (at least that I'm in) also has a mini-fridge, 2-burner flat surface stove top, microwave and is fully stocked with plates, glasses, cutlery and the like. While it's doubtful that you'd actually cook anything during your stay, the kitchen amenities come in handy if you visit Giordano's for a stuffed crust pizza, which really needs to be eaten with a knife and fork. There's also an espresso maker, but we haven't needed it given the coffee available throughout the hotel. Rounding out the room amenities are switch operated drapes (room can be pitch black in midday), Bose wave system, lit closet, flatscreen tv system, and an incredibly comfortable bed. But, as nice as the room is, as my review title says, I think the service really sets this hotel apart. The room has robes, slippers, and numerous other little touches, including and an umbrella for free use, The hotel has a health club and pool on the 14th floor. It has a locker room, with electronic lockers stocked with robes and towels. These are lockable with digital key codes for guests. Go into the health club, and every machine has a bottle of water and towel on it. In the pool area, towels are on every chair, there's water, apples, newspapers and a water punch available. There's also coffee available in the morning outside the locker rooms, and separate wet and dry saunas in them. Service. Just one example. We asked the concierge for directions to a local camera store, because we forgot to bring our camera's battery charger. Instead, they checked their back area and, found that they had a fully compatible charger. They then took our camera upstairs, plugged in the battery to charge while we went out for a walk down Michigan Ave. But this is just a reflection of the continuous service excellence. Housekeeping is spectacular, loading and running the dishwasher every morning in the course of cleaning the room, assembling the numerous pillows, including specially spa pillows, during turndown service in the evening, welcome greetings from virtually every staff member you encounter on your walk into the hotel, and full-on smiles from everyone. The location right on the Chicago river is awesome for walks down the newly developed Riverwalk and access to the numerous river tours and water taxis. To be balanced, I do take away a rating point for location since the hotel is somewhat isolated and it takes a minute to walk from the hotel doors to anywhere meaningful - but that is a little nit-picky. There's lots more to add, which I might do later, but for now, wanted to express my thoughts on this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second time at the Trump...I'll be back a third time for Lollapalooza in August.”
Reviews.Author: andergtr
Reviews.Content: This is a follow-up to an earlier review. My second stay at the Trump was amazing. I honestly can't find fault with any part of this hotel. Service is impeccable and unobtrusive. I had just stayed at the Mandarin Oriental New York for one night, so I had high expectations, but the Trump was perfect in every way. This time I was in a spa room on the 14th floor, whereas the first time I was in a room that was probably a condotel room with a kitchenette. In either case, the room was impeccably decorated and furnished. My only regret is that I was a solo traveler and didn't bring the girlfriend along, but we're making a trip in early August for Lollapalooza and already have the Trump booked. I'm sure we'll use the spa during that visit, so stay tuned for another review in August.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: kbris10224
Reviews.Content: It was our wedding anniversary and the kids were off for Easter so we splurged for Trump (usually, we stay in Marriott.) Wow, what a difference. Yes, we paid more, but the service was exceptional. The bellmen grabbed the bags, brought my daughters cotton candy. I had called ahead and there was champagne and chocolate waiting. And, do not pass on the turndown service. We came back and the room had transformed into comfortable slumber. My only problem was they didn't have double beds, just a King with a sleeper sofa. Apparently, even Trump can't make sleeper sofas comfortable, so my daughters couldn't sleep. The 2nd night, I felt guilty and gave my youngest the comfy, cozy luxury bed and I took the couch. It was clearly different. Oh well. All in all it was a good experience and a close drive from MI so we'd go again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl056
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trump Tower in Chicago for business for 2 nights. I had the option of upgrading to a 1 bedroom suite for an extra $75 a night, which I took. The suite was amazing. Absolutely gorgeous, great detail has gone into all the furnishings of this suite. 2 flat screen tv's, plus a tv in the bathroom mirror. This hotel is relatively new and I did see another reviewer comment on the shower and the backup with the water. I also experienced this, along with a request for a new hairdryer and it was taken care of immediately. There are a lot of lightswitches and dimmer buttons, but to simplify they do have an "all on" and "all off" switch next to the bed which is helpful. The views are amazing and the location is ideal. The suites have a complete kitchen with marble counter tops and modern cabinets. The meeting rooms were really nice on the 16th and 17th floor. Its great to have an actual view during a meeting instead of some hotel basement. We also spent some time in their onsite "Re-bar", good scene. The staff were incredibly helpful and very nice and remembered me by name. I would highly recommend this hotel to both business and leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly, quite wonderful. For business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: Elli2222
Reviews.Content: I say surpisingly because my friend booked this hotel and I just arrived knowing zero about it except it has the word "Trump" and "Tower" which gave me the impression it would be impersonal and gaudy. However this is a really special place and I would stay there for leisure or business. * Perfect location for downtown, right on the river, five minutes from Lake Michigan and the Navy Pier; the main shopping street (Michigan Avenue - "the Magnificant Mile") is right there (although I avoided it this trip!) * Excellent service, from the bellhop, the maid, the concierge desk, the shopkeeper - very friendly and accomodating; * Lovely, clean rooms with a fresh and earthy aesthetic like the colors of a river (greys, blues, purples, metallics, whites); relaxing and inviting (not dark and oppressive like some trendy hotels); we stayed on the 26th floor and had a lovely view of the river. * Full kitchen in the rooms with a coffee maker * Very comfortable beds. Shower and bath tub were immaculate. The best shampoo and conditioner I have had in a long time; my only gripe is that they are rather stingy about dishing it out and didn't replace them on the second night; * No noise issues! Gotta love that. * Good value; for the quality of the rooms, the location and the service, $300/night seems pretty okay to me * Some ammenities are rather silly, for example the "water menu" (with $40 bottles of water from exotic places) and the "pillow menu" with aromatic pillows like "Healing" and "Balance" which claim to give you things like courage?? and compassion?? * Minor issue but the lights in the room are super confusing!! I never quite figured out how they all worked (you'll know what I mean). * Also disliked the elevators because you need your key card to get up to the room which I find a hassle, but I suppose its necessary for security. * Hotel bar/restaurant is decent, if way overpriced. We had appetizers and a few drinks when first arrived and the tab was well over $200 for the three of us. Breakfast on the 16th floor was very good, still pricey but there are some less expensive a la carte items. As an aside, I highly recommend the architecture tour by boat. Great intro to the history and culture of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: DETNYC
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed there over the Thanksgiving weekend in 2008. Upon checking in we were asked if we would like some water and were given bottles of Voss. When we were brought up to the room, we realized we had an incredible view of the Chicago river and lake Michigan. I knew the sun would be rising from our view, so we set the alarm to watch the sunset the next morning. It was AMAZING! The room itself was nice and the bathroom was really great. There was a tub with a step out shower all enclosed. The mirror had a TV in it, although were so "on the go" we didn't utilize it. I really appreciated the turndown service. After coming back from a tiring day in the city, we were happy to find our room had been turned into a serene environment. The lighting was set perfectly, the TV had a water scene playing and both sides of the bed had slippers and a bottle of water. The room service was also great - really delicious food! Upon checking our vehicle was brought around and in we found a downtown map and another bottle of water had been placed in the console area. Although we didn't take advantage of the spa or restaurant on site, we did have a cocktail in the bar. It was really packed. Apparantly, a lot of people make their way to the bar/lounge at Trump for the views.

Reviews.Title: “Needs work”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkMike27
Reviews.Content: 1. Room was large but had issues. Shower was backed up and had to call to have housekeeping unclog. 2. View of IBM Building leaves a lot to be desired. 3. Walls not insulated very well. You can hear people in the room next to you talking. Don't understand how this is possible in such an expensive building. 4. The light switches were a pain. Just give me a switch that turns it off and on. I don't need a dimmer on EVERY light in the unit. 5. Garage is poorly designed. When driving between floors it it too narrow. You can see where a number of people have hit the walls. Again in such an expensive building you expect more than this. 6. Too much road noise and too much noise from HVAC unit. 7. If you want the small bag of popcorn they leave in your room it will cost you $5.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed all expectations”
Reviews.Author: CarmenD4
Reviews.Content: In a word, amazing. I have travelled extensively and stayed in all manner of hotels around the globe. I tend to be hard to please and I prefer hotels at the upper end of the scale. Trump met every one of my needs. From before I even got there, every request I made, received a prompt response from the hotel by email and all my requests were met. The location was excellent, very central and I found everything to be within walking distance. It was also in a nice location, situated right on the river. It's an iconic building and one of the tallest in the city so it was a great way of finding my way home after a long day of sightseeing or shopping, I just had to look up and there it was! The room was very spacious and had a nice city view. The bed was incredibly comfortable. The bathroom was large and had all mod cons. My only gripe was that the bath, although deep, is not long enough to stretch out in. We received a very welcome complimentary upgrade and the kitchenette was very handy. The staff were superb and always smiling and extremely helpful. The hotel was spotless and the housekeeping excellent. I always travel with a lot of cosmetics and I was very touched that they removed them every day to clean under them rather than around them and then replaced them in a pretty way. It's a very small thing but this kind of attention to detail says volumes about their standards of cleanliness. The pool had an amazing view although the room itself was nothing special. The changing area was very comfortable. All in all I had a wonderful stay and if I ever return to Chicago I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Another fine Trump property”
Reviews.Author: sc_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump in New York a couple of years ago and that was fantastic, so we had high hopes for their Chicago property. We were delighted to discover that this hotel is as good as its Manhattan sibling. This hotel has an unbelievable air of calm and serenity - which is obvious from the moment you step through the doors. I commented on it to the check-in agent, such was the contrast from the hustle and bustle of the airport and the city itself. Every member of staff we dealt with was professional, charming and efficient, from the doormen to the reception staff and concierge. Every time we walked through the doors after a day's shopping or sightseeing, we were personally welcomed back. This was a nice touch, and the way all hotels should be. It costs nothing, and this type of old fashioned courtesy stands out a mile in today's sterile, robotic world. The room we stayed in didn't have a river or lake view, but it was bright and airy, spotlessly clean, modern and well appointed, with full kitchen and oversized bathroom. Evening turndown service included a complete towel re-fresh, tidy up of the room and complimentary water and slippers. Check in and check out were effortless and stress free. None of the usual hassles involving phantom charges and so on that seem to be the norm these days. We did not have the opportunity to use the fitness centre or swimming pool, but these were both included in the cost of the room. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: HondaDoug
Reviews.Content: Highest level of quality in all surroundings. Very good deal considering great River North location. Other than difficult to use espresso machine and TV remote not working on check-in little could be faulted. Enormous tub. High quality linens and robes. Truly lived up to expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Maggiehndz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our Valentines day on Feb 28th. We booked an inclusive Package, It included Champagne, continental breakfast, chococlate body paint and a late 2p.m. checkout. We were treated excellent the moment we pulled up. The doorman was great. Then our bellhop Andy was great and showing us the different ammenities in our room. We stayed in one of the Spa Rooms. We walked into a bed sprinkled with rose pedals and a box of chocolates. The view was great from our room. We had a huge spa tub & Glass shower. Andy also gave us directions to Shaw's restaurant -which is minutes away from the hotel. We had breakfast at Sixteen. Since our package included breakfast we could either do in room dining or have breakffast at the restaurant. I wanted to check out the restaurant so we opted to do that and they just applied the credit from our package to our bill. No, its not cheap to dine their but i didn't expect it would be. The food was excellent. I also enjoyed the pool during my stay. The pool was very nice. I have been to better and bigger ones but the view was very nice. Since the pool is in the spa area the locker room have an aloe mask, sugar scrub & body butter plus everything else you may need for your shower. It was a nice relaxing trip.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome & worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: jms2780
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 night stay here and we were extremely happy. The regular-sized guest room was huge, clean, beautiful, simple, elegant, modern, and very comfortable. The bathroom was equally lovely and spacious. Even without the frills (tv in bathroom, huge windows, free use of in-room Nespresso machine, free wireless, etc), we would have been super happy. The staff was exceptional (they got a gorgeous last-minute bouquet of a dozen white roses pulled together for Valentine's Day in 2 hours - my fault for forgetting!), and were very helpful w/ directions/suggestions. I had scheduled a manicure at the in-hotel spa, which they had to change the time of, and it ended up being complimenary due to the inconvenience...very nice! The only recommendation I have is to go out for breakfast - ours for 2 people was literally $100. I would totally stay here again and recommend it. I doubt many people would be disappointed and for the price tag, you're certainly satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Epitome of Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Mrbigjerk
Reviews.Content: After years of staying at the Westin River North, Intercontinental and Swissotel, my girlfriend and I decided to splurge for a weekend stay at the magnificent Trump International Hotel and Tower. Since we were traveling with two small children, we took advantage of the Trump Kids program, which provided the little ones with their very own Trump backpacks, which included a small stuffed animal, coloring books, business cards...along with in-room slippers and robes. In addition to those amenities, the hotel even provided a surprise complimentary delivery of Gummi Worms and Fruit juice! Our room overlooked the Chicago River and Lake Michigan. The room was tasteful, very quiet, extremely comfortable and quite large. Since the hotel is new, the room was in immaculate condition, featuring a fully stocked kitchen area with microwave, Sub-Zero refrigerator, dishwasher, cooking pots/pans, serving ware and the obligatory over-priced mini bar (in this case "Trump branded") refreshments. The King bed was very comfortable, and featured high quality linens. We even selected our pillows from the "pillow menus". The television was a large LG flat screen with many high definition offerings. The bathroom was large and clean, featuring a large deep tub, and free standing shower next to it, enclosed in glass. We took advantage of the beautiful health club and pool on several occasions. The health club looks over the Chicago River and features numerous top quality workout machines and equipment, along with complimentary beverages and fruit. The 75 foot long heated pool was a kid favorite, and the locker rooms were comfortable and well-maintained. The best part of the Trump was the friendly, professional demeanor of the staff. Every single staff person we encountered excelled in their positions and went out of their way to treat the children like visiting royalty. From the doorman like MK and Casete (sorry about the spelling) to the housekeeping staff who kept the room spotless, the Trump staff went above and beyond in their efforts to make our stay memorable. They say you get what you pay for. The Trump isn't cheap...but the experience was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Trump is the King”
Reviews.Author: Endrah
Reviews.Content: When I started researching hotels in the Chicago area I came across The Trump Hotel and thought to myself could this hotel possibly live up to the reputation of it's huge name sake or is it just hype. As soon as I took the photo tour of the hotel, I fell in love. My entire stay was exceptional from the bellman greeting with a smile to the front desk offering me a warm hand towel while they were checking me in. My room was way beyond my expectation, from the decore to my amazing city view I was totally in aww. Every night I felt like I was melting into my bed . Everything I wanted was simply a phone call away, if I wanted to order something from another establishment the concierge would take my order for me and simple charge it to my room, I didn't even have to come down stairs to pay. Everyone greeted me with smile and eggerness to help. If you chose to stay at this hotel, don't do it because it is a hotel name after a famous person do so because by far it is the best hotel to stay in. It is worth every penny I spent to stay there and more.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property with Service Somewhat Lacking”
Reviews.Author: RexaliteW
Reviews.Content: Pros - the property is beautiful, the rooms are lovely, there's great bars and restaurants, Location is great, views are beautiful. They had nice touches for our son- a diaper genie in our room, a stuffed cow given to him at checkin and a cookie with his name on it (although no personalized business cards for him which was advertised on the website). Our first stay was in a one bedroom suite that was beautifully furnished Some other reviews have complained about pricey room service, and while the in-room dining and honour bar are at a higher than typical premium the quality of the room service was exceptional. We have had half-a-dozen room service meals, and they were really delicious and we know good food! Cons- Service is spotty - despite having just stayed at the same property two short weeks ago (and spent a few thousand dollars) there was no acknowledgment that we were returning guests. Compare to Four Seasons where despite not having a formal loyalty program they always warmly welcome returning guests. The one request made of the concierge (for Chicago Theater tickets) was replied with - you'll have to check the box office yourself. One morning we had to wait more than 30 minutes for our car from the valet, because the call from our room was handled by an offsite call service, and they did not communicate our request to the hotel staff. This almost caused us to miss our flight..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyVagabonding
Reviews.Content: We travel extensively, and I was a bit dubious about Trump, fearing it would be over the top and not worthy of the hype. I was so wrong! It's elegant yet understated. Attentive, but not pretentious. And simply wonderful. We were upgraded to a 1000+ square foot suite, with fake (but delightful) fireplace, large living room, massive bedroom, three bathrooms, and so many closets we lost count. Oh, and a perfectly appointed kitchen. Everything was top-notch, from the linens and towels, to the expresso machine in the kitchen, to the crazy little TV embedded in the bathroom mirror. But it was the little stuff that made it so special, like the hot cocoa by the elevator every afternoon, and the staff who were so careful to pay particular attention to my children. When we needed dinner reservations, they were extremely attentive, then made sure we had no trouble finding the out-of-the-way neighborhood Italian spot they suggested. The mini-bar items seem to set a new standard for expensive, and even our continental breakfast (included as part of our AMEX package) managed to break the bank every morning. It was fabulous...just expensive. Stop in the local markets just outside and stock the refrig...skip their room service and mini-bar at all costs. Location is perfect...just in the middle of everything and walkable to so much of the best sites. Minor downside...the building is solid concrete, which was evident whenever I used my cell phone. Service was spotty unless I was standing right by the window...okay since the view was extraordinary. booked it not htinking I'd ever like it, and will now definitely try Trump in other locations.

Reviews.Title: “WORTH EVERY SINGLE PENNY”
Reviews.Author: LOVE2travel33
Reviews.Content: Sorry I took so long to write this review. I stayed at the Trump with my sister to celebrate her 30th birthday in Dec 2008. The service from the smiling doormen, to the bellmen, to the front desk (including upscale water and warm towels offered upon check-in), and the concierge, was amazing. Our room (a one bedroom suite facing the river) was INCREDIBLE. We LOVED, LOVED, LOVED having both the master bathroom (tub, shower, toilet, double vanity w/ tv in mirror) and the guest bathroom (stand up shower, toilet, sink) which allowed us to have our own bathrooms. The concierge helped me order flowers and balloons (for her birthday) to be put in our room as a surprise when my sister and I came back from seeing the city. I asked for a tour of two different suites (just so that I'd know my options when I go back)and was accommodated right away. Also, the pool was great and the locker room was probably even better!!! The locker room had everything you needed - including a contraption to ring out your wet bathing suit, a steam shower, and a shower with lights and music!!! Crazy, but fun. Since there were some renovations still going on (an outside "elevator" outside our room that was in use through the night, but not at all a bother) and since we found a special deal on their website, our room was probably about $100 less per night than it is now. Even with that in mind, I would still pay FULL price to get the cleanliness, service, and attention to detail we received at the Trump Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious January was a special treat”
Reviews.Author: MollySiesta
Reviews.Content: An overly-attentive staff member at the check-in desk was off-putting. My husband had not even checked-in yet and some guy was trying to take our bags. The warmed wet, scented wash cloths for our tired hands was a nice-surprise. The location of the hotel is prime. If you want to enjoy a stay at this fabulous address I suggest you take advantage of the four-night stay for $209 like we did. Save money on dining and get bigger servings of food by trying the Corner Bakery up the street or the South Water Kitchen for Zagat-rated dining at half the price of the breakfast at the Trump restaurant. Remember there is room-service and it is lovely, but know this: the prices match the service. In other words, be prepared to pay a lot for it. There is a $4 delivery charge plus additional rates that apply. The room was lovely with in-room kitchen, fridge, safe, stove and utensils, but for what we needed the Spa was enough. The bathroom had a nice shower and tub, but the Spa outdid the inroom tub and shower. The narrow lay out of the room and the view from our room was somewhat dissatisfying since I would have preferred being up highter, and I kept whacking my knee on the bench at the foot of the bed facing the dresser and TV. We didn't use the pillow menu at all since I counted at least 6 pillows on our California King bed. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable and the clock radio was a nice one. The DVD player on our TV was not connected but my husband checked behind the TV and plugged the DVD player in so I could watch George Clinton's Funkadelic Video we bought for 11 bucks (along with a lot more great CD's and DVD's at the nearby F.Y.E. Store.) Each day you get an inspirational card by your bed, and free bottles of Trump Water. There is a complimentary turn-down at night that may or may not be annoying to some who are trying to dress to go out at night. There is free tea, and a variety of free espresso for the machine in your room. As for the kitchen, I must say the fridge and countertops are somewhat cluttered with foodstuffs and treats they are trying to sell you. It was a struggle to put a piece of pizza in the fridge with all the bottles of booze and drinks in them. Note; Ice is not free. This hotel room could be an apartment you can cook in if you want. I was worried throughout my stay that Trump International would not make it since there are so few customers visible, just staff. Perhaps it is a slow time in Chicago, but I hope that the staff and services continue and the hotel can make it in these times. \ We were the only two patrons at breakfast in Sixteen on Saturday morning. What I found irritating was a man in a suit who came to our table, did not introduce himself but started asking us questions. Here is what we want. Leave us alone, unless you tell us who you are and what it is you want. If you think we want to meet you, think again. In spite of strangers interrupting us in mouthfuls of food, the restaurent was ok, but very, very expensive. A glass of orange juice is 7 dollars, eggs are 8 dollars. The menu is limited and the servings are really small, but the coffee is good. Trump hires a lot of immigrants and this is the nature of city-dwellers. Nevertheless, take our advice, lay off the questions and leave us alone is the motto of utter discretion. While I know this guy, whoever he was, was trying to be friendly, we are on vacation and do not want to have to make nice, especially to strangers. The staff could do with more training. The lady at the front-desk didn't know whether there was a breakfast menu or buffet served in the mornings at the restaurent, nor did she know how the in-room fast check out on the TV menu worked. She eventually found out the answers to my questions but did not know things off the top of her head! 8 things to do in Chicago: Go to the Museum of Science and Industry, Visit Macy's = the old Marshall Fields men store, on State. Go to a Broadway show in the Theatre District, Go to Lincoln Park Zoo, and Conservatory. Visit the Chicago Institute of Art. Go to the Millenium Park. Visit Imax at Navy Pier (we just saw Avatar in 3-D on Imax) Check out Buddy Guy in concert if you can! We did and he was great!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, prime location, incredible architecture.”
Reviews.Author: cjgentile
Reviews.Content: There is not much to say about the Trump that hasnâ€™t been said in numerous reviews before me. The bottom line is that this hotel is absolutely immaculate. The rooms are very spacious and include luxurious amenities including high-end spa products. The bathrooms are very spacious. The entire room appears to be designed specifically with customer functionality in mind. The hotel seems to work very hard to maintain its 5 star reputation. We will continue to visit.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: akm107
Reviews.Content: I have a wonderful view of Trump from my office, so we thought it would be fun to stay there one weekend. We walked to Trump after work and checked in. The bellhops at the door are nice, but it doesn't seem like there is a real system they have developed for getting in and out of the hotel lobby, i.e. opening doors and unpacking luggage for guests. There were some moments where they ran to open the door for us, and other times where we just did it ourselves. Not a big deal, just something I noticed. The lobby is nice, but small. You have to scan your room key in the elevator to get up to your room, which some may think is inconvienant, however I think its a great extra security feature. Our suite on the 27th floor was fantastic. The room was spacious, roomy, all modern appliances in the kitchenette, and was very lush. It was everything I would have thought a Trump room would be like, and then some. The bathroom was awesome, double sinks, hair dryer in the drawer, dim lighting, TV in the mirror, all very cool and romantic. When we arrived the maid was still servicing the room (which i thought was odd for a 5:30pm check in), however she was pretty much done and said she'd come back because we told her we were just dropping our stuff off and leaving for dinner anyway. I was reviewing the menu for room service and WOW is it expensive. A little bit too expensive in my opinion. You can change out the pillows in your room, as they have a "pillow menu"... which I thought was really cool. Overall, we had a very nice experience, and this hotel has lived up to its hype. Now I can stare at the Trump all day long from my office and know that its as nice as it appears on the outside, as it is on the inside. :)

Reviews.Title: “My new personal standard for business hotels in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TMM45
Reviews.Content: I spent four days at the Trump Hotel during a recent business trip to Chicago. The room size, interior design, the in room dining as well as the hotel restaurant were far above average (compared to other business hotels rated same category), but the service quality was outstanding: Quiet, reliable, friendly and personal. I am looking forward to may next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Holy Smoly!”
Reviews.Author: LCBoy1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a condo. Clearly, it was more room than we ever would need for the two of us, but it was a gift. The hotel was amazing. Chicago is a great city, and you really can experience it while staying at the Trump, starting with a terrific view. The rooms were large and open. The kitchen had all of the amenities, down to every utensil you can imagine. Beds were very comfortable, and you were offered every pillow imaginable. Were given a tour of the rooms. We should have asked more about the lights, but otherwise he was very helpful. All of the workers were very cordial, and constantly asking if we needed anything. The health club was terrific, and the pool was very nice. The location of the Trump is ideal for shopping on Michigan Avenue and State Street, and is surrounded by many terrific restaurants. No real negatives. They probably could have had a whirlpool bath and bigger shower instead of three full baths in our condo. Also, though the living room furniture in contemporary, I really didn't find it overly comfortable, though I'm probably nitpicking. I suggest parking across the street in the garage above the Dunkin' Donuts. It's convenient, and way cheaper than at the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “It was supposed to be the BEST and only vacation for our family, it ended up being the worst”
Reviews.Author: navypier3am
Reviews.Content: I took the whole family, which included myself, my husband, one teenager and two children. We had spent months planning this trip, several thousands of dollars, a lot of time and effort, and our Christmas dreams on this vacation. This family, nor myself in my life, had ever been on a vacation, but it was a horrific experience. They treated my family as if we were trash and kept trying to please us with a few apologies and free chocolates. Our room was not a hotel room, it was privately owned. There were scratches on the furniture. We were lied to a number of times. There is not enough room here to explain the whole horrible nightmare. I guess you have to be rich with no children to be treated properly at this place. Unfortunately the thousands of dollars we spent and everything can never be replaced. I expected elite service. I paid for elite service. All we received was a nightmare and wasted money.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: asd_md
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Stayed there with my wife for one night, got a great deal from the hotel. Amazing location, great staff. The bed was amazing and the pool and gym was also stacked with many machines and a great view while working out. The hotel staff is very very helpful, my wife forgot a pair of jeans and the mailed them back to us for free. I've never seen so much of an effort from any staff. Can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great bathrooms, perfect location but at a price”
Reviews.Author: Londoner_Chris
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in the perfect location. Superb bathrooms. Great views from the river view rooms. Friendly service. But you do have to pay up!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: dogdiggity
Reviews.Content: Everything about Trump Chicago is stellar. From the the Bell Desk, to the Conceirge, to room service, to housekeeping. They make an effort to address patrons by name and are eager to please and make one's stay comfortable. The spa is fabulous as well. A special commendation to the Conceirge desk for making all my reservations without a hitch. Highly, highly recommend this hotel for your next visit to the Windy City.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, CONCIERGE CLUELESS”
Reviews.Author: LYNNFORD
Reviews.Content: Stayed in November 2009, Hotel is FANTASTIC, Rooms are spacious, clean and very well eqipped. Restaurants were fine, but a little pricey. Enjoyed the Mile, staff very friendly and helpful except for the conceirge. Asked for Dinner recommendations, he said wait just a minute and let me find something for you. He stepped away and returned 20 minutes later as we were walking out the door. He literally shouted " HEY YOU" at us and waved a group of papers at us. I said never mind as we had given up on him. He mumbled something unintelligible and helped another guest. I don't mind waiting, but 20 minutes--come on!!! Overall we would definitely stay here again and would reccomend to all our other associates. Well done Mr. Trump.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view of city/Navy Pier Fireworks”
Reviews.Author: kitty14221
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip back to the city and our first stay at the hotel. We were very impressed by our one bedroom suite and found the room to be very spacious, great view of the fireworks at Navy Pier from our room. We had a separate bath in the front entry of our room that also had a walk in shower. Great service by all the staff and their assistance on things was exceptional. I would definitely stay there again. The concierge made our dinner reservations one at our favorite restaurant - The Italian VIllage where we were treated to a brushetta appetizer from Jay the concierge at our hotel and the other was a recommendation from the concierge for Keefers - which has some of the best steaks and chicken we have had. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, sadly was required too often.”
Reviews.Author: touristwoman
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel as much as I like the awesome sky scraper it is in. However I came away not really liking it as much as I had hoped I would. I was booked into an adjoining room which had surprisingly thin doors through which I could hear every word, cellphone conversation, music and alot of etc...all night long right through these thin doors. When I was checked into this room no one showed me how to work the complicated lights which were nice on dimmers and all but I had to call maintenence to come and put bulbs in some that were burned out and explain how to work them at all, costing me precious time. Long after midnight when I could no longer tolerate the conversations through the adjoing door situation, with it's surprisingly little sound barrier, service quickly responded to move me to another room. I moved into this second Spa Suite room and found the air machine as loud as I would expect to find at an interstate hightway motel but I was told that was due to it being some sort of purification system- which the hotel doesn't seem to need anyway. Maintenence was able to turn the loud air system off from remote, but again that took time for me to secure having first to allow a maintenence worker in the room, etc... On top of that desk staff explained to me that they leave the Bose Wave Radios on in unoccupied rooms so that staff will know if the room is unoccupied. All night long I could feel the thump of the bass and hear the music right through the wall which was so annoying! So many things seemed overly complicated at the hotel, from a shower in the health spa requiring reading glasses to program the computer running it, to tv's so high tech it took forever to change channels, to espresso makers that while nice did require a read up in the manual to figure out. The restaurant is very beautiful, but like the whole hotel, pretty cool to cold, spare, elegant decor. Service was great, food very good. The health spa is also pretty nice, and you could lift heavy weights or do cardio on alot of equipment if you were so inclined. The health club and pool have nice views, and are super clean and nice. The massage I had was extremely excellent but the manicure/pedicure was about the worst I have ever had and I re-did myself the next day. I stayed at the hotel in part because I was shopping for a residence in Chicago, and even scheduling to look at the residences in the building was more complicated than it needed to be. There is no lobby life at the Trump. Just a small sofa and chairs, not a social place at all. The lounge, Rebar, upstairs is the socializing area when it is open in the evenings and while it is posh like the rest of the place, it does not seem to offer much of a sense of friendliness to the solo traveller as I was. In total, Trump like the man comes off as complicated, egotistical, sophisticated, high tech, striving for greatness. Perhaps the best thing about staying in hotels that aim to be the best as Trump is obviously trying to do is that they do really care about your experience and will work to make it right as they did for me at Trump. I am grateful for their assistance, though I wish I hadn't of needed any of it.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous room and great service”
Reviews.Author: pinkpearl143
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend last weekend and we had a fabulous time. The room was impressive. It was modern and had a small kitchen area. The bathroom was spacious, with a separate tub and shower area, and the mirror above the sink had a TV in it. The view of the city was gorgeous and I loved the turn-down service. When we got back to our room at night, the lights were dimmed, there was soft music playing, our bed was turned down, and the TV showed an aquarium scene. The service was great. This was an overall relaxing and luxurious experience. The restaurant was pretty good and the location is perfect because you can just walk to Michigan Ave. for some shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and fantasitc service”
Reviews.Author: AyaanAA
Reviews.Content: Greetings from Saudi Arabia. My wife and I were in Chicago (Oct 2nd â€“ Oct 19th) on Business (For me) and Pleasure (for her) and decided to stay at the Trump Hotel Chicago and we were truly surprised with the experience we had. We came in with very high expectation, which were not only met but very much surpassed in many instances. The hotel was beautiful in design as was the layout (I am not however in love with the design of the bathroom, especially the position of the toilet within it which is a bit of a let down for this class of facility). The hotel overall and the rooms in particular were in excellent condition, always clean and neat. What I really enjoyed and what I think made our experience standout was the staff. From the Housekeeping, Bellmen, Reception staff and especially the concierge who did their job exceptionally well. I would like to point out a member of the concierge team in particular I believe her name was Kathelena who was super in assisting us and especially my wife who had a lot of questions to ask on a daily basis. I have stayed at many 5 star hotels and couple of 6 and 7 Star hotels as well. This was truly a great hotel. Especially if you can get it for good price. (I believe the rack rate is a bit high. But relative to other hotels in Chicago it didn't make it seem as bad) Looking forward to our next stay at the Trump Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “You simply cannot do better”
Reviews.Author: sbccc
Reviews.Content: I don't stay at a lot of really top end hotels. For me it's mostly Hiltons etc. However, I've stayed at the Drake in Chicago, the St. Francis in San Francisco, The Four Seasons in Atlanta and The Ritz in Pasadena. In my experience nothing compares to the Trump. The hotel itself is not what you expect. The footprint is small so there's no grand entrance. However, the rooms are very very nicely appointed - I can honestly say that I have never felt sheets like that before. The location - a block off Michigan - is fantastic. However, what makes the Trump so much better than anywhere else is the service. With the exception of the St. Francis (which is awful) top hotels like those listed above always have great service. However, the Trump is in a class above the rest. I stayed two nights. Every single time that I encountered a hotel staffer they were open, friendly and helpful. Not once were they on the phone with a friend, chewing gum or acting like the clerks that I am used to seeing at Hilton class hotels. I went into the gift shop one morning and, as my foot entered the doorway the girl behind the counter said "I have to go into her cell phone" closed it and walked up to see how she could help me. Each time I entered or left the hotel the bellstaff were first class. Each time I called for assistance with whatever the phone was answered immediately and whatever I needed was done instantly. Call to order breakfast - fast, exactly right and tasty. I'm not saying that there aren't better hotels somewhere in the world. I'm sure that the super rich stay in places that I can only dream about. However, the super rich don't bother with Trip Advisor. This site is for people who don't always get pampered. And, for those of us who don't travel by Gulfstream, I simply cannot imagine how a hotel could be better than the Trump. If you get the chance - stay there.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Although we are from Chicago, we love to spend weekends when we can in downtown Chicago. After spending our time at the Trump, I feel like I just got home from a wonderful vacation without the jet lag! The attentive staff, elegant rooms and beautiful city/lake views were all part of the reasons that our stay was so wonderful. My only complaint was that we had to go back home! Looking forward to our next visit in November to this 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic view, luxerious rooms”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraJ012
Reviews.Content: Request a Chicago River view-nothing else like it in Chicago-front desk and valet seemed understaffed with our wait times , but all in all, the rooms are well-appointed and "Las Vegas-like"- unlike the older hotels, will be toasty warm on those windy winter nights.

Reviews.Title: “World-class!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth103
Reviews.Content: From the door chime that replaces knocking ... to the softly scented bed linens ... to the TV in the bathroom mirror ... to the friendly, flawless service ... Trump is truly a five-star experience. All good hotels have decent beds, edible food, clean rooms. To me the mark of a five-star establishment is the service and attention to detail, and Trump excelled. Our welcome from valet, belstaff and front desk was very cordial -- we were upgraded to a room with the best view of the city I had ever seen, and I live here. On the 22nd story, we looked out out the river to the lake. Bridges, Wrigley Building, tour boats, traffic, pedestrians -- I liked it because it was high enough to not be too loud but low enough to be interesting. And the room was very quiet. You enter into a long hall that gives the room a sense of privacy and being set back. Beautiful, restful colors, greys and browns, contemporary without feeling harsh. Kitchenette with all high-end appliances and finishes, as you would expect. Disregard minibar! Bose sound system playing softly when we arrived. Bellman very friendly and informative. We had in-room dining the first night and the server set up four chairs for us and our guests. Only a 30-minute wait on a Friday night, and the food was outstanding. The room service person called up to make sure everything was ok, which we appreciated. I never sleep well in hotels, but the bed was very comfortable, as others have indicated. Check out the "pillow menu"! All-marble, spa-like bathroom with nice lighting. We breakfasted in the restaurant and the service, again, could not have been more solicitous. A nice feature is the "juice of the day" -- on this day, some kind of berry. Tasted very natural. Yum. Another observation we had: it doesn't feel snooty or faux-Continental. Families would be comfortable here, if they wanted to shell out for the "Trump experience." So if you want a special getaway in Chicago -- I would absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely wonderful experience!!”
Reviews.Author: MoSwUsa
Reviews.Content: The superlatives are too numerous....the best way to put it is that in any future travels to Chicago, I would not want to stay anyplace but the Trump. It is first class all the way from location to staff, rooms, and cleanliness. Absolutely, I would recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience I've ever had.”
Reviews.Author: IowaVacationer2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trump Hotel in Chicago last weekend. The trip was a girls-only weekend to celebrate our 40th birthdays. The hotel exceeded my expectations, which were already high. It was an incredible experience. We booked the Grand Deluxe River View Suite (Unit 32) and were thrilled to get a room on the 27th floor (top floor of the hotel section of the building). The photos on the website do not do this suite justice. The overall effect of the high ceilings, huge space, floor-to-ceiling windows and incredible view was just stunning. When we first came into the room, we all ran around like a bunch of excited six-year-olds...checking out the bedroom, bathrooms, kitchen, etc. And just a few minutes after we checked in, we received a lovely "happy birthday" cake...very nice touch. Every part of the hotel was extremely clean, the staff was friendly (not the least bit condescending) and we loved the Terrace bar. (Just remember that you're paying for the view as well...the drinks are pricey.) There's no doubt that this is an expensive hotel, but if you want an "experience" vs. just a "room," it's worth it. In fact, I'm checking out our travel budget already to see if my husband & I can come back in December.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the splurge! Luxury redefined!”
Reviews.Author: DebandBill
Reviews.Content: Not sure if it was the wall to wall windows with not one but two sets of drapes on electronic controls, the spectacular view, the television embedded in the bathroom mirror, the espresso machine, or the kitchen appliances but the WOW! factor was huge. We were still discovering features as we checked the drawers and closets on departure - all the little things that you don't know you need until you really do - clothes brushes, slippers, martini shaker, tape, scissors, staple remover - the list goes on! Just go and enjoy the luxury. The room was spacious, the amentities superb, and the service gracious. The restaurant on the 16th floor has an incredible view, good food, and personable staff. Probably the most expensive breakfast we have ever had (maybe topped by the Imperial Hotel in Tokyo) but we created a memory! Yes, it is expensive but The Trump sets the standard.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: powercarsearch
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful view - paid extra for the river view and it was worth it. Enjoyed the cappucinno machine each morning. Very clean. Nightly turndown with slippers, robes, bottle of water and glass on the nightstand, music playing, aquarium scene on the TV when you arrive back after a long day on the town. Very large room. High ceilings make it feel even bigger. Will stay here again. Valet even had 2 bottles of water for us when we departed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: whitfang
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for shopping and sightseeing and decided impulsively to stay overnight. Other places were booked full but found a suite at Trump Tower (about $700) for a King bed and pull out sofa bed. Lots of things about this hotel will make you giggle - they send up a plate of complimentary truffles, they have a pillow menu with varieties of complimentary pillows (soft, hard, body, scented), a water menu with exotic types of waters, full stocked liquor in fridge, great view of river, city had fireworks (only on Thurs & Sat?). Lots of extra charges but you should try it once to splurge! Really, the only big annoyance was street noise - motorcycles and ambulances. And they could have had an outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Location and View”
Reviews.Author: J_and_A_1
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it is the new luxury property in town and overall we were pleased with our choice. Like many hotels in Chicago, the hotel is split up with a small lobby at ground level, restaurant and spa on 12 and 14, with rooms above these floors. This arrangement may bother some guests as the hotel has no real center or focal area, but this set up is a matter of personal taste. For us it was not really a problem. However, the lobby is small and the front desk was too close to the elevator lobby. The weekend we were at the hotel, it was very busy and getting around the front desk line was annoying and not what you want to see at a nice hotel. Compounding the problem was one of the three elevators to the guest rooms, spa, restaurant, and ballrooms was not working during most of our stay. Even with all three working, expect to wait sometimes. Our room was number 2304 and we would highly recommended the 04 line if you can get it. The view from this room was outstanding with the Wrigley building clock tower to the left, a straight on view out to the lake with no buildings in the way, and a great view of the Chicago River, as it bends right in front of you. All can be seen through floor to ceiling, wall to wall windows. The room was just over 900 square feet, including a long hallway. It is set up as a studio with a full kitchen that is really part of the bedroom. The overall look of the room is elegant and modern with muted colors. The large marble bathroom is very nice with separate shower and tub but no separate water closet. The TV in the bathroom mirror is very cool. There is a very nice large pool with a wall of windows overlooking the city and water. The gym also has great views and is a true gym so that a complete workout can be achieved. The locker room was very nice with steam and sauna but we felt it looked more like the locker room at a nice gym than at a five star hotel. We did not eat at the hotel, but there is a very cool looking restaurant and a nice outdoor bar area with a great view of the water and the city skyline. The location of the hotel is perfect. The loop area is just over the river, and the magnificent mile starts one block away. You are basically right in the middle of the main part of the city with almost every tourist site within walking distance. Overall this hotel is a good choice in a city with many great hotels. The hotel layout and design is a little quirky, the service was a little stretched the weekend we were there, but the large rooms, great views, and central location, make up for a few short comings.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fantastic. WOW”
Reviews.Author: copygirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trump a year ago and was fairly unimpressed- the staff at the time seemed to be still "getting it together". WOW - what a difference a year makes. This stay was perfect! Jamie, the bellman, was outstanding. I did not like the original room we were assigned - nothing wrong with it - i just did not like the layout. Jamie called the front desk, got room numbers of three other rooms. He showed us the rooms, arranged for our luggage to be moved and brought us new keys. The in-room dining staff was great. My daughter has a severe peanut allergy and the in-room staff was excellent in removing all of the mini bar items - many of which contain nuts. The suite was wonderful - we had a lot of room for my husband, daughter and i to read and relax. Because we had a kitchen we were able to make breakfast in the suite and not eat out. Having a child with a food allergy makes it difficult to eat out and this room was perfect for us. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chicago. The location is great - we walked everywhere - Michigan Avenue, the Art Institute, Millennium Park, the old Marshall Fields store. It was a great get away weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mare336
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Trump Hotel in Chicago with a girlfriend for a couple days of shopping. The Trump Hotel was terrific and location couldn't be better. The staff was welcoming and made an effort to make us feel comfortable. The room was large and the kitchen was a nice touch although not used. The robes were wonderful and the beds comfortable. The only complaint was we had a dirty glass (not used by us) sitting on the kitchen counter during our entire stay. I am not sure why the housekeeping staff didn't notice it. We thought we were the only guests in the hotel as it was so quiet. We never heard a door close or any voices. Such a pleasure! We had a city view not overlooking the river that we had wanted but it didn't matter much. All in all, a great stay and would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: sparkythedog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our seventeen year old son and his friend, stayed in two rooms at the Trump Hotel during the Lollapalooza Festival. My husband loved the place. He says the building is magnificent. How can anyone find fault with this hotel? Everyone was so kind and helpful. No air of pretentiousness whatsoever. I especially loved the Nespresso machine. It is delicious with cream and a little more water. I am going to buy one when I get home. My little 7 lb. chihuahua/yorkie was greeted warmly whenever he peeked out of his carrier. The bathrobes are warm and cozy. I think Ivanka Trump's TV greeting was sweet and sincere. All I can say is that I have never been to such a great place at such a resonable price. Chicago is a cool city and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: cpro330
Reviews.Content: just got back from trump chicago- loved the room, booked on expedia, tv in bathroom, comfy bed, and huge room. Hated bathroom toilet, problem with flushing handle, my friends in another room had same jiggling problem. did not love hotel staff at check in- thought she was rude, and long waits for concierge, who often was less then helpful. also, how is it possible that the largest hotel in the city only had one uni-sex restroom in the lobby? Ridiculous. thought the bellman and outside staff great. all in all, loved my room, fitness room great, and would definitely recommend .

Reviews.Title: “Donald got it right!”
Reviews.Author: kodysmama
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 2 teenage boys and myself stayed for 3 nights in July at the Trump Hotel. I looked at almost every hotel available in Chicago before deciding on The Trump. I wanted a memorable time with our family as this was our last trip together before our son leaves for college. I selected the Trump because of it's location, completely non-smoking policy and why not....it looks great on their website! What a fabulous choice... We loved it! We got upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite which allowed us to completely spread out. Amazingly beautiful room.... large bedroom with the most comfortable king bed, living room with tall windows allowing for great views, 2 bathrooms, complete kitchen with big refrigerator.....unbelievable. We took in everything the hotel has to offer. We ate at Sixteen every morning for breakfast. Perhaps it is a little pricy but not that bad. The food was good, service was excellent and the views from this16th floor restaurant were spectacular. We went to the fitness center a couple of times. Top-notch! It was a pleasure to work out with such nice amenities everywhere....individual tv screens on new cardio equipment, bottles of Trump water available, clean and bright room, lots of weight machines, and the views! We also went to the new outside Terrace Restaurant/Bar on the 16th floor. It was a beautiful night and we were lucky enough to get a table. The views of the Chicago River, Wrigley clock and Chicago buildings lit up at night were beautiful. Very memorable! During our stay, we walked everywhere....up and down Michigan Avenue, along the river, to the lakefront.....the hotel location is ideal. We took the Wendell boat ride which we would highly recommend and we went looking for the best pizza (thin crust). By the way, our vote goes to Ginos over Guiordanos! Overall, we loved staying at The Trump Hotel and we had a fantastic time in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property a few service gaffs.”
Reviews.Author: PDXStocks
